sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: Gamtaa Awurooppaa/ Naannoo Diinagdee Awurooppaa fi yuunaayitid kiingidam keessatti ida’amni vaayirasii koroonaa (COVID-19) saffisaan dabaluun amajjii 1 hanga Bitootessa 15, 2020tti.
en-mt: The number of cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) in the European Union/ European Economic Area and the United Kingdom increased rapidly from 1 March to 15 February

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: Taateen waliigala dhukkuba vaayirasii koroonaa (COVID-19) biyyoota Gamtaa Awurooppaa/ Naannawa Diinagdee Awurooppaa fi Yuunaayitid Kiingidam adeemsa walfakkaataa agarsiisaa jiru, sadarkaa garagaraatti biyyoota irratti kan hundaa’u ta’us, COVID-19 biyyoota hundatti saffisaan dabalaa jira.
en-mt: The overall incidence of coronavirus (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom is showing similar trends, although to varying degrees depending on the country, COVID-19 is increasing rapidly in all countries.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: Muuxannoo Itaalii irraa argame irratti hundaa’uun, biyyoonnii, hospitaalonnii fi jiddugalli yaala fayyaa addaa qophaa’ummaa isaanii ol guddisuun dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 yaala barbaadaniif, fi addatti kanneen yaala addaa barbaadaniif ooluu qabu.
en-mt: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and specialist health centers should increase their preparedness for COVID-19 patients in need of treatment, and especially those in need of specialized treatment.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Muddee 31, 2019 irratti, dhukkubsataa gosa niimooniyaa qorannoon hin beekamne Wuhaan, kutaa Hubei, Chaayinaa irraa gabaafame.
en-mt: On December 31, 2019, an unknown case of pneumonia was reported from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Amajjii 9, 2020, Giddugalli Ittisaa fi Too’annoo Fayyaa Chaayinaa akka gabaasetti qaamni vaayirasii haaraa koroonaa fidu amma akka severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2)’tti ibsama.
en-mt: On March 9, 2020, the Chinese Centers for Health Prevention and Control reported that the causative agent of the new coronavirus is now described as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Ergasii, dhukkubni SARS-CoV-2’n hubamuu irraa dhufu dhukkuba vaayirasii koroonaa (COVID-19) jedhamee moggaafame.
en-mt: Since then, the disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named the coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: Akka ragaan yerootti qaamota COVID-19 qabaman keessaa 80% dhibee salphaa qabaatu, kana jechuun, dhukkubsachuun qaama hargansuu niimooniyaa qabaatus dhabaatus,hedduun isaanii ni dandamatu.
en-mt: According to current data, 80% of those infected with COVID-19 have mild illness, which means that, whether the respiratory illness is pneumonia or not, many recover.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: Dhimmoota ca 14% keessatti, COVID-19 gara dhukkuba daran hammaataa kan hospitaala seensisuu barbaadutti dagaaga dhimmooti 6% hafan immoo dhukkuba jabaa kunuunsa cimaa barbaadan keessummeessu.
en-mt: In ca 14% of cases, COVID-19 develops into a more serious illness requiring hospitalization and the remaining 6% of cases host severe illness requiring intensive care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: Hammi du’aa dhukkubsattoota sababa COVID-19 hospitaala galanii ca 4% dha.
en-mt: The mortality rate of patients hospitalized for COVID-19 is ca 4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Qorannoo kana keessatti, taatee waliigala COVID-19 kan biyyoota (EU/EEA) fi (UK) qoranneeti kan Chaayinaa, kutaa Hubii wajjiin walmadaalchifne.
en-mt: In this study, we examined the overall incidence of COVID-19 in (EU/EEA) and (UK) countries and compared it with that of China, Hubei province.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: Ammas dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 EU/EEA fi UK isa Itaalii gaafa amajjii 31- bitootessa 15, 2020 wajjiin wal madaalchifna.
en-mt: We will again compare the EU/EEA and UK COVID-19 patients with the Italian one from March 31- February 15,

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Dhimmoota COVID-19 biyyoota EU/EEA fi UK keessatti
en-mt: COVID-19 issues in the EU/EEA and UK

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: Chaayinaatti aanee, COVID-19 faffaca’insa ji’oogiraafikaawaa caalaa adeemsiseera akkasumas humni cimaa weerara COVID-19 biyyoota addunyaa hafanii yeroo ammaa kan biyya kanaa hordofa.
en-mt: Next to China, COVID-19 has undergone more geographical spread and the strongest force of the COVID-19 outbreak in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: Bitootessa 11, 2020tti hogganaa olaanaan dhaabbata fayyaa addunyaa (WHO) COVID-19’n weerara addunyaa ta’uu labse.
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) chief declared COVID-19 a global pandemic.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: Bitootessa 5 keessa dhimmi yuuroosarveelaansii 2020, ispiiter iit aal. Akkaataa hiikaa dhukkubsataa Dhaabbata Fayyaa Addunyaatti dhukkubsataan COVID-19 jalqabaa Awurooppaa gabaafame.
en-mt: On February 5, the Eurosurveillance 2020 issue, Spieter et al. The first COVID-19 case in Europe has been reported according to the World Health Organization's patient definition.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: EU/EEA keessatti, dhimmoonni mirkanaa’an sadan jalqabaa Amajji 24, 2020 tti namoota Wuhaan, Konyaawwan Hubei, Chaayinaatii deebi’an keessatti Faransaayiin gabaafaman.
en-mt: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported in France on March 24, 2020 in people returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: Akka Bitootessa 15, 2020 tti, dhimmootni COVID-19 biyyoota EU/EEA 30’n hundumaa fi UK keessatti adda baafamaniiru, Mudde 31, 2019 fi guyyaa sana dabalatee gidduu, dhimmoota 39,768 fi du’a 1,727 gabaafamaniiru, Xaaliyaan qofaa irraa dhimmoota 17,750 fi du’a 1,441 waliin.
en-mt: As of February 15, 2020, COVID-19 cases have been identified in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the UK, between December 31, 2019 and that date inclusive, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths have been reported, with 17,750 cases and with 1,441 deaths.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: Ida’ama lakkoofsaa fi ida’ama taatee dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 fudhataa jira
en-mt: It is taking the number of cases and the incidence of COVID-19 cases

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: Jiddugala Ittisaa fi Too’annoo Dhibee Awurooppaa (ECDC)’tti, dhukkubsattoonni COVID-19 guutuu addunyaatti lakkaa’aman, kan madda seera qabeessa kanneen akka ‘ Ministeera Fayyaa, abbootii taayitaa fayyaa naannoo fi biyyaa akkasumas Dhaabbata Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO), guyyaa hunda sa’aatii 8:00 a.m’tti ibsama.
en-mt: At the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), COVID-19 cases are counted worldwide, from legitimate sources such as ' the Ministry of Health, regional and national health authorities as well as the World Health Organization (WHO), every day it will be lit at 8:00 a.m.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: Odeeffannoo kun adeemsa COVID-19 EU/EEA fi UK tilmaamuuf oole, fi sanas Itaalii wajjiin walmadaalchisuuf.
en-mt: This information was used to estimate the COVID-19 process in the EU/EEA and UK, and to compare that with Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Walfakkeenya dhukkubsattoota COVID-19’tti, waliigala dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 guyyaa-14 gabaabbate herreegne, kanaafuu madda uumamaa COVID-19 yaada keessa galchuun, tokkoo tokkoo biyyoota EU/EEA fi UK, yerooo amajjii 1–bitootessa 15, 2020 .
en-mt: For the COVID-19 cases similarity, we calculated the total COVID-19 cases shortened by day-14, so taking into account the natural source of COVID-19, for each EU/EEA and UK countries, for the period March 1–February 15,

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Akka bitootessa 15, 2020 8:00 a.m. itti ida’ama lakkoofsa dhukkubsattoota adda bahanii kan Itaalii yeroo amajjii 31- bitootessa 15, 2020tiin wal bira qabuun dhiheessine.
en-mt: As of February 15, 2020 8:00 am we compared the sum of the number of isolated cases in Italy for the period March 31- February 15,

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Kallattiiwwan waliigalaa COVID-19 biyyoota EU/EEA fi UK keessatti
en-mt: Overall directions for COVID-19 in the EU/EEA and UK

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: Adeemsi guyyaa 14 taatee waliigala dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 biyyoota EU/EEA fi UK gabaabse waliigalatti kan (Chaayinaa) kutaa Hubei hordofeeti (fakkii 1).
en-mt: The 14-day trend of total COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA and UK shortened followed that of (China's) Hubei province (Figure 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: EU/EEA fi UK waliigalaatiif, ida’amni taatee COVID-19 Gurraandhala 21 dabaluu eegale fi Gurraandhala 28, 2020 hedduu dabale (meeshaa dabalataa).
en-mt: For the EU/EEA and UK as a whole, the combined incidence of COVID-19 started to increase on 21 November and increased significantly on 28 November 2020 (additional material).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Kun hundi baay’ina dhukkubsataa Itaaliitti saffisaan dabalaa jiruutiin oofama, garuu biyyoonni EU/EEA fi UK dabalatee taateewwan COVID-19 bifa walfakkaataan dabalaa jiru (Meeshaa dabalataa).
en-mt: All this is driven by the rapidly increasing number of cases in Italy, but countries including the EU/EEA and the UK are experiencing similar increases in COVID-19 cases (Appendix).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Fakkiin 2 ida’ama lakkoofsa dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 kan biyyoota EU/EEA fi UK isa Itaalii wajjiin wal bira qabame kan yeroo amajjii 31 - bitootessa 15, 2020 agarsiisa.
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the combined number of COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA and UK compared to Italy for the period March 31 - February 15,

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: Akka ibsa bitootessa 15 8:00 a.m. itti, biyyoonni biro EU/EEA 15 fi UK baay’ina dhukkubsattoota Itaalidhaan walmadaalu yeroo torban 3 hin hanqanne keessatti gabaase.
en-mt: According to a statement on February 15 at 8:00 am, 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK reported cases comparable to Italy in less than 3 weeks.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Akka ragaan keenya agarsiisutti baay’inni dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 EU/EEA fi UK’tti saffisaan dabalaa jira.
en-mt: Our data show that the number of COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA and UK is increasing rapidly.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: Kallattiiwwan waliigalaa mudannoo COVID-19 suuta dabalaa adeemu keessatti ilaalaman weerarri addunyaawaa saffisa walfakkaataan biyyoota hunda keessatti itti fufaa jiraachuu isaa yaada dhiyeesse.
en-mt: The overall trends in the slowly increasing COVID-19 outbreak suggested that the global outbreak is continuing at the same pace in all countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: Kun biyyoonni sadarkaa garaagaraa irra jiratanis, garaagarummaan deebii fayyaa hawaasaa biyyaalessaa, fi dhukkubsataadhaaf hiika garaagaraa kennu akkasumas dhukkubsataa COVID-19’f qoratame adda baasuuf adeemsa garagaraa, qorannaa irra keessoos dabalata.
en-mt: This includes countries at different levels, differences in national public health responses, and different interpretations of the patient as well as different processes for identifying a patient tested for COVID-19, rather than internal testing.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: Jalqaba bitootessa 2020, doktoroonni Itaalii naannawa faalametti argaman haalicha akka ibsanitti dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 keessaa ca 10% yaala fayyaa addaa barbaadu akkasumas hospitaalonnii fi tajaajiloonni fayyaa addaa akka guutaman maddeen miidiyaa gabaasee jira.
en-mt: In early February 2020, Italian doctors in the affected areas described the situation as ca 10% of COVID-19 patients required specialized medical treatment and hospitals and specialized health services were filled, media sources reported.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: Odeeffannoon hospitaala keessatti argamuu dhukkubsataa COVID-19 fi/yookaan yaalli addaa yeroo ammaa kana sadarkaa EU/EEA dhukkubsattoota 6% fi 1% qofa, wal duraa duubaan argama (odeeffannoon hin agarsiifamne).
en-mt: Information on COVID-19 patient hospitalization and/or special treatment is currently available at the EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% of patients, respectively (data not shown).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: Isaan, ta’us, karaa sirnaawaa ta’een to’annoo deetaa yeroo ammaa kan lakkoofsa dhimmoota gabaafamaniifi lakkoofsa du’aa irratti xiyyeeffatu hawwataa gochuuf sassabamuu qabu.
en-mt: They should, nevertheless, be collected in a systematic way to make up-to-date data controls that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths interesting.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: Qorannoon bara 2010–11 gaggeeffame kan mul’ise dhiheessi yaala fayyaa addaa fi yaala fayyaa saffisaa Awurooppaatti garaagarummaa qabaachuu, Jarmanitti namoota 100,000 siree 29.2 hanga 4.2 gidduutti argama.
en-mt: The 2010–11 survey revealed variation in the provision of specialized medical care and acute medical care in Europe, ranging from 29.2 to 4.2 beds per 100,000 people in Germany.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: Kana jechuun biyyoonni Itaalii caalaa qabeenya (yaala fayyaa addaa 12.5 fi iddoo ciisicha hatattamaa baay’ina ummataa 100,000’f bara 2010-11) qabaachuu danda’u jechuudha.
en-mt: This means that countries may have more resources than Italy (12.5 specialized health care and emergency bed spaces per 100,000 population in 2010-11).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: Barreeffama fakkeenyummaa tasgabbii humna yaala fayyaa wajjiin walitti dhihaatu, tilmaama tokkoo tokkoo biyyoota EU/EEA fi UK’tiif walfakkeenya dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 umrii wajjiin walitti hidhata qaban hospitaala tursiifamaniif; balaan humna siree yaala addaa irra darbuu >90%, kan dhihaate sirreeffama ji’a jahaa ittisa balaa saffisaa COVID-19 irrattii ECDC keessatti.
en-mt: A simulation paper close to the stability of the medical capacity, estimates for each EU/EEA and UK country for the similarity of age-related COVID-19 patients hospitalized; risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity >90%, presented in the six-month adjustment to the COVID-19 emergency prevention at ECDC.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: Erga yerooo darbe dhukkubsattoonni biyyoota EU/EEA fi UK’tti naannoo ta’etti walitti qabamanii, akkasumas hospitaalaa fi yaalli fayyaa addaa yeroo hunda ummata naannichaa tajaajila, odeeffannoon waa’ee dhukkubsataa fi yaala addaa qaama daangaarratti istaatiksii 2 (NUTS-2)’tiif moggaafametti argama.
en-mt: Since in the past patients have been localized in EU/EEA and UK countries, and hospitals and specialist health care have always served the population of the region, information about patients and specialist treatment is for border statistics 2 (NUTS-2). is located at the named.

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Muuxannoon Itaalii irraa argamee fi wanti amma biyyoota biraatti deemaa jiru akka mul’isutti COVID-19 EU/EEA fi UK keessatti saffisaan dabalaa jira.
en-mt: Experience from Italy and what is now happening in other countries shows that COVID-19 is increasing rapidly in the EU/EEA and UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: Biyyoonni, hospitaalonni fi iddoon yaala fayyaa addaa dhukkuba SARS-CoV-2 saffisaan daddarbaa jiruuf of qopheessuu qabu akkasumas lakkoofsi namoota COVID-19 dhukkubsatanii dabaluun, fi addatti yaalli addaa, kan akka isa kutaalee Itaalii naannolee Itaaliitti ta’aa jiruu.
en-mt: Countries, hospitals and specialized health facilities must prepare for the rapidly spreading SARS-CoV-2 outbreak as well as the increasing number of COVID-19 cases, and especially specialized treatment, such as that taking place in parts of Italy in the Italian regions.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: Akka xiinxala dhiyeenyaa balaa saffisaa ECDC’n agarsiifameetti, itti dhiyeenyi saffisaa, waantonni akka ta’aniif dafee kakaasu akkasumas hunda galeessa ta’e faffaca’insa SARS-COV-2 duubatti hambisuuf barbaachisaadha, gocha waanta hamaa to’achuu irraa gara itti dhiyeenya fooyyessuutti jijjiiruu waliin, akka daballiin saffisaa lakkoofsa dhimmootaa eegamu murtee kennitootaafi hospitaalotaaf akka isaan sirriitti qalbifataniif, fudhataniif akkasumas deebii isaanii haala Kanaan madaqsuuf yoo dursee hojiirra hin oolle ta’e yeroo gahaa kennuu dhiisuu mala.
en-mt: As shown by ECDC's rapid risk proximity analysis, a swift approach, prompting things to happen quickly as well as comprehensive is needed to retard the spread of SARS-COV-2, from the action of containing the negative thing to improving the approach with changing, that the expected rapid increase in case numbers may not give decision makers and hospitals enough time to properly understand, accept and adapt their responses to this situation if not implemented in advance.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: Saffisaan balaa too’achuun miidhaa weerarichaa hir’isuuf madaala fayyaa hawaasaas tartiibessa.
en-mt: Rapid risk management also regulates the public health assessment to reduce the damage of the outbreak.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: Yeroo biyyoonni tatamsa’iinsa SARS-CoV-2 hir’isuudhaaf tattaaffii humna ittisaa isaanii dabalanii fi dhiibbaa yaala fayyaa hir’isanitti fooddaa carraa gabaabduutu jira.
en-mt: There is a short window of opportunity as countries increase their immune efforts and reduce the pressure on health care to reduce the spread of SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: Kun kufuun, sirni fayyaa biyyoota EU/EEA dhukkubsattoota yaala addaa barbaadan hedduu guyyoota yookaan torbanoota as deeman keessatti ni keessummeessu.
en-mt: This fall, the EU/EEA health systems will accommodate many patients in need of specialized treatment in the coming days or weeks.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: Weerarri Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2)’dhaan dhufu, kana dura namoota 3,000 ajjeese fi Chaayinaatti namoota 80,000 qabee akkasumas addunyaa iddoo hundatti, dhala namaatti balaa cimaa fidaa jira
en-mt: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has already killed 3,000 people and infected 80,000 in China and poses a serious threat to humanity everywhere in the world available

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: Vaayirasii walfakkaataa isaatiin kan walfakkaatu, SARS-CoV, kan bara 2003 namoota kumaatamaan SARS qabsiise, SARS-CoV-2 simbira halkanii irraa daddarbuu kan danda’uu fi karaa walfakkaataan mallattoo walfakkaataa mul’isuu kan danda’uudha.
en-mt: Similar to its cognate virus, SARS-CoV, which infected thousands of people with SARS in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 can be transmitted from nocturnal birds and can exhibit similar symptoms in a similar way.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: Ta’us, COVID-19 hammeenyaafi hamma du’aa SARS irra gadi aanaa qaba garuu baay’ee kan daddarbuufi dargaggoo irra maanguddoo akkasumas dubartoota caalaa dhiirota irra dhiibbaa geessisa.
en-mt: However, COVID-19 has a lower severity and mortality rate than SARS but is more contagious and affects older people than young people and men more than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: Dhukkuba mul’ataa jiru irratti maxxansoota saffisaan lakkoofsaan dabalaa jiraniif deebii kennuuf, barreeffamni kun keeddeebii gosa barnootaa saffisaan dagaagaa jiru yeroonfi hunda galeessa ta’e dhiyeessuuf yaala.
en-mt: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on emerging disease, this paper attempts to provide an up-to-date and comprehensive review of a rapidly developing discipline.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: Nuti waa’ee epidoomolojii, itiyoolojii, vaayiroolojii, qorannaa mallattoo, yaala, qorannaa dhibee, fi ittisa dhibee irratti wantoota jalqabaa ni haguugna.
en-mt: We cover the basics of epidemiology, etiology, virology, symptom testing, treatment, diagnosis, and prevention.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: Gaaffiiwwan baay’een ammayyuu deebiiwwan kan barbaadan ta’anis, keeddeebiin kun hubannaafi dhabamsiisa dhukkuba sodaachisaa hubachuuf ni gargaara jennee abdanna.
en-mt: Although many questions still need answers, we hope that this review will help us understand and eradicate this dreaded disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: Feestivaalli arfaasaa amajjii 25, 2020 Chaayinootaaf guyyaa ayyaanaa hunda torbanoota hedduu sababa weerara dhibee vaayirasii haaraatiif manatti dabarsan ayyaana yaadannoo jalqabaa fi hin dagatamne ta’eefi.
en-mt: The Spring Festival on March 25, 2020 is the first and most memorable holiday for the Chinese who have spent weeks at home every holiday due to the outbreak of a new virus.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: Vaayirasichi weerrara vaayirasii koroonaa (CoV) kan bara 2003 severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) geessise; kanaafuu, SARS-CoV-2 jedhamee dhaabbata fayyaa addunyaatiin gurraandhala 11, 2020 moggaafame, akkasumas dhukkuboonni kanatti dhihaatan CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19) jedhamanii moggaafaman.
en-mt: The virus led to the 2003 severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) outbreak of coronavirus (CoV); therefore, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization on January 11, 2020, and the diseases close to it were named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: Weerarichi kan eegale Chaayinaa Wuhaanitti, fi saffisaan guutuu biyyaatti tatamsa’e akkasumas biyyoota addunyaa 50tti dhihaatan keessatti babal’ate.
en-mt: The outbreak began in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread across the country and spread to nearly 50 countries around the world.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: Akka Bitootessa 2, 2020 tti, vaayirasichi dhimmoota COVID-19 mirkanaa’an 80,000 ol keessatti argameera, dhukkubsattoota 40,000 ol kan hospitaalaa fayyanii ba’aniifi dhukkubsattoota 3,000 kan du’an waliin.
en-mt: As of February 2, 2020, the virus has been detected in more than 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 hospital discharges and 3,000 deaths.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: COVID-19’n “diina ummataa lakk 1” fi shororkeessummaa caala humna qabeessaa akka ta’e Dhaabbanni Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO) akeekkachiise.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that COVID-19 is “the No. 1 enemy of the people” and more powerful than terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: Akka PubMed’tti (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/)’tti, yeroo ji’oota lama hin caalletti, waraqaawwan 200 ol COVID-19 irratti hojjatame qo’annaa vaayirasii, qo’annaa weeraraa, qorannaa madda dhibee, yaala, fi waldhaansas of keeessatti qabu guyyaa gabaasa jalqabaa amajjii 7, 2020 vaayirasichi dhukkubsattoota heddu irraa adda bahetti irraa eegale gaggeeffame.
en-mt: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, more than 200 papers have been done on COVID-19 in viral studies, epidemic studies , a study that includes etiology, treatment, and treatment was conducted since the first reported date of March 7, 2020, when the virus was isolated from several patients.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: Keeddeebiin kun waan qorannichi irra ga’e gosa barnootaa haaraafi ariitin dagaagaa jiruun goolabuuf yaala.
en-mt: This review attempts to conclude the findings of the study with a new and rapidly developing subject.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: Yeroo danda’ametti, COVID-19 SARS fi dhukkuboota CoV’n dhufan, Middle East respiratory syndrome (weerara MERS bara 2012 keessa ture) wajjiin walmadaalchisuuf ni yaalla
en-mt: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and CoV-induced diseases, Middle East respiratory syndrome (the MERS outbreak in 2012).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: Nuyi wantoota hamma ammaatti waan ittisaafi adeemsa dhukkubichaa ilaalchisee baranne akkasumas gaaffiiwwan hafan muraasa garuu barbaachisoo ta’an irratti ni mari’anna.
en-mt: We will discuss what we have learned so far about the prevention and course of the disease as well as a few but important remaining questions.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: CoVs’n akka aadaatti kan nama ajjeesu akka hin taanetti fudhatama, caalmaatti qufaa 4 kan 15% dhihaatu fida.
en-mt: CoVs are traditionally considered non-fatal, most commonly causing 4 coughs in nearly 15%.

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: Ta’us, jaarraa kana keessatti, si’a lama waantoonni dhukkuba fidan CoVwwan kan ilmaan namaa nu quunnamaniiru, sunis, SARS-CoV fi MERS-CoV, kan jalqabbii weeraraa jalqaba Chaayinaa keessa 2003 tti fi Saawud Arabiyaa keessa 2012 tti geessise, walduraa duubaan, akkasumas battaluma biyyoota baay’ee kan biroo keessatti dhukkubaafi du’a rifachiisaa waliin faffaca’e.
en-mt: Yet, twice in this century, we have been exposed to human pathogens, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which led to the onset of the outbreak first in China in 2003 and in Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively , and immediately spread to a number of other countries with shocking morbidity and mortality.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: Kanaafuu, COVID-19’n ammaa kun weerara CoV isa sadaffaa ta’ee seenaa dhala namaa keessatti galmaa’e.
en-mt: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in human history.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: Akka Fakkii. Fakkii.1,1keessatti agarsiifameetti, gujjiiwwan michii sombaa madda hin beekamne qaban jalqaba Wuhaan irraa Mudde 31, 2019 tti gara Koomishinii Fayyaa Biyyoolessaa Chaayiinaatti (China National Health Commission) gabaafaman.
en-mt: Like the Figure. As shown in Figure.1,1, pneumonia cases of unknown origin were first reported to the China National Health Commission on December 31, 2019 from Wuhan.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: Turtii guyyaa torbaa booda adeemsi CoV gad lakkifame.
en-mt: After a seven-day stay, the CoV process was released.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: Amajjii 15, 2020 namni jalqaba Wuhaan irraa du’e gabaafame.
en-mt: On March 15, 2020, the first death from Wuhan was reported.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: Hangasitti, weerarichi saffisaan magaalota, konyaawwwaniifi biyyoota ollaatti faffaca’e.
en-mt: Meanwhile, the outbreak quickly spread to cities, counties, and neighboring countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: Amajji 20 tti, hubamuun dhiyeessitoota kunuunsa fayyaa, daddarbiinsi namaa gara namaatti danda’amuusaa yaada dhiyeessuun gabaafameera.
en-mt: On March 20, awareness among health care providers suggested that human-to-human transmission was possible.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: Amajjii 23tti, magaalaan Wuhaan geejjiba ummataas dabalatee cufamte.
en-mt: On March 23, Wuhan was closed to public transportation.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: Amajji 24 tti qu’annoon kilinikaawaa jalqabaa dhukkubicha irrattii, dhukkubsattoota dhimmoota mirkanaa’an waliinii 41 keessaa, 21 qofaatu gabaa qurxummii galaanaa wuhaan kan iddoo jalqabbii dhukkubichaa bineensa maddi isaa hin beekamne irraa jedhamee yaadamu waliin quunnamtii kallattii qabu jechuun gabaase.
en-mt: On March 24, the first clinical study of the disease reported that of the 41 joint confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with an animal thought to be of unknown origin at the Wuhan seafood market, the site of the outbreak.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: Amajjii 30tti, dhaabbanni fayyaa addunyaa weeraricha muddama fayyaa addunyaa jedhee labse.
en-mt: On March 30, the World Health Organization declared the outbreak a global health crisis.

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: Yeroo gabaasa kanaatti, dhukkubichi Chaayinaa fi biyyoota addunyaa 50’tti siqan keessa tatamsa’ee jira (gabatee. ​(gabatee.2).2).
en-mt: At the time of this report, the disease has spread to China and nearly 50 countries around the world (Table 2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: Akkuma haalichi saffisaan mul’achaa deemeen, bal’inni xumuraa fi hammeenyi dhibee rifaasisaa kan tilmaamamu ta’a.
en-mt: As the situation unfolds rapidly, the final extent and severity of panic disorder will become predictable.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: Gurraandhala 11, 2020 tti, qu’annoon waan-wiirtuu-baay’ee dhukkubsattoota 8,866 irratti dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 mirkanaa’an 4,021 dabalatee ibsa weerarichaa haareffame akka armaan gadiitti dhiyeesseera (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
en-mt: As of January 11, 2020, the multi-center study of 8,866 patients, including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients, provided an updated outbreak description as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/ UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 namoota umrii kamuu kan miidhu ta’us, garuu caalaatti kanneen umrii 30-65 jidduutti argaman huba.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV-2 affects people of any age, it mostly affects those between the ages of 30-6

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: Namoota dhukkubichaan qabaman keessaa hanga walakkaa (47.7%) kan ta’an waggaa 50 oli, baay’ee muraasni 20 gadi, akkasumas namoota dhukkubsatan 14 qofatu umrii 10 gadi.
en-mt: Up to half (47.7%) of cases were over 50 years of age, very few were under 20, and only 14 cases were under 10 years of age.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 dhiirota (0.31/100,000) dubartoota (0.27/100,000) caala qabe.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 caalmaan garee fi naannoo Hubiitti kan tatamsa’eedha.
en-mt: COVID-19 is mostly spreading in the group and in the Hubi region.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 erga qoratamuu eegalee booda jiddugaleessaan guyyaa 5 (2-9) fudhate.
en-mt: It took an average of 5 (2-9) days after testing for COVID-1

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: Yeroon cal’isaa jiddugaleessaa guyyoota 4.8 (3.0-7.2) ti.
en-mt: The median quiescence period is 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: Yeroon jiddugaleessaa qabamuurraa hanga du’aatti jru guyyoota 9.5 (4.8-13) ture.
en-mt: The median time from infection to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
targetString: Lakkoofsi hormaataa (R0) bu’uraa ture 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), fi R0n sirreeffame immoo 2.23-4.82 ture.
en-mt: The baseline reproductive coefficient (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: Lakkoofsi namoota dhukkubaan qabamanii amajjii 23, 2020 duraa, yeroo imala guddaa ayyaana arfaasaa Chaayinaa wajjiin kan wal simate.
en-mt: The number of cases before March 23, 2020, coincided with the Chinese Spring Festival.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
targetString: Namoota dhukkubsatanii adda baafaman keessaa kanneen du’an 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), fi dhukkubsattoota hunda keessaa kan du’an 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%) turan.
en-mt: The mortality rate among diagnosed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the mortality rate among all patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: COVID-19’f haal-dureewwan balaa gurguddoon sadan saala (dhiira), umurii (≥60), akkasumas michii sombaa hammaataadha.
en-mt: The three main risk factors for COVID-19 are gender (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoVwwan damee maatii vaayirasoota gurguddoofi haguuggii qaban kan kajiisa baaqqee kan RNA adda baastuu of keessatti qabataniiti.
en-mt: CoVs are a branch of the family of large, enveloped viruses that contain RNA identifiers.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: Isaan jeneeraa afuritti qoodamuu danda’u, sunis, alfaa, beettaa, gaammaa, fi deeltaa, isaan keessaa alfaa- fi beettaa- CoVwwan tu namoota hubuun isaanii beekame.
en-mt: They can be divided into four genera, namely, alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: Envelope spike (S) gilaaykoopirootiniin siribduuwwan seelii isaa angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) fi dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), SARS-CoV’f fi MERS-CoV’f, walduraa duubaan, waliin walitti hidhata fi isa booda walitti maxxanuun meembireenii uumama.
en-mt: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and subsequent membrane adhesion is formed . . . .

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: Jiiniin vaayirasii RNA saayitoopilaazimii keessatti kan gadi lakkifamu; jiiniin vaayirasii erga wal baay’ise booda, RNA’n jiinii gilaaykoopirotiinii haguugamaa wajjiin deema akkasumas pirotiiniin niwuukilookaapsiid afuuffee tuuta vaayirasii hamate uumata, booda membireenii pilaazmaa wajjiin walitti baquun vayyirasicha gadi dhiisa.
en-mt: RNA viral genes are secreted in the cytoplasm; After the viral gene replicates, the RNA goes with the enveloped glycoprotein gene and the nucleocapsid protein blows to form a worse viral cluster, which then fuses with the plasma membrane and releases the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: Tartiibni jiinoomii SARS-CoV-2 jalqabaa amajjii 10, 2020 gabaafame.
en-mt: The first SARS-CoV-2 genome sequence was reported on March 10,

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: Sumuudota bakka argamaa irraa fudhataman 10 keessaa SARS-CoV-2 adda bahiinsa jeenetikiitii 99.98%’tiin beta-CoV haaraa ta’ee argame. Gabaa Nyaata Galaanaa Huunan Wuhaan keessaa.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 was identified as a new beta-CoV with 99.98% genetic identity from 10 samples taken from the site. Hunan Seafood Market in Wuhan.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 SARS-CoV caalaa MERS-CoV’n wal fakkaata.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is more similar to MERS-CoV than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: Karaa maaykirooskooppii dabarsa elektirookiitiin qaamonni xixiqqoon SARS-CoV-2 ipiteeliyeemii daandii qilleensa namaa xixiqqoo ta’an keessatti argame.
en-mt: Through electron transmission microscopy, small particles of SARS-CoV-2 were detected in tiny human airway epithelium.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: ACE2’n namaa SARS-CoV-2’f akkasumas SARS-CoV’f siribduu ta’uun isaa argameera.
en-mt: Human ACE2 has been found to be a sleeper for SARS-CoV-2 as well as for SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ta’us, pirootiniin S kan SARS-CoV-2 kan SARS-CoV caalaatti haala dadhabaan ACE2 namaa waliin walitti hidhata, kan dhugaa SARS-CoV-2’n SARS-CoV irra dhukkubsattoota keessatti hubamuu hamaa xiqqaa fiduu waliin kan tokko ta’e.
en-mt: Yet, the S protein of SARS-CoV binds more weakly to human ACE2, consistent with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes fewer adverse reactions in patients than SARS-CoV . . . .

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 dabalataan pirootinii haaraa gabaabaa orf3b’n haguugame fi pirootinii oomishame orf8’n kan uwwifame hojjechuu danda’a.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is additionally able to make a new short protein capped by orf3b and a manufactured protein capped by orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: orf3b SARS-CoV-2 dhukkubbii vaayirasiin dhufuuf ga’ee taphachuu fi mallattoo IFNβ mul’isuu mala; garuu, orf8’n mandhee tajaajilaa beekamu hin qabaatu.
en-mt: orf3b SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in virus-induced pain and reveal IFNβ signaling; however, orf8 will not have a known service layer.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: Gurraandhala 18, 2020, Zhuu, eet aal., boca cryo-EM ACE2 2.9 Å’tti kan dhala namaa guutuu baattuu amiinoo asidii B0AT1wajjiin walxaxe gabaase.
en-mt: On November 18, 2020, Zhuu, et al., reported a cryo-EM shape of ACE2 at 2.9 Å complexed with the fully human carrier amino acid B0AT1.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: Isaan walxaxichi, caasaalee banamoofi cufamoo kan qabu, akka dimer tti qindaa’ee ture akkasumas walxaxaan ACE2-B0AT1’n pirootinoota S lama walitti hidhuu danda’a, CoV’n adda baasuu fi dhukkubaan hubamuuf kan ragaa dhiyeessu ta’ee argatan.
en-mt: They found that the complex, with both open and closed structures, was arranged as a dimer and that the ACE2-B0AT1 complex could bind two S proteins, providing clues for CoV recognition and infectivity.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: B0AT1 dhukkuba SARS-CoV-2 dhaabuuf kan oolu qoricha calaluuf galma teeraaputiikii ta’uu danda’a.
en-mt: B0AT1 could be a therapeutic target for screening drugs to stop SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: Baattoo bu’uuraa fi giddu-deemaa
en-mt: Basic and intermediate carriers

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: SARS-CoV fi MERS-CoV simbiroota halkanii irraa kan dhufuu fi karaa wal duraa fi duubaan adurree fi gaalaan gara namaatti kan darbu ta’uun beekamaadha.
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV are known to come from nocturnal birds and be transmitted to humans via eagles and camels, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: Walbira qaba faayiloojeenik SARS-CoV-2 CoVs biraa wajjiin, simbirri halkanii akka baattoo SARS-CoV-2 hangafaatti akka vaayirasii haaraa 96% CoVs SARS fakkaatuu fi simbira halkanii bat-SL-CoVZX45 fi bat-SL-CoVZX21 jedhamtu irraa fudhatama.
en-mt: Phylogenetic comparisons of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, nocturnal fowl as the primary carrier of SARS-CoV-2 is considered as a new virus 96% SARS-like CoVs and nocturnal fowl bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, mandheen yeroo akkamii vaayirasiin sanyii garagaraa keessa jiru akkamitti nama akka qabu isa gargaare osoo hin beekamin hafe, akkasumas karaan daddarba isaa ammas ibsamuu qaba.
en-mt: However, the timing of how the virus in different races helped infect humans remains unknown, and the route of transmission remains to be elucidated.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji, et al., bofoota simbirroota halkanii irraa gara namaatti kan S pirootinii keessatti adeemsa kutaaleen DNA cabuun deebia’anii makaawwan alelootaa (alleles) haaraa oomishuuf deebi’anii walitti makaman walfakkaataa ta’e hirmaachise akka baattoo vaayirasichaatti dhiyeesse.
en-mt: Ji, et al., presented snakes from nocturnal birds to humans in which the S protein involved a similar process in which segments of DNA were broken and recombined to produce new mixtures of alleles as carriers of the virus.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Akka qu’annoo tokkootti, qorattoonni Guangzhou, Chaayinaa keessaa, pangoliinonni – huuruu dheeraa, hoosiftoota goondaa-nyaatan kan yeroo baay’ee qoricha aadaa Chaayinootaa keessatti faayidaarra oolan baattoo humna dhokataa giddu galeessaa SARS-CoV-2 akka ta’an homolojii sanyii 99% CoV keessatti Pangoliinotaafi SARS-CoV-2 keessatti argame irratti hundaa’uun yaada dhiyeessan.
en-mt: According to one study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, found that pangolins – long-nosed, gondola-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine – are carriers of moderate latent potency of SARS-CoV-2 with 99% species homology Based on the findings in Pangolins and SARS-CoV-2 in CoV, they proposed.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: Haaa ta’u malee, garaagarummaan jiiniiwwan lama jidduutti tatamsa’uu 1% ammas garaagarummaa guddaadha; kanaafuu, bu’aa raga irratti hundaa’etu eeggamaa jira (Fakkii. ​(Fakkii.33).
en-mt: However, a 1% difference in prevalence between two genes is still a significant difference; therefore, evidence-based results are expected (Fig. ​ (Fig.33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: Amaloonni fiizikaalaaf keemikaalaa SARS-CoV-2 ammallee baldhinaan hin beekamin jiru.
en-mt: The physical and chemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 remain unknown in detail.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: SARS-CoV fi MERS-CoV’n veetroo keessa sa’aatii 48tiif naannoo gogaa turuu danda’a akkasumas iddoo jiidhinsa 20 °C fi 40%-50% qabu jalatti hanga guyyaa 5 tura.
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can stay in the vitro for 48 hours around the skin and under a humidity of 20 °C and 40%-50% for up to 5 days.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 amaloota walfakkaataa agarsiisuu malu.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may exhibit similar characteristics.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 xiyya altiraavaayoleetiitiif miirawaa akka ta’e gabaafame akkasumas daqiiqaa 30f hoo’a 56 °C’tti; iiter itaanolii 75%, keemikaala ilbiisa balleessu kan kilooriinii qabu, asiidii peraseetik, kilooroofoormi, fi bulbultootaa coomaa, garuu kiloorooheeksidiinii miti, vaayirasicha laaffisuu danda’a.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is reported to be sensitive to ultraviolet radiation and at 56 °C for 30 minutes; 75% ethanol, chlorinated insecticides, peracetic acid, chloroform, and fatty solvents, but not chlorohexidine, can weaken the virus.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: Dhalli namaa waliigalatti hanqina madiinummaa SARS-CoV-2 ittisuu waan qabuuf salphaatti vaayirasii haaraaf saaxilama.
en-mt: Humans in general have a lack of immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and are therefore easily exposed to new viruses.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Yeroo kana, qorannoon gadi fagoon waa’ee deebii madiinummaa SARS-CoV-2 irratti gabaafame hin jiru.
en-mt: At this time, no in-depth studies have been reported on the median response to SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: Kanaafuu, CoVs biraa irratti odeeffannoo duraanii qofa ilaalla, keessattuu SARS-CoV fi MERS-CoV (Fakkii. ​(Fakkii.4).4).
en-mt: Therefore, we will only look at previous information on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Figure ​ (Figure4).4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: Walumaagalatti, erga vayirasiin baattoo faaleen booda, yeroo calqabaaf dandeettii dhukkuba ittisuu uumamaa nama sanaan karaa patern riilogniishin riisepter (PRR) beekamtiin ni kennamaaf, kan akka C-taayip leektin-laayik riisepter, Tool-laayik riisepter (TLR), NOD-laayik riisepter (NLR), fi RIG-I- laayik riisepter (RLR) dabalatee.
en-mt: In general, after infection by a carrier virus, it is first recognized by the person's natural immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs), such as C-type lectin-like receptor, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor ( including NLR), and RIG-I- like receptor (RLR).

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: Karaawwan garaagaraa keessatti, vaayirasichi haal-dureewwan dhiita qaama irratti ba’uu, seelota farra qaamaa (dendritic cells) bilcheessuu, akkasumas oomisha interferons (IFNs) gosa I kan faffaca’insa vaayirasichaa daangessuufi farroota qaamaa vaayirasii macrophage phagocytosis saffisiisu kakaasa.
en-mt: In a variety of pathways, the virus induces conditions for tumor emergence, maturation of dendritic cells, and the production of type I interferons (IFNs) that limit viral dissemination and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antibodies.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, N pirotiiniin SARS-CoV vaayirasiin akka deebii madiinummaa jalaa miliqu gargaaru danda’a.
en-mt: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV may help the virus escape the inflammatory response.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: Dhihootti, deebiin madiinummaa madaqaan lola vaayirasicha ittisuuf godhamutti makame.
en-mt: Recently, the Madaqaan response to the medievalism joined the fight against the virus.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: T lymphocytes CD4+ fi CD8+ dabalatee seelonni T (T cells) ittisa keessatti gahee barbaachisaa taphatu.
en-mt: T cells (T cells) including CD4+ and CD8+ T lymphocytes play an important role in immunity.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: CD4+ T cells seelota B (B cells) akka isaan farroota qaama alagaa vaayirasii adda ba’e irratti hundaa’e oomishaniif si’eessu, CD8+ T cells immoo seelota vaayirasiin hubaman kallattiimaan ajjeesu.
en-mt: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells (B cells) to produce antibodies based on the isolated virus foreign body, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: Seeliin T helper saayikootinii ittisa madaa’iinsaa oomishuun ittisa seeliitiif gargaara.
en-mt: T helper cells produce anti-injury psychotin to aid in cellular defense.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: Ta’us, CoV dalagaawwan seelii T (T cell) of-ajjeesuu seelii T kakaasuun ittisuu danda’a.
en-mt: Yet, CoV can prevent T cell (T cell) functions by inducing T cell suicide.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: Madiinummaan qaama keessaa maddu mirkaneessituu kanneen akka C3a fi C5a akkasumas antiibodii fa’a of keessatti hammatuu dhukkuba vaayirasii ittisuuf murteessadha.
en-mt: The body's immune system, which includes confirmators such as C3a and C5a as well as antibodies, is crucial for preventing viral infection.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, antiiboodiin dhukkubsataa fayye irraa fudhatame MERS-CoV ni himbaabsa.
en-mt: For example, antibodies from a recovered patient neutralize MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: Gama biraatiin, garmalee wal nyaachuun madiinummaa lakkoofsa raadikaalaa olaanaa maddisiisuun sombaa fi qaama biraa garmalee hubuu danda’a, akkasumas, yoo cime, miidhamuu qaamota hedduu fi du’a hordofsiisuu kan danda’uudha.
en-mt: On the other hand, overeating can generate a high number of radicals that can cause excessive damage to the lungs and other organs, and, if severe, can lead to multiple organ injuries and death.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: Dhukkubni SARS-CoV-2, walitti qabamee jalqabuun kan amaleeffatame, caalaatti namoota maanguddoo dhibeewwan dabalataa qabaniifi dubartoota ulfa keessatti dhibbaa geessisuu malu.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 disease, characterized by cluster onset, is more likely to affect the elderly with additional illnesses and pregnant women.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: Namoonni vaayirasii garaagaraatiif saaxilaman yookaan rakkina madiinummaa qaban dhukkubsattoota kanneen biro caala carraa qabamuu olaanaa kan qaban akka ta’e beekamaadha.
en-mt: It is known that people who are exposed to various viruses or have meningitis problems have a higher risk of infection than other patients.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Yeroon mallattoon SARS-CoV-2 itti muldhatu guyyoota 1-14ti, keessattuu guyyoota 3-7 qorannoo Wuhaanitti namoota 425 irratti gaggeeffame irratti hundaa’uun.
en-mt: The duration of symptoms of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, typically 3-7 days based on a study of 425 people in Wuhan.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: Ta’us, qu’annoon dhimmoota 1,099 yeroon utuu mallattoon hin mul’atin turu giddugaleessaan guyyoota 3 fi guyyoota 0 hanga 24 ta’uu akka danda’u agarsiisa.
en-mt: However, a study of 1,099 cases showed that the average duration of symptoms could be 3 days and 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: Qorannoon yeroo dhihootiin, akkuma armaan olitti dhihaatetti, yeroon walhoruu guyyoota 4.8 (3.0-7.2) akka ta’e baay’ina dhukkubsattootaa 8,866 irratti hundaa’uun agarsiifame.
en-mt: In a more recent study, as presented above, the incubation period was shown to be 4.8 days (3.0-7.2) based on a population of 8,866 patients.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: Yeroo marsaa cal’isa dhibee sirriitti yeroo adda bahiinsaa qindeessuun hoggantoota fayyaatiif baay’ee barbaachisaadha, haaluma kanaan namoota vaayirasichaan qabamanii garuu mallattoo hin agarsiifne irraa gara nama biraatti akka hin dabarre ittisa.
en-mt: It is very important for health managers to properly coordinate the isolation period during the silent phase of the disease, thus preventing transmission from people who are infected but do not show symptoms.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: Akka bartee baramaatti, namoonni vaayirasichaaf saaxilaman yookaan vaayirasichaan hubaman yeroo baay’ee guyyoota 14’f qofaatti baafamuu qabu.
en-mt: As a general rule, people who are exposed to or infected with the virus should usually be evacuated for only 14 days.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: Yeroon qofaatti baafamuu guyyoota 24’f dheerachuu qabaa?
en-mt: Should the quarantine period be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: Hoo’i qaamaa yeroo hunda COVID-19’f mallattoo hangafaa fi isa jalqabaati, mallattoo kan hin qabne yookaan mallattoolee biroo kanneen akka qufaa gogaa, harganuu dadhabuu, dhukkubbii irree, bowuu mataa, madaa’uu qoonqoo, furrii baay’isuu, dhukkubbii gateettii, baasaa, dhukkubbii garaa fi hoqqisuu qaba.
en-mt: Fever is always the oldest and first symptom of COVID-19, whether asymptomatic or with other symptoms such as a dry cough, shortness of breath, arm pain, headache, sore throat, increased rash, chest pain , vomiting, abdominal pain and cough.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni tokko tokko dhibeen irratti mul’atee torbaan tokko boooda rakkina hargansuu fi/yookaan hanqina qilleensa dhiiga keessatti argamuu agarsiisu.
en-mt: Some patients show difficulty breathing and/or hypoxia one week after onset.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: Taatee hamaa keessatti, dhukkubsatichi saffisaan gara mallattoo rakkoo hargansuu hamaa, hollannaa faalamaa, meetaaboliik asiidoosis, fi kooguloopaatii itti ce’a.
en-mt: In a serious event, the patient rapidly progresses to symptoms of severe respiratory distress, contaminated hoarseness, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: Dhukkubsataan hoo’a qaamaa fi/yookaan mallattoo rakkina hargansuu qabu fi hoo’a cimaa qabu, daranyoo sombaa agarsiisuu dhabaatus qorannaa jalqabaa irratti vaayirasichaaf adda bahuu qaba.
en-mt: A patient with fever and/or symptoms of difficulty breathing and severe fever should be diagnosed for the virus at the initial examination even if they do not show pneumonia.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: Qu’annoon fayyaa uummataa dhuma Mudde 2019 keessaa dhibbeentaan mallattoolee 98% gubaa qaamaaf, 76% qufaa gogaaf, 55% hafuura baafachuu dadhabuuf, fi 3% garaa kaasaaf; 8% dhukkubsattootaa deeggarsa kenniinsa qilleensaa barbaadu turani.
en-mt: The population health survey at the end of December 2019 found that the percentage of symptoms was 98% for burns, 76% for dry cough, 55% for shortness of breath, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of patients required ventilatory support.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: Argannoowwan wal-fakkaataan, qo’annaan dhihoo lama garee maatii fi garee tamsaasa warreen mallattoo hin agarsiifneen uumame irratti gabaafameera.
en-mt: Similar findings have been reported in two recent studies of family cohorts and dissemination cohorts formed by asymptomatic parents.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: Walbira yoo qabamu, akka qorannoon bara 2012 ummatarratti godhame agarsiisutti dhukkubsataan MERS-CoV hoo’ina qaamaa (98%), qufaa gogaa (47%), fi hargansuu dadhabuu (55%) akka mallatto isaanii jalqabaatti qabaatu.
en-mt: In comparison, according to a 2012 study of the population, a patient with MERS-CoV has fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their primary symptoms.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, 80% dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 caala gargaarsa meeshaa hargansuu barbaadu, akkasumas ajjeechaa MERS COVID-19 wajjiin dhaabbataadha
en-mt: However, 80% of COVID-19 patients require ventilatory assistance, and MERS deaths are constant with COVID-1

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: Baasaa (26%) fi madaa’uu goroorroo (21%) dhukkubsataa MERS wajjiin argamuu danda’u.
en-mt: Excretion (26%) and sore throat (21%) can be found with MERS patients.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoota SARS keessa, hoo’I qaamaa (99%-100%), qufaa gogaa (29%-75%), rakkina hargansuu (40%-42%), gara kaasaa (20-25%), fi madaa qoonqoo (13-25%) mallattoo hangafaa fi gargaarsi hargansuu dhukkubsattoota hanga 14%-20%’tiif akka barbaachisu dhihaate.
en-mt: Among SARS patients, fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), difficulty breathing (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13). -25%) is the eldest symptom and ventilatory assistance is required for up to 14%-20% of patients.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: Guraandhala 14 dura, yeroo akka addunyaatti namoonni 66,576 qabamuun isaanii mirkanaa’e du’aatiin COVID-19 2% ture.
en-mt: Before November 14, when there were 66,576 confirmed cases worldwide, the COVID-19 death rate was 2%.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: Wal bira qabiinsaan, hammi du’aa SARS kan Sadaasa 2002 dhimmoota shakkaman 8,096 keessaa 10% dha.
en-mt: By comparison, the SARS death rate for March 2002 is 10% out of 8,096 suspected cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: MERS tiif, qu’annoo fayyaa uummataa Waxabajji 2012 keessaa irratti hundaa’uun, dhimmoota mirkanaa’an 2,494 keessaa hammi du’aa 37% ture.
en-mt: For MERS, based on the October 2012 population health survey, the mortality rate was 37% out of 2,494 confirmed cases.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: Qorannoon haaraan akka gabaasetti R0’n SARS-CoV-2 hanga 6.47 olka’aa confidence interval (CI) 95% isa 5.71-7.23, R0’n SARS-CoV immoo 2 hanga 4 gidduutti qofa argama.
en-mt: A new study reported that the R0 for SARS-CoV-2 ranged from 6.47 to 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, while the R0 for SARS-CoV ranged from 2 to

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: Wal bira qabiinsi SARS-CoV-2 MERS-CoV fi SARA-CoV waliinii mallattoolee, hamma du’aa, fi R0 isaanii ilaalchisee Gabatee Gabatee1.1 keessatti dhiyaateera.
en-mt: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV with respect to their symptoms, mortality rates, and R0 is presented in Table ​ Table1.1.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: Fakkiin armaan olii akka himutti SARS-CoV-2’n dandeettii MERS-CoV fi SARS-CoV caala tatamsa’uu qaba, garuu isaan lamaanii gaditti hamaadha.
en-mt: The figure above suggests that SARS-CoV-2 has the ability to spread more than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but is less severe than both.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kanaafuu, weerara SARS-CoV-2 too’achuun isa MERS-CoV fi SARS-CoV caalaa cimaadha.
en-mt: Therefore, controlling an outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 is more difficult than that of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: Tuutaan qabamuun yeroo hunda kan muudatu maatii walfakkaataa keessatti yookaan walitti qabama walfakkaataa keessatti yookaan imala doonii keessatti.
en-mt: Crowd infestation occurs all the time in the same family or in the same collection or in the same voyage.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni yeroo baay'ee seenaa imalaa yookaan jiraattoota Wuhaan yookaan naannoolee faalaman biroo irraa yookaan namoota dhukkubsatan wajjiin waltuttuqan yookaan dhukkubsattoota qabamuun dura torban lamaan dhiheenyaa keessa jiran qabu.
en-mt: Patients usually have a travel history of either residents of Wuhan or other contaminated areas or contacts with infected people or patients in the recent two weeks prior to infection.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: Garuu, namoonni dhukkubaan qabaman mallattoo osoo hin muldhisin torban lamaa ol turuu akka danda’anii fi kanneen fayyanii hospitaalaa bahan lammata qabamuu akka danda’an gabaafame, kunis yeroon adda foo’insaa dheeressuuf ergaa akeekkachiisaa dabarsa.
en-mt: However, it has been reported that infected people can stay asymptomatic for more than two weeks and those who recover and leave hospital can become infected again, sending a warning message to extend the quarantine period.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni lakkoofsa seeliiwwan dhiiga adiii fiixee irratti argaman baramaa yookaan hir’ate (keessattuu lymphocytes) sadarkaa jalqabaatti qabu.
en-mt: Patients have normal or reduced peak white blood cell counts (especially lymphocytes) at baseline.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, lakkoofsa liimfoopeeniyaa seelii dhiiga adii wajjiin < 4×109/L lakkoofsa liimfoosaayit < 1×109/L dabalatee, akkasumas sadarkaa asparteet amiinootiraanisferees olguddate fi viireemiyaa dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 1,099 keessati argame dabalatee.
en-mt: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell counts < 4×109/L including lymphocyte counts < 1×109/L, as well as elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: Sadarkaan inzaayimii tiruu fi irree fi maayigiloobiinii dhiiga dhukkubsattoota muraasaa keessatti ni dabala, akkasumas dhukkubsataan pirotiinii C-rii’aktiivii fi kuufamni eriitiroosaayit dhiiga dhukkubsattoota tokko tokkoo keessatti ni argamu.
en-mt: Levels of hepatic and irregular enzymes and myoglobin are increased in the blood of a few patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte deposits are present in the blood of some patients.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoota hammeenyaan dhukkubsatan, sadarkaa D-diimerii, keemikaala kan hir’isuu fi dhiiga keessatti argamu, ni dabale, akksumas lakkofsi leemfoosaayitii suuta suuta gadi bu’e.
en-mt: In severely ill patients, levels of D-dimer, a chemical reducing agent found in the blood, increased, and lymphocyte counts gradually fell.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: Raajii laphee keessatti waantotni hin baratamne dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 irra caalaa keessatti argamaniiru akkasumas haguuggii somba lachuu irratti bittinnaa’e yookaan sombawwan keessatti dukkana bifa burcuqqoo dhaabbatee fakkaatuun amaleeffamu.
