en-mt: Abnormalities in cardiac prognosis have been found in most COVID-19 patients and are characterized by scattered membranes on both lungs or darkness in the lungs.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni yeroo baay’ee michii sombaa sababni isaa hin beekamne, miidhamuu sombaa akka tasaa, akkasumas mallattoolee ukkaamamuu qaama hargansuu akka tasaa agarsiisu.
en-mt: Patients often present with pneumonia of unknown cause, sudden lung injury, and signs of sudden respiratory arrest.

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: Gaafa ARDS uumamu, dhiita to’annoo ala ta’e, kuufama dhangala’aa, akkasumas faaybiroosisii itti fufaan haala hammaataan geeddarinsa qilleensaa xiqqeessu.
en-mt: When ARDS develops, uncontrolled swelling, fluid accumulation, and persistent fibrosis severely reduce ventilation.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: Faayidalamee niimoosaayitii gosa-I fi gosa-II sadarkaa wantoota maddiirra qubatanii hir’isa akkasumas soda maddii dabala, haaluma kanaan dandeettii afuufamuu sombaa hir’isuunii fi balaa miidhamuu sombaa olkaasa.
en-mt: Used type-I and type-II pneumocytes reduce the levels of source-settled substances and increase source fear, thereby reducing the ability to inhale and increasing the risk of lung injury.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: Kanaafuu, argannoon raadiyoogiraafii ceekuu hamaan yeroo hunda hammeenya dhibichaatiin wal cinaa deema.
en-mt: Therefore, radiographic findings of malignant cecum always go hand in hand with the severity of the disease.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Guraandhala 18, 2020 irratti, xiinxalliin calqabaa paatooloojikaalii COVID-19 irrattii kan agarsiise numoosaayiitiin luqqa’uu, membireeniin hayaaliin uumamuu, fi multinukletid siinkaayital seels somba dhukkubsattoota dhibee kanaan du’anii keessatti, qorannoo dhibee faalama vaayirasii waliin walitti fufaa fi ARDS fi dhukkubsatoota SARS and MERS waliin tokkuma.
en-mt: On January 18, 2020, preliminary pathological analyzes of COVID-19 showed pneumocyte lysis, hyaline membrane formation, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of deceased patients, in continuous diagnosis of viral infection and ARDS and SARS and Same with MERS.

sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: Argannoon RNA SARS-CoV-2 karaa reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR)’n COVID-19 qorachuuf akka ulaagaa hangafaatti fayyada.
en-mt: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA by reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) is used as the primary criterion for diagnosis of COVID-1

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, sababa hamma nagatiivii sobaa, kan weeraricha hammeessuu danda’uutiin, agarsiifni kilinikaa yaalaaf oolu (kan RT-PCR irratti hin rarraane) gurraandhala 13, 2020 Chaayinaatti eegalame.
en-mt: However, due to the high level of false negatives, which could exacerbate the outbreak, clinical indications for treatment (which do not depend on RT-PCR) were launched on November 13, 2020 in China.

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: Qorannoo dhukkuba SARS keessattis haala walfakkaataatu uumame
en-mt: A similar situation occurred in SARS research

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: Kanaafuu, walitti qabamni seenaa dhukkubaa, agarsiisa kilinikaa, qorannoo laabiraatoorii, fi argannoowwan raadiyoolojii barbaachisoodha akkasumas qorannaa bu’a qabeessa gochuufis murteessoodha.
en-mt: Therefore, the collection of clinical history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is important and also critical to an effective diagnosis.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: Amajjii 14, 2020, gareen Feng Zhang akkaataa SHERLOCK CRISPR irratti hundaa’eef adeemsa haala itti fayyadama isaa SARS-CoV-2 tooftaa ittisu, kan qoqqoodaama 20 × 10-18 mol/L hanga 200 × 10-18 mol/L (baay’ina 10-100 maaykirooliitirii tokkoof) SARS-CoV-2 RNA meeshaa biraa osoo hin fayyadamin shallagduu gadi fageenyaa qofa barbaada.
en-mt: On March 14, 2020, Feng Zhang's group developed a SHERLOCK CRISPR-based use case process for its SARS-CoV-2 prevention strategy, ranging from 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (very' ina 10-100 per microliter) SARS-CoV-2 RNA requires only a depth calculator without the use of any other equipment.

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: Abdii guutuun, malli haaraan yoo eddattoowwan kilinikaawaa keessatti mirkanaa’e haala ajaa’ibaan miirummaafi simannaa fooyyessa.
en-mt: Hopefully, the new method, if validated in clinical trials, will dramatically improve sensitivity and reception.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: Sababa hanqina muuxannoo novel CoV waliiniif, ogeessoti fayyaa caalaatti dhukkubsattoota COVID-19’f kunuunsa gargaarsaa dhiyeessu, yeroo wal’aansota gosa adda addaa kan faayidaarra oolanii turan yookaan isa dura kan wal’aansota CoVwwan kan biroo kanneen akka SARS-CoV fi MERS-CoV fi dhukkuboota vaayirasiin dhufan kan biroof karoorfame yaalanitti (Gabatee (Gabatee2).2).
en-mt: Due to the lack of experience with novel CoV, health professionals are more likely to provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, during or before the treatments for other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and planned for treating other viral diseases (Table ​ (Table2).2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: Wal’aansonni kunniin wal’aansota yeroo ammaafi humna qaban qorichoota farra dhukkuboota vaayirasiin dhufan waliin, waantota madiinummaa qaamaa hir’isan, gosa qorichoota hormonii irraa hojjetaman (steroids), plaazmaa dhukkubsattoota bayyaannatan irraa, qorichoota Chaayinaa, akkasumas deeggarsa xiinsammuu hammatu.
en-mt: These treatments include current and powerful treatments with antiviral drugs, anti-inflammatory drugs, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: Pilaazmaan dhukkubsataa dandamate irraa argamu tajaajila fayyaaf akka oolu eeramee ture.
en-mt: It was mentioned that the plasma from the recovered patient would be used for medical purposes.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: Dhaabbileen qoricha oomishan antiiboodiiwwanii fi qoricha talaallii oomishuuf fiigaa jiru.
en-mt: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to produce antibodies and vaccines.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 jalqaba irratti hedduminaan sombawwan miidha akkasumas tarii, hammamtaa xiqqaan, qaamota biroo ACE2 agarsiisan, kanneen akka sirna garaachaafi mar’ummaanii fi kaleewwan miidhuu danda’a.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 initially predominantly affects the lungs and possibly, to a lesser extent, other ACE2-expressing organs, such as the gastrointestinal tract and liver.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: Ta’us garuu, sirni hargansuu laafuu fi kufuun miidhaa cimaa kan fiduu fi du’aaf sababa kan ta’uudha.
en-mt: However, respiratory failure and collapse can cause serious injury and death.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: Kanaafuu, gargaarsi hargansuu mallattoo laaffisuuf murteessaa fi lubbuu baraara akkasumas yaala oksijiinii waliigalaa, yaa’a oksijiinii olaanaa, hargansiiftuu addaan hin cinne, fi hargansiiftuu adda citaa hammeenya dhukkubaa irratti hundaa’uudhaan.
en-mt: Thus, respiratory assistance is crucial for symptom relief and is life-saving as well as general oxygen therapy, high oxygen flow, uninterrupted respiration, and intermittent respiration depending on disease severity.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni mallattoo miidhaa qaama hargansuu qaban extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO)’dhaan gargaaramuu qabau, tooftaa hambisa onnee fi sombaa kan waldhaansa dhibee onnee fi daranyoo sombaaf akka oolu fooyya’eedha.
en-mt: Patients with signs of respiratory injury should be treated with extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a cardiopulmonary bypass technique modified for the treatment of heart disease and pulmonary embolism.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: Dabalataan, suphaan madaala elektiroolaayit, ittisuu fi waldhaanuu dhukkuba sadarkaa lammaffaa fi seeptik shook, fi kunuunsi tajaajila qaama murteessaatis dhukkubsattoota SARS-CoV-2’tiif barbaachisoodha.
en-mt: In addition, maintenance of electrolyte balance, prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and care of critical organ services are also important for SARS-CoV-2 patients.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Saaytookiin istoormiin wal nyaatinsa cimaa sirna madiinuma dhukkubsattoota SARS fi MERS irraa akka dhufu ni beekama.
en-mt: Cytokine storms are known to result from strong interactions with the immune system of SARS and MERS patients.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: Saayitookiin istoormiin adeemsa deebii madaa walitti aansa saayikotiiniitiin dabaalame TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, fi MCP-1 fa’a hammatuudha.
en-mt: Cytokine storming is a series of wound responses augmented by psychotin encompassing TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: Cytokine nonni kunniin seelota dandeettii dhukkuba ittisuu qaban akka isaan raadikaala bilisaa lakkoofsaan guddaa ta’an kanneen sababa guddaa ARDS fi hojii dhaabuu qaamota baay’ee ta’an akka gadhiisaniif kakaasu.
en-mt: These cytokine nons stimulate immune cells to release large numbers of free radicals that are a major cause of ARDS and multi-organ dysfunction.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: Madiimummaa qaamaa humni isaa hir’ate wal’aansa baay’atee faca’uu cytokine keessatti barbaachisaadha, keessattuu dhukkubsattoota dhibeen itti hammaate keessatti.
en-mt: Attenuated immunity is required in the treatment of cytokine proliferation, especially in patients with advanced disease.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: Kortiikosterooyid fi tosilizumaab, antiiboodii moonookilonaal farra-IL6, saaytookiin istoormi fayyisuuf oolu.
en-mt: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, a monoclonal antibody against IL6, a cytokine for curing stroke.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: Waldhaansonni madiinumma hir’isan saayitoosiiniitiif oolan kaneen biroo deebii madiinummaa T seeliin hogganamu; ittisa IFN-γ, IL-1, fi TNF; ittisa JAK; bilinaatumoomab; ittisa mallattoo saayitookiin siignaaliing 4; fi ittistoota HDAC.
en-mt: Other immunosuppressive treatments for cytosine are T cell-mediated immune responses; inhibition of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; defense of JAK; bilinaatumoomab; inhibition of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Istirooyidii, akka hir’isa madiinummaatti, waldhaansa SARS keessatti hammeenya madaa’uun fiduu danda’uuf baldhinaan hojiirra oola.
en-mt: Steroids, as a reducing agent, are widely used in the treatment of SARS for the severity of wounds.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, istirooyidiin garmalee fudhatame dhukkubsattoota SARS fi COVID-19 miidhamaniif faayidaa hin qabu.
en-mt: However, steroid overdose is not beneficial for patients affected by SARS and COVID-1

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: Bakka sana, miidhaa cimaa geessuu malu, keessattuu avaaskular ostoneekroosis, bifa ajaa’ibsiisaa ta’een qorannoo dhibee irratti dhiibbaa fida.
en-mt: That location, potentially severe damage, especially avascular ostonenecrosis, dramatically affects the diagnosis.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Ta’us, kallattii gabaabaan kostikosterooyid hammi fudhannaa-xiqqaa-hanga-giddugaleessaatti jiru namoota COVID-19 ‘iin ciminaan dhukkubsatan fayyaduuf ajajama.
en-mt: However, short-term low- to moderate-dose costosteroids are prescribed for the benefit of people who are severely ill with COVID-1

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: Yeroo barreeffamutti, wal’aansi farra dhukkuba vaayirasiin dhufuu bu’a qabeessi hin mirkanoofne.
en-mt: At the time of writing, no effective antiseptic treatment has been established.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, hoggansa seelii dhiiga keessaa reemdesiviir wajjiin, tartiiba niwuuklootaayid, dhukkubsataa COVID-19 lammii Ameerikaa keessatti murteessaa ta’uun isaa mirkanaa’e.
en-mt: However, with the administration of remdesivir in blood cells, the nucleotide sequence proved to be critical in an American COVID-19 patient.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: Reemdesiivir qoricha farra vaayirasii haaraa jalqaba waldhaansa Iiboolaa fi vaayirasii Maarlibargiitiif Gilead’dhaan hojjatameedha.
en-mt: Remdesivir is a new antiviral drug first developed by Gilead for the treatment of Ebola and Marlberg virus.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: Booda, remdesivir dabalataan ittisa ta’uu danda’u kan vaayirasoota RNA kajiisa baaqqee ta’an kan biroo MERS fi SARS dabalatee agarsiiseera.
en-mt: Later, remdesivir additionally showed potential protection against other RNA viruses including MERS and SARS.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: Kunniin irratti hundaa’uun, Gilead yaaliiwwan cimdii namoota SARS-CoV-2’n hubaman irratti gaggeessuuf kompaawundicha Chaayinaatti dhiyeesseera, akkasumas firiiwwan haala ol’aanaan eegamu.
en-mt: Based on these, Gilead has offered the compound to China for intensive trials in people infected with SARS-CoV-2, and results are highly expected.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: Dabalataan, baarisitiimbi, interfiiroon-α, loopinaavir/ritonaavir, fi riibaaviriindhukkubsattoota sirna hargansuutiin qabamaniif akka waldhaansa cimaa ajajame.
en-mt: In addition, baristimb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin were prescribed as intensive therapy for patients with respiratory infections.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: Wal’aansa lopinavir/ritonavir hordofuu waliin garaa kaasaan, locaan, balaqqamsiisaan, miidhamuun tiruu, akkasumas walnyaatinsoonni faallaa uumamuu danda’u.
en-mt: Nausea, loca, vomiting, kidney injury, and adverse reactions may occur with adherence to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: Walqunnamtiin waldhaansa kanneenii fi qorichoota biroo dhukkubsataan fayyadamu wajjiin godhamu ofeeggannoodhaan ta’uu qaba.
en-mt: Interaction with these treatments and other medications used by the patient should be done with caution.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: Pilaasmaa dhukkubsataa dandamatee fi maddiinsa antiibodii irraa.
en-mt: Plasma from a resistant patient and source of antibodies.

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: Namoota dhukkubsatanii fayyan irraa dhiignii fuudhamee namoota dhukkuba walfakkaataan qabamaniif oolu yookaan namoonni fayyaan akka hin qabamne kunuunsuuf oolu seenaa dheeraa qaba.
en-mt: There is a long history of blood being taken from people who have recovered from illness and used for people with similar diseases or to keep healthy people from getting infected.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: Dhugaatti, namoonni dhukkuba irraa dandamatan yeroo hunda wantoota dhibee fidan dhiiga isaanii keessa jiruuf farra qaama alaagaa olaanaa qabu.
en-mt: In effect, survivors always have high foreign antibodies to disease-causing agents in their blood.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: Farroonni qaama alagaa immunoglobulin (Ig) kan B lymphocytes dhaan waanta dhukkuba fiduufi waantota alaa kan biroo loluuf oomishamanidha akkasumas isaan waantota dhukkuba fidan keessatti molakiyuloota addaa adda baafatu akkasumas kallattiimaan miidhaa maleessa isaan taasisu.
en-mt: Antibodies are immunoglobulins (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign agents and they recognize specific molecules in pathogens and make them directly harmless.

sourceString: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
targetString: Kanarratti hundaa’uun, pilaazmaan dhiiga garee dhikkubsattoota COVID-19 irraa dandamatan irraa kan walitti qabamee namoota 10 garmalee dhukkubsataniif kenname.
en-mt: Based on this, blood plasma was collected from a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and given to 10 critically ill people.

sourceString: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
targetString: Mallattoon isaanii sa’aatii 24 keessatti fooyya’a, hir’achuu dhukkubaa fi hamma vaayirasiifi fi oksijiiniin dhiiga keessatti itituu wajjiin wal qabata.
en-mt: Their symptoms improve within 24 hours, associated with a reduction in illness and increased viral load and oxygen in the blood.

sourceString: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, mirkaneessuu fi ifa taasisuun hanga waldhaansi addaa hanga ammaatti hin guddatinitti tooftichi baldhinaan hojii irra oolchuun barbaachisaadha.
en-mt: However, confirmation and clarification require the technique to be widely implemented until a specific treatment is developed.

sourceString: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
targetString: Dabalataan, miidhaa qorichi yaalaa fidurratti hundaa’uun, miidhaawwan pilaazmaa wajjiin walqabatan muraasni of eeggannoon ilaalamuu qabu.
en-mt: In addition, depending on the side effects of the drug, a few plasma-related side effects should be considered with caution.

sourceString: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, aniiboodiin deebii madiinummaa hammaa olii fi mallattoo qoqqoodama seelii ,kan humnaan asiidummaa lubbuuf balaa qaban caalaatti kakaasuu ni danda’a.
en-mt: For example, anhydride can further stimulate an excessive medium response and cell division signals ,which are violently acidic and more life-threatening.

sourceString: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
targetString: Hammamtaan farroota qaama alagaa dhiiga keessaa yeroo baay’ee gadi aanaadha, akkasumas dhukkubsattoota baay’ee isaan dhukkubu wal’aanuuf barbaachisummaan plaazmaa guddaadha.
en-mt: The concentration of foreign body antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the need for plasma is great for treating patients who are very sick.

sourceString: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
targetString: Weerara addunyaa balleessuuf antibaayotikii gahaa saffisaan hojjachuu fi oomishuun baay’ee cimaadha.
en-mt: It is very difficult to develop and produce antibiotics quickly enough to eradicate a global epidemic.

sourceString: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
targetString: Kanaafuu, inni dhukkubsataa dandamate irraa seelii B adda baasuuf murteessaa fi hojiirra kan ooluu danda’uudha akkasumas jeeneetik koodii antiibaayotikii bu’a qabeessa jijjiiruuf yookaan antiibodii pirotiinii murteessaa vaayirasii faallaa jiru calala.
en-mt: Therefore, it is critical and applicable for isolating B cells from a resistant patient and screens for altering the genetic code for effective antibiotics or antibodies against a critical viral protein.

sourceString: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
targetString: Karaa kanaan, oomisha farra qaama alaagaa dabaluu dandeenya.
en-mt: In this way, we can increase the production of foreign antibodies.

sourceString: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
targetString: TCM biyya Chaayinaatti dhukkuboota garagaraa waldhaanuuf waggota kumaatamaaf itti fayyadamamaa ture.
en-mt: TCM has been used in China for thousands of years to treat various diseases.

sourceString: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, miidhaan isaa caalmaatti walitti qabama qaama foormullaa keessaa kan qorannoo dhibee yaadrimee TCM irratti hundaa’u irratti hirkata.
en-mt: However, the side effects are more dependent on the concentration of the ingredient in the formula which is based on the diagnosis of TCM concepts.

sourceString: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
targetString: Qaamonni murteessaan hedduun osoo hin beekamin hafan yookaan adda baasuuf waan cimuuf ni ulfaatu akkasumas qaama yookaan walitti qabama sana mirkaneessu.
en-mt: Many critical elements that remain unknown are either difficult to identify and therefore confirm the entity or aggregate.

sourceString: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
targetString: Yeroo ammaa kana, hanqinni yaala addaa COVID-19 jiraachuun, dhukkkubsattoota mallattoo salphaa hanga jiddugaleessaa qabanii fi ciminaan dhukkusatanii dandamataniif TCM waldhaansa murteessaa ta’aa dhufe.
en-mt: Currently, due to the lack of specific treatment for COVID-19, TCM is becoming an essential treatment for patients with mild to moderate symptoms and severe illness.

sourceString: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, qorichi Shu Feng Jie Du fi qorichi Lian Hua Qing Wen waldhaansa COVID-19’tiif kan fayyadan ta’anii argaman.
en-mt: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du's drug and Lian Hua Qing Wen's drug have been found to be useful for the treatment of COVID-1

sourceString: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
targetString: Hammi yaala dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 kutaalee Chaayinaa hedduu keessatti maatii isaanii 87% keessatti TCM fayyadaman, (63.7%) Gaansuu, (50%) Ninjiyaa, fi (50%) Huunaan dabalatee, akkasumas kutaa Hubii, kanneen dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 isaatiif TCM 30%’tti dhihaatu qofa fayyadaman hamma yaalaa gadi aanaa (13%) qaba.
en-mt: The extent of treatment of COVID-19 patients in several provinces of China used TCM in 87% of their families, including (63.7%) Gansu, (50%) Ninjia, and (50%) Hunan, as well as Hubei province, which has 30 TCM for its COVID-19 patients only nearly % have a low therapeutic rate (13%).

sourceString: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, kun dhiibbaawwan biroo kanneen akka lakkoofsaa fi hammeenya dhukkubsataa qoratamuu wajjiin yoo wal bira qabamu irra keessoo dha.
en-mt: However, this is more internal compared to other effects such as the number and severity of patients being examined.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
targetString: Gurraandhala 18, 2020, Boli Zhang fi namoonni inni wajjiin hojjatu western medicine (WM) fi TCM qorannoon walmadaalchisu maxxanfamee ture.
en-mt: On November 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and his colleagues published a comparative study of western medicine (WM) and TCM.

sourceString: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
targetString: Isaan yeroowwan fooyya’uu ho’ina qaamaaf, dhabamuu mallattoof, akkasumas wal’aansaaf gara hospitaalaatti erguuf barbaachisan haala ajaa’ibaan garee WM qofaa irra garee WM+TCM keessatti xiqqoo ta’uu argatan.
en-mt: They found that times to improvement in fever, disappearance of symptoms, and referral to hospital for treatment were dramatically smaller in the WM+TCM group than in the WM alone group.

sourceString: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
targetString: Haala baay’ee dinqisiisaa ta’een, saffisni hammaachuu mallattoo qabaachuu (salphaa irraa gara hamaatti) haala ajaa’ibsiisaa ta’een garee WM qofaa irra garee WM+TCM tiif gadi aanaa dha (7.4% birqaba 46.2%) akkasumas hammi du’aa garee WM qofaa irra garee WM+TCM keessatti gadi aanaa dha (8.8% birqaba 39%).
en-mt: Most dramatically, the rate of symptomatic exacerbation (from mild to severe) is remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM alone group (7.4% versus 46.2%) as is the mortality rate lower in the WM+TCM group than in the WM alone group (8.8% versus 39%).

sourceString: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
targetString: Ta’us garuu, nageenyummaa fi fayyadamummaan TCM ammas shaakala bal’aa giddugala bal’aatti ta’u eeggata.
en-mt: However, the safety and usefulness of TCM still awaits widespread practice in a wide range of centers.

sourceString: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
targetString: Tooftaawwan gochaalee amaleessuun akkasumas qaamota bu’a qabeessa wal’aansota TCM yookaan walitti makama isaanii yoo danda’ame ifa gochuun silaa dabalataan gammachiisaa ta’uu danda’a.
en-mt: Characterizing the techniques of actions as well as elucidating the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible would have been extra exciting.

sourceString: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni COVID-19’n qabamuun shakkaman yookiin beekaman irra caalaatti sodaa dhukkubba daddarbaa fi ajjeesaa qabu, akkasumas namoonni adda baafamanis miira nuffuu, kophummaa, fi aarii horatu.
en-mt: Patients suspected or known to be infected with COVID-19 are more likely to be infectious and deadly, and people who are isolated also develop feelings of fatigue, loneliness, and anger.

sourceString: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
targetString: Dabalataan, mallattooleen dhukkubichaa kan akka gubaa qaamaa, hanqina oksiijiniifi qufaa akkasumas bu’aaleen fallaa wal’aansotaa kan akka hirriba dhabuu corticosteroids dhaan dhufu yaaddoo danuufi cinqii sammuutti geessuu danda’u.
en-mt: In addition, symptoms such as burning sensation, lack of oxygen and coughing, as well as side effects of treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids, can lead to increased anxiety and depression.

sourceString: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
targetString: Sadarkaa jalqabaa jalqabbii SARS tti, hammamtaa dhukkuboota sammuu, walitti fufiinsaan cinqamuu, yaaddoo, sodaan miidhamuu, gammachuu sochiiwwan gochaa sammuu irraa maddan, mallattoolee dhibee sammuu, jeequmsa sammuu, akkasumas of-ajjeesunillee gabaafamaniiru.
en-mt: In the early stages of SARS onset, severity of mental illnesses, continuous depression, anxiety, fear of injury, euphoria resulting from mental action activities, symptoms of schizophrenia, psychotic disorders, as well as suicidality were also reported.

sourceString: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
targetString: Dirqamni tuttuqqaa barbaaduu fi addatti baasuu, akka qaama deebii fayyaa hawaasaa tatamsa’ina COVID-19’tiif godhamuutti, waa’ee miidhaa tatamsa’ina dhibee, adda foo’amuu, fi akkasumas maatii fi hiriyyoota biratti balaaleffatamuun ummata soda fi miira adabbii keessa galchuu danda’a.
en-mt: The duty to seek and isolate contacts, as part of the public health response to the COVID-19 outbreak, instills fear and punishment in the public about the harm of the outbreak, isolation, and condemnation by family and friends can.

sourceString: Thus, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
targetString: Kanaafuu, tajaajilli fayyaa sammuu dhukkubsattoota COVID-19’tiif kennamuu qaba, namoota shakkaman, fi namoota isaan wajjiin walqunnaman akkasumas ummata barbaachisaa ta’eef kennamuu qaba.
en-mt: Therefore, mental health services should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspects, and their contacts as well as the relevant population.

sourceString: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
targetString: Deeggarsi xinsammuu hundeeffama gareewwan fayyummaa sammuu ogummaa garaagaraa, quunnamtiiwwan ifoo haareffama waa’ee jalqabbii SARS-CoV-2 yeroo maraafi sirrii ta’e akkasumas karoorota wal’aansaa fi ogummaan fayyadamiinsa meeshaawwan elektiroonikii fi fayyadamoota quunnamtii dhiyoo walii wajjinii dhorkan hammachuu qaba.
en-mt: Psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the onset of SARS-CoV-2 as well as treatment plans and professionals prohibiting the use of electronic devices and close contact with each other.

sourceString: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
targetString: Talaalliin bu’a qabeessi funca tatamsa’iinsaa madda bineensaa irraa fi nama dhukkubichaan qabame irraa gara baattoo saaxilamoottii fi yeroo hunda too’annoo weerara vaayirasiiwwan lafaa dhufoo dhufaniitiif yaala farra vaayirasiitiif barbaachisaadha.
en-mt: Effective vaccination against fungi for transmission from animal sources and from an infected person to susceptible carriers is always required for antiviral therapy for the control of incoming outbreaks of earthworms.

sourceString: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.
targetString: Talaalliiwwan pirootinii S irratti hundaa’an dagaagsuuf farroota qaama alagaa cimoo giddu galeessa gochuu danda’an yeroo dheeraa fi/yookaan SARS-CoV irratti madiinummaa eeguu danda’an maddisiisuuf carraaqqiiwwan taasifamaniiru.
en-mt: Efforts have been made to develop S-protein-based vaccines to generate potent neutralizing foreign body antibodies capable of prolonged duration and/or maintained neutrality against SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.
targetString: Talaalliiwwan vaayirasii lubbuun keessa jiru irraa hojjetaman SARS’f moodelota bineensaa irratti gamaaggamamaniiru.
en-mt: Vaccines made from live viruses have been reviewed in animal models for SARS.

sourceString: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, yaaliin talaallii nama jaarsa irratti waan gaarii agarsiisee fi moodelii dhiibbaa-ajjeesaa fi ittisni isaan vaayirasii zoonootikiif godhan qorannoo kilinikaa dura murtaa’uu qaba.
en-mt: However, vaccine trials have shown positive results in elderly humans and effect-lethal models and their immunity to zoonotic viruses should be determined before clinical studies.

sourceString: This is probably because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
targetString: Kun sababa SARS waggoota 17 dura kan bade fi sana booda dhikkubsataan biraa hin argaminiifiidha.
en-mt: This is because SARS disappeared 17 years ago and no other cases have been reported since.

sourceString: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
targetString: Walbira qabuun, taateewwan baratamoo hin taanee fi gurmuun MERS Giddugala Bahaatti mul’achuu itti fufe fi naannoo biraatti tatamsa’e zoonoozikii naannawa sana irraa maddu irraa ka’uun.
en-mt: In comparison, unusual events and clusters of MERS continued to appear in the Middle East and spread to other areas arising from zoonoses originating in that area.

sourceString: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS by using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
targetString: Tooftaan talaallii MERS’f kan qophaa’e vaayirasii hin si’aayin, pilaasmidii DNA, baattota vaayirasii, naanoopaartikilii, wantoota vaayirasii fakkaatan fi galma kutaa pirotiinii fi muraasni moodela bineensotaa keessatti kan qorataman fayyadamuudhaan.
en-mt: Vaccine strategies have been developed for MERS using non-encapsulated viruses, DNA plasmids, viral carriers, nanoparticles, virus-like substances and protein compartment targets and few have been tested in animal models.

sourceString: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
targetString: Namoota SARS-CoV-2 dhukkubsatanii madiinummaa gadi aanaa qabaniif talaalliin hojjatamu ariifachiisaa ta’uu qaba, fi hojiiwwan weerara deema jiru dhaabanis akkasuma.
en-mt: Vaccination for people with low immunity to SARS-CoV-2 should be urgent, and so should efforts to stop an ongoing outbreak.

sourceString: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, sababa dawaa talaallii uumuuf yeroo dheeraa (giddugaleessaan ji’a 18) fudhatuu fi jijijjiiramuu CoVs’tiin rakkina kana dhabamsiisuun cimaadha.
en-mt: However, it is difficult to eliminate this problem because of the long time (average 18 months) to develop a vaccine and the evolution of CoVs.

sourceString: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
targetString: Akka dhibee haaraatti, COVID-19 qorannoowwan isaa kan kilinikaa guutuu karaa dhukkubsattoota kumaatamaatiin qulqullaa’uu eegale.
en-mt: As a new disease, COVID-19 began its full clinical trials through thousands of patients.

sourceString: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
targetString: Dhimmoota baay’ee keessatti, dhukkubsattoonni mudannoo dhibee biroo malee dhawaataan bayyaannachuu danda’u.
en-mt: In many cases, patients can recover quickly without the experience of other diseases.

sourceString: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
targetString: Garuu, akkuma SARS fi MERS, akkasumas COVID-19 dhukkubsattoota haala hamaa keessa jiran keessatti dhukkubbii fi duuti isaa ni guddata.
en-mt: But, like SARS and MERS, COVID-19 also increases morbidity and mortality in critically ill patients.

sourceString: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
targetString: Kanaafuu, moodeelii maalummaa dhukkubaa raaju dhukkubichaaf ijaaruun ejensoota kunuunsa fayyaatiif tajaajiloota isaaniif akka dursa kennaniif, keessattuu iddoowwan hanqina qabeenyaatti barbaachisaadha.
en-mt: Therefore, building a model for the disease that predicts the nature of disease is necessary for health care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-poor settings.

sourceString: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table ​(Table33):
targetString: Gabaasa qorannoo kilinikaa darbe irratti hundaa’uun, dhiibbaaleen armaan gadii qorannaa mallattoo dhukkubsattoota COVID-19’tiif godhamuun hubamuu malu yookaan wajjiin walitti makamuu malu (Gabatee ​(Gabatee33):
en-mt: Based on previous clinical trial reports, the following effects may be detected or combined with symptomatic testing in COVID-19 patients (Table 33):

sourceString: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.
targetString: Umrii: Umriin qorannaa SARS keessatti dhiibbaa guddaa kan qabuufi, COVID-19’fis akkasuma.
en-mt: Age: Age is a major factor in SARS testing, and so is COVID-1

sourceString: COVID-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
targetString: COVID-19 hedduminaan umurii 30-65 tti uumame isaan keessaa qu’annoo dhimmoota 8,866 akka armaan oliitti addeeffamee keessatti 47.7% dhukkubsattoota umurii 50 oliiti.
en-mt: COVID-19 predominantly occurred in the 30-65 age group of which 47.7% in the study of 8,866 cases as described above were patients over 50 years of age.

sourceString: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni yaala fayyaa addaa barbaadan wantoota walxaxaa qabaachuu danda’u akkasumas umriidhaan kanneen biro umriin caalu (jiddugalaan umrii 66 fi 51), umriiwwan jedhaman dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 irratti miidhaa fidu tilmaama keessa galchuuni.
en-mt: Patients requiring specialized medical treatment may have complications and others are older (average ages 66 and 51), taking into account the ages that affect COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.
targetString: Saala: SARS-CoV-2 dubartoota caalaa dhiirota hube (0.31/100,000 birqaba 0.27/100,000), akka armaan olitti ibsametti.
en-mt: Gender: SARS-CoV-2 affected men more than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.

sourceString: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
targetString: Dhukkubootaafi dhibeewwan dabalataa dhukkubaan booda dhufan: Dhukkubsattoonni COVID-19 waliinii kan kunuunsa cimaa barbaadan miidhamuu onnee akka tasaatiifi toora rukuttaa onnee gadhiisuutiin caalaatti dararamuu danda’u.
en-mt: Comorbidities and diseases: Comorbid COVID-19 patients who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from sudden cardiac arrest and cardiac arrest.

sourceString: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in SARS patients.
targetString: Taateewwan dhukkuba onnee waliin walqabatanis dhukkubsattoota SARS keessatti sababa du’aa ijoo turani.
en-mt: Cardiovascular events were also the main cause of death in SARS patients.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 koolanjoosaayitii pozatiivii ACE2 duuba akka jiru gabaafame, kunis dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 irratti miidhamuu tiruu fiduu danda’a.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 has been reported to be behind ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which can lead to kidney damage in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
targetString: Umrii fi dhibeewwan jalaan jiran biroo ciminaan akka walqabatanii fi walitti bu’uu akka danda’an hubannoo gaafata.
en-mt: It requires an understanding that age and other underlying diseases are strongly related and can conflict.

sourceString: Abnormal laboratory findings: The C-reactive protein (CRP) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
targetString: Qorannaa laabiraatoorii hin mirkanoofne: Sadarkaa C-reactive protein (CRP) dhiiga keessaa kan agarsiisu hammaachuun dhibee yookaan miidhamuun tishuu wantoota dhibee fiduu danda’an, kan waldhaansa deebisu, fi dandamachuu akka ta’an dhihaatee.
en-mt: Unconfirmed laboratory testing: Serum C-reactive protein (CRP) levels indicating disease exacerbation or tissue injury are proposed to be risk factors for disease, treatment response, and resistance.

sourceString: The correlation of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been proposed.
targetString: Walitti dhufeenyi CRP’n hammeenyaa fi qorannaa COVID-19 wajjiin qabus dhihaate.
en-mt: The relationship between CRP's severity and testing for COVID-19 was also presented.

sourceString: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may also help predict the outcome.
targetString: Dabalataan, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), fi creatine kinase (CK) dabalataan bu’aa raaguuf gargaaruu malu.
en-mt: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may additionally help predict outcome.

sourceString: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
targetString: Inzaayimoonni kunniin humnaan qaamota hedduu keessatti ibsamu, keessattuu onneefi tiruu, akkasumas yeroo miidhaa tishuutti gadhiifamu.
en-mt: These enzymes are strongly expressed in many organs, most notably the heart and kidney, and released during tissue injury.

sourceString: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
targetString: Kanaafuu, miidhamuu onnee fi tiruutiif isaan agarsiiftuu aadaati.
en-mt: Therefore, they are traditional indicators for heart and kidney injury.

sourceString: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
targetString: Mallattoolee kilinikaawaa gurguddoo: Raajiin laphee fi mallattooleen kilinikaawaa qabatamaan itti fufaa deeman dhimmoota kan biroo tilmaammii bu’aatiif akkasumas dhibeewwan dabalataa COVID-19’n uumaman wajjin tilmaama keessa galuu qabu.
en-mt: Major clinical signs: Cardiac prognosis and ongoing actual clinical signs should be taken into account along with other factors for outcome prediction as well as additional complications caused by COVID-1

sourceString: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Faayidaa istirooyidii: akka olitti ibsametti, istirooyidiin madiinummaa too’achuuf kan gargaaru yeroo hunda yaala dhibee daddarbaatiif fayyadu miidhaan madaan fidu hir’isa.
en-mt: Benefits of steroids: As mentioned above, steroids are used to control inflammation and are always useful for the treatment of infectious diseases.

sourceString: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
targetString: Erga hammi fudhannaa olaanaa corticosteroids bal’inaan dhukkubsattoota SARS itti hammaate keessatti fayyadaa irra oolee, namoonni bayyaannatan baay’een dhukkuba goggoguu ujummoolee dhiigaa hanqina qaamaa umurii guutuufi haala jireenyaa gadi bu’aa waliin dararamani.
en-mt: Since high doses of corticosteroids have been widely used in exacerbated SARS patients, many recovered patients have suffered from atherosclerosis with lifelong disability and poor quality of life.

sourceString: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kanaafuu, yoo barbaachise, astirooyidiin bifa xiqqaa ta’eenii fi dhukkubsattoota COVID-19’tiinis yeroo gabaabaaf fudhatamuu qaba.
en-mt: Therefore, if necessary, steroids should be taken in small doses and for a short period of time by COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
targetString: Dhiphina sammuu: Akka armaan olitti ibsametti, yeroo jalqabbii COVID-19 tti dhukkubsattoonni baay’een dhiphina addaatiin dararamaniiru isaan waan yeroo dheeraaf qofaatti baafamaniif akkasumas haala hin beekamne ol’aanaa keessa turaniif fi waan du’a miseensota maatii dhiyoofi dhukkubsattoota hiriyaa ta’an dhugaa ba’aniifi.
en-mt: Depression: As mentioned above, during the onset of COVID-19 many patients suffered from special depression because they were isolated for a long time and were in a highly unknown state and because of the deaths of close family members and fellow patients for the output.

sourceString: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
targetString: Gorsa xiinsammuu fi deeggarsa yeroo dheeraa dhukkubsattooti kunniin akka isaan dhiphina isaanii irraa bayyaannataniifi jireenya idileetti akka deebi’aniif gargaaruuf dhiyeessuun baay’ee barbaachisaadha.
en-mt: It is very important to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from their distress and return to normal life.

sourceString: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
targetString: Akka qorannaa qubsuma ummataa si’a darbeetti, COVID-19 amala qorannaa weeraraa irratti hundaa’uun SARS irraa garaagarummaa qaba..
en-mt: According to previous population settlement surveys, COVID-19 differs from SARS based on the characteristics of the outbreak survey.

sourceString: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 akkuma CoVs utaalloo nama qabsiisuu sana qaama hargansuu gadi aanaa keessatti wal horuun dabalatatti, qaama hargansuu olaanoo keessattis wal horu akkasumas sadarkaa jalqabaa irratti mallattoo salphaa yookaan agarsiisuus dhabuus danda’a.
en-mt: In addition to reproducing in the lower respiratory tract, like CoVs that infect people, SARS-CoV-2 also reproduces in the upper respiratory tract and may or may not show mild symptoms in the early stages.

sourceString: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
targetString: Kanaafuu, dhukkubsattoonni sadarkaa jalqabaatti yookaan yeroo hamma mallattoon mul’atuutti hubaman, to’annaa weerarichaaf rakkina guddaa uumuun yeroo sochiiwwan guyyaa guyyaatti vaayirasii hamma guddaa oomishuu danda’u.
en-mt: Therefore, patients who are diagnosed in the early stages or when symptoms appear, can produce significant amounts of virus during daily activities, making it more difficult for control of the outbreak.

sourceString: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
targetString: Ta’us, daddarbuun SARS-CoV yeroo dhukkubsattoonni haala hamaan isaan dhukkubu akka uumamu xiinxalamee ture, yeroo daddarbaan harki caalaa sadarkaa jalqabaatti hin uumaminitti.
en-mt: Yet, SARS-CoV transmission had been analyzed to occur when patients were severely ill, when most transmission did not occur in the early stages.

sourceString: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: Kanaafuu, weerarri COVID-19 kan yeroo ammaa SARS caalaa hamaa kan ta’ee fi too’achuuf ulfaataa kan ta’eedha.
en-mt: Therefore, the current COVID-19 outbreak is worse than SARS and more difficult to control.

sourceString: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Chaayinaatti Wuhaanii fi magaalota naannoo Sanaa cufuu dabalatee akkasumas walitti aansuudhaan hanga guutuu ummataatti adda foo’uudhaan tatamsa’ina SARS-CoV-2 hanqisuuf yeroo ammaatti tattaaffii guddaatu godhamaa jira.
en-mt: In China, efforts are currently being made to curb the spread of SARS-CoV-2, including the closure of Wuhan and surrounding cities and the continuous isolation of the entire population.

sourceString: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
targetString: Gochi kunneen diinagdee barbadeessaa kan jiran ta’us, lakkoofsi namoota haarawa qabamanii hir’ataa jira, kunis weerarichi hir’achaa jiraachuu mul’isa.
en-mt: Although these practices are devastating the economy, the number of new cases is decreasing, indicating that the outbreak is decreasing.

sourceString: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
targetString: Tilmaammiin fuulduratti baay’ee waanta gaarii abdatu jalqabbichi Bitootessatti akka xumuramuufi sadarkaan haalli isaa itti hir’atu ji’oota 3-4’f akka turu ture.
en-mt: The most optimistic forecast for the future was that the start would be completed in February and the decline would last for 3-4 months.

sourceString: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, ogeeyyonni tokko tokko kanarratti ilaalcha gaarii hin qabna..
en-mt: However, some experts are not positive about this.

sourceString: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
targetString: Paawul Haaanter, et al., COVID-19 akka tilmaametti, SARS caala dhukkubsa, bara 2020tti hin badu.
en-mt: Paul Hunter, et al., predicts that COVID-19 is more painful than SARS and will not disappear by

sourceString: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
targetString: Iraa Longiinii, eet aal., moodelii miidhaa weerarichaa raaguuf hundaa’ee fi SARS-CoV-2 ummata addunyaa lama-sadaffaa ni qaba yaanni jedhu dhihaate.
en-mt: Ira Longini, et al., developed a model to predict the damage of the outbreak and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 would infect two-thirds of the world's population.

sourceString: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
targetString: Gareen Kaanaadotaa SARS-CoV-2 furrii walakkeessa funyaanii fi qoonqoo dhukkubsattoota bayyannataniifi hospitaalicha torban 2 dura gadhiisan keessaatti argamuu gabaasan, kan vaayirasiin haaraa adda ba’e akkuma infiluweenzaa marsaan kan deddeebi’u ta’uu isaa agarsiisuun.
en-mt: A Canadian team reported the detection of SARS-CoV-2 in the mid-lip and throat rashes of recovered patients who left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, suggesting that the newly isolated virus is circulating like influenza.

sourceString: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
targetString: Ta’us, lakkoofsaan gadi bu’uu dhimmoota haaraa irratti hundaa’uun mallattooleen abdachiisan Chaayinaa keessatti uumamaniiru, tarsiimoowwan yeroo ammaa tarii hojjechaa jiraachuu isaanii agarsiisuun.
en-mt: Yet, based on a drop in the number of new cases, promising signs have emerged in China, suggesting that current strategies are probably working.

sourceString: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
targetString: Iboolaan jalqabatti dhimmoota miiliyoonaan lakka’amaniifi du’a miiliyoona walakkaa akka geessisutu raagame.
en-mt: Ebola was initially predicted to cause millions of cases and half a million deaths.

sourceString: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
targetString: Garuu, adda foo’insa murtaa’aa ta’een, dhukkubichi suuta suutaan too’annaa jala oolee jira.
en-mt: But, with certain improvements, the disease has slowly been brought under control.

sourceString: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
targetString: Akkuma SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2’nis vaayirasoota waliin qaama namaa keessatti argaman laafaa dhufanii yookaan vaayirasii dhibee fiduu hin dandeenye nama wajjiin jiraatan ta’aa dhufanii jiru.
en-mt: Like SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 is either weakening co-viruses in the human body or becoming a non-pathogenic co-existent virus.

sourceString: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is provided below (Fig. ​(Fig.55).
targetString: Wal bira qabiinsi weerara COVID-19 SARS fi MERS waliinii jalatti dhiyaateera (Fakkii. (Fakkii.55)
en-mt: A comparison of the COVID-19 outbreaks under the joint SARS and MERS is presented (Fig. ​ (Fig.55)

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 haala ol’aanaan karaa qufaa yookaan haxxissoo, akkasumas tarii karaa quunnamtii kallattii meeshaawwan vaayirasichaan faalaman waliin daddarba.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted most commonly through coughing or sneezing, and possibly through direct contact with infected objects.

sourceString: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
targetString: Vaayirasichi akkasumas bobbaawwan keessatti argameera, kan carraa haaraa daddarbuu bobbaawwanii-gara-afaanii kakaasu.
en-mt: The virus has also been detected in bobbins, which triggers a new possibility of bobbin-to-mouth transmission.

sourceString: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
targetString: Akka qorannoon dhiheenya kana dhukkubsattoota 138 irratti godhame gabaasetti 41% kan qabaman faalama noosokomiyaatiin, dhukkubsattoota 17 dhibee biraas qabanii fi hojjattoota yaala fayyaa 40 dabalatee.
en-mt: According to a recent study of 138 patients, 41% were infected with nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other diseases and 40 health workers.

sourceString: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
targetString: Kanaaf, of-eeggannoon guddaa nama eeguuf fayyadamamuu qaba, keessumattuu dhiheessitoota kunuunsa fayyaatiif, hojjettoota hawaasaaf, miseensota maatiif, hiriyootaa, fi eegdota dhukkubsatoota yookan namoota faalaman waliin quunnamtii qabaniifiyyuu.
en-mt: Therefore, great caution should be used to protect people, especially health care providers, community workers, family members, friends, and guards who have contact with patients or infected people.

sourceString: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
targetString: Sararri ittisa jalqabaa balaa dhukkubaan hubamuu xiqqeessuun ittiin danda’amu karaa golgaawwan fuulaa uffachuu; fayyadaminsa golgaawwan kutaa baqaqsanii hodhuu fi golgaawwan N95 ittiin harganuun danda’amu lachuu (series # 1860s) faffaca’insa vaayirasootaatiif to’achuuf gargaaru.
en-mt: The first line of defense to minimize the risk of infection is through wearing masks; the use of both operating room curtains and N95 respirable curtains (series # 1860s) to help control the spread of viruses.

sourceString: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
targetString: Golgaawwan fuulaa kutaa baqaqsanii hodhuu cophoota dhangala’oo ta’an nama haala cimaan hubame irraa qilleensa keessa deemuu yookaan dirrawwan meeshaalee irra qabachuu irraa, iddoo isaan kanneen biraatti darbuu danda’an ni ittisu.
en-mt: Operating room goggles prevent liquid droplets from traveling through the air from an acutely affected person or from catching on instrument surfaces, where they can be passed on to others.

sourceString: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
targetString: Ta’us, golgaawwan N95 (series # 1860s) qofaatu yeroo qilleensi gara keessaatti fudhatamu qabiyyee vaayirasii waliigalaa hamma 10 gara 80 nm tti xiqqaatan irraa eegumsa gochuu danda’a, qabiyyee vaayirasii waliigalaa 5% guutummaatti uranii lixan waliin; SARS-CoV-2’n SARS-CoV waliin hammamtaan walfakkaatoodha akkasumas lachuu tilmaamaan 85nm dha.
en-mt: Yet, only the N95 curtains (series # 1860s) can provide protection against total virus contents as small as 10 to 80 nm when air is taken in, with a total virus content of 5% fully sinking uranium; SARS-CoV-2 is similar in size to SARS-CoV and both are approximately 85nm.

sourceString: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
targetString: Wantoonni xixiqqoon haguugduu fuulaa kan yeroo baqaqsanii yaaluu walitti qabatan shan keessa darbuu waan danda’uuf, hojjattoonni yaala fayyaa kallattiidhaan dhukkubsataa wajjiin walqunnaman haguugduu baqaqsanii yaaluu osoo hin taane isa N95 (walqabataa # 1860s) kaawwachuu qabu.
en-mt: Because small objects can pass through the five masks that are collected during surgery, medical personnel in direct contact with the patient should wear the N95 (related # 1860s) mask instead of the surgical mask.

sourceString: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
targetString: Golgaawwanitti dabalataan, dhiyeessitoonni kunuunsa fayyaa wandaboo dheeraa qofaatti baasu kan gitu caalaatti quunnamtiii vaayirasootaa hir’isu uffachuu qabu.
en-mt: In addition to goggles, health care providers should wear more than just a long wandabo that reduces contact with viruses.

sourceString: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
targetString: Vaayirasichii namoota karaa ijaatiinis qabuu handa’a.
en-mt: The virus can also infect people through the eyes.

sourceString: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
targetString: Amajji 22, 2020 tti, doktarri tokko golgaa N95 uffatee jiraates SARS-CoV-2 hubameera; vaayirasichi gara qaama isaa keessaatti tarii dhiita ija isaa keessaan galee ta’uu danda’a.
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, a doctor wearing an N95 mask was also infected with SARS-CoV-2; the virus may have entered his body through a swelling in his eye.

sourceString: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
targetString: Kanaafuu, hojjattoonni yaala fayyaa yeroo dhukkubsataa wajjiin hojjatan haguugduu ijaa fi fuulaa agarsiisaa ta’e uffachuu qabu.
en-mt: Therefore, medical personnel should wear reflective eye and face masks when working with patients.

sourceString: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
targetString: Uummata waliigalaa iddoowwan dhiibbaan irra gahe yookaan haala jabaan dhiibbaan irra gaheef, namni hundumtuu harkoota isaanii saamunaa farra orgaanizimoota xixiqqootiin isa barame caalaa yeroo baay’ee dhiqachuu, qofaatti of-baasuu dhuunfaatiif mana turuu yaaluu akkasumas namoota haala jabaan hubaman waliin quunnamtii daangessuun haala ol’aanaan gorfamu.
en-mt: For the general population in affected or severely affected areas, everyone should wash their hands with antibiotic soap more often than usual, try to stay home for personal isolation alone and limit contact with severely affected people advised.

sourceString: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
targetString: Faanni sadi namoonni dhukkubsattoota irraa hiiquuf sirrii akka ta’etti fudhatama.
en-mt: Three fans are considered appropriate for people to remove patients.

sourceString: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Gochi kun tooftaa dhibee hir’isuu fi tatamsa’ina vaayirasiis ittisuuf ni fayyada.
en-mt: This practice is also useful as a strategy to reduce disease and prevent the spread of viruses.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 addunyaa dhala namaatti akka vaayirasii haaraatti dhufus akka gabaasa amajjii 7, 2020’tti SARS-CoV wajjiin kan wal fakkaatuu fi yaadannoo gadi fagoo SARS bara 2003 Chaayinaatti akeekkachiisa cimaa uumee ture.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV-2 entered the human world as a new virus, it was similar to SARS-CoV as reported on March 7, 2020 and the deep memory of SARS in 2003 had created a strong warning in China.

sourceString: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, hanga ammajjii 19, 2020’tti hoogganaan Giddugala Too’annoo Dhibee Wuhaan vaayirasiin haaraan dhukkubbii gadi bu’aa fi namootarraa namootatti walhoruu murtaa’aa kan qabu fi kun immoo ittisuu fi too’achuuf rakkina akka hin taane lammiileetti himuudhaan kan jajjabeessan hin turre.
en-mt: However, as of March 19, 2020, the head of the Wuhan Disease Control Center told citizens that the new virus has low morbidity and limited human-to-human transmission, which is not a problem to prevent and control they were not encouraging.

sourceString: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in Wuhan.
targetString: Ergaan kun haala ajaa’ibsiisaan akeekkachiisa uummataa qabbaneesseera, keessattuu yeroo biyyi guutummaan Ayyaana Birraaf (Spring Festival) qophaa’aa turetti, akkasumas yerichi murteessaan Wuhaan keessatti dhukkuba hamma xiqqaan qabaachuu isaatiin darbeera.
en-mt: The message dramatically cooled public alerts, especially as the entire country prepared for the Spring Festival, and the critical period passed with a small amount of disease in Wuhan.

sourceString: The disease control agencies in China may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
targetString: Ejensiiwwan to’annoo dhukkubaa Chaayinaa keessaa barumsa cimaa kana fudhachuufi fuulduraaf fooyya’insawwan murteessoo tolchuu malu.
en-mt: Disease control agencies in China may learn these strong lessons and make critical improvements in the future.

sourceString: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, ejensiiwwan kunniin (1) labsiiwwan uummataa yommuu labsanitti caalaatti of-eeggachuu qabu jechi hunduu lammiileef gatii qaba akkasumas ilaalcha isaaniifi murtoowwan isaanii jijjiiruu danda’a; (2) gabaasa seera qabeessa doktaroota yookaan qondaaltota irraa eeguu irra odeeffannoo waan baratame irraa adda ta’e kiliniikota irraatti caalaatti miira qabeessa ta’uufi yaada kennuu qabu; (3) uummata jajjabeessuu irra sadarkaa jalqabaa isaatti weerara qabachuuf caalaatti daangeffamuu qabu; akkasumas (4) caalaatti yeroo baay’ee karaa ittiin hubannoon kennamuu danda’u kan kaayyoo qabuufi bu’a qabeessa ta’e hubannoo uummataa waa’ee weerara dhukkubootaa dabaluuf dhiyeessuu akkasumas qorachuufi sirna deebii hawaasaa yeroo yerootti fooyyessuu qabu.
en-mt: For example, these agencies should (1) be more careful when issuing public decrees because every word has value for citizens and can change their attitudes and decisions; (2) they should be more sensitive to and comment on information that differs from what is common from clinics rather than waiting for legitimate reports from doctors or officials; (3) they should be more restricted to containing epidemics in their early stages rather than encouraging populations; and (4) more often offer objective and effective ways to increase public awareness of disease outbreaks as well as test and update public response systems on a regular basis.

sourceString: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the novel virus SARS-CoV-2 started in the end of December 2019.
targetString: Weerarri COVID-19 kan muudate sababa SARS-CoV-2 dhuma muddee 2019tti muudateeni.
en-mt: The COVID-19 outbreak was caused by the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak in late December

sourceString: In less than two months, it has spread all over China and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
targetString: Ji’oota lamaa gaditti, yeroo barreeffama kanaatti guutuu Chaayinaattii fi biyyoota biro 50’tti dhihaatan irra tatamsa’e.
en-mt: In less than two months, it spread throughout China and nearly 50 other countries at the time of writing.

sourceString: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurring.
targetString: Erga vaayirasichi SARS-CoV waliin baay’ee walfakkaataa ta’eefi akkasumas mallattooleen akkasuma COVID-19 fi SARS gidduu walfakkaatoo ta’anii, jalqabbiin COVID-19 miira irra deebi’ee jalqabuu SARS uumeera.
en-mt: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the onset of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS re-start.

sourceString: However, there are some remarkable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, COVID-19 fi SARS jidduu garaagarummaa ifaatu jira, kan weeraricha dhaabuu fi dhukkubsataa yaaluuf murteessaa ta’e.
en-mt: However, there are clear differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are crucial to stopping the outbreak and treating the patient.

sourceString: COVID-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
targetString: COVID-19 dargaggoota caala jaarsolii qaba, dubartoota caala dhiira qaba, fi hammi du’aa akkasuma dargaggeessa caala jaarsolii irratti ol kaa’a.
en-mt: COVID-19 affects more elderly people than young people, more men than women, and the mortality rate is also higher in elderly people than in young people.

sourceString: SARS has higher mortality than COVID-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
targetString: SARS COVID-19 (10.91% fi 1.44% yoo walbira qabamu) caalaa carraa ajjeesuu qaba.
en-mt: SARS is more likely to kill than COVID-19 (10.91% and 1.44% compared).

sourceString: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni COVID-19 yeroo mallattoo agarsiisuu hin eegalinittis nama biraatti ni dabarsu kan SARS immoo yeroo garmalee dhukkubsatetti nama biraatti dabarsa, kunis COVID-19 ittisuun SARS ulfaataadha.
en-mt: Patients will pass on COVID-19 even when they do not start showing symptoms and SARS will pass on when they are very sick, which makes SARS difficult to prevent.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kun gama tokkoon SARS-CoV-2 maaliif saffisaa fi bal’inaan akka tatamsa’u ibsa.
en-mt: This partly explains why SARS-CoV-2 is spreading so quickly and so widely.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Akkaataan taa’umsa yeroo maraa RNA SARS-CoV-2’f dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 muraasa keessatti negatiivii ta’uu danda’a.
en-mt: The regular sedentary pattern for SARS-CoV-2 RNA may be negative in a few COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: Karaa biraatiin, dhukkubsattoonni fayyan vaayirasichaaf irra deebi’anii positiivii ta’uu danda’u.
en-mt: Alternatively, patients who recover may test positive for the virus again.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: Argannoowwan kunniin balaa faffaca’insa vaayirasichaa haala ajaa’ibaan dabalu.
en-mt: These findings dramatically increase the risk of spreading the virus.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: Qorannoowwan saffisaan COVID-19 irratti godhamaa jiran irratti hundaa’uun, dhimmoonni murteessoon hedduun ammas furamuu qabu, akka armaan gadiitti:
en-mt: Based on the rapid research on COVID-19, several critical issues still need to be addressed, as follows:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 eessaa dhufe?
en-mt: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: Sanyiin homologii walfakkaataan 96% SARS-CoV-2 fi simbira halkanii lama kan CoVwwan SARS’n fakkaatanii gidduutti argamanis, ammayyuu nuyi SARS-CoV-2 simbirroota halkanii irraati jennee guduunfuu hin dandeenyu.
en-mt: Although 96% identical homology was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two nocturnal birds with SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from nocturnal birds.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: Sanyii bineensa akkamiitu vaayirasicha mandhee jalqabaa irraa tamsaasa, simbiroota halkanii jedhi, gara namaatti?
en-mt: What animal species spreads the virus from the original nest, say nocturnal birds, to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
