sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: Dandamannaan bineeldota manaa fi bosonaa qorannoon mirkanaa’e.
en-mt: The resistance of domestic and wild animals has been confirmed by research.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Sadaffaarratti, akkuma gararraatti tarreeffame, walfudhachuu fi madaqinsi SARS-CoV-2 sanyii sadaffaa keessatti kanneen tuqaatii simbirfa halkanii fi paangooliinii waliin qaban keessatti ta’uu danda’a.
en-mt: Third, as listed above, SARS-CoV-2 infection and adaptation may occur in third species that have contact with nightingales and pangolins.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: Barbaachiargama bineensota SARS-CoV-2f ammayyuu godhamaa jira.
en-mt: The search for SARS-CoV-2 animals is still ongoing.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Bineensa kanuu irraa adda baanaan CoVs daandaa sanyiiwwan bineensota garagaraa gidduu jiru mijeessuuf gama vaayirasiitiin dhiibbaawwan saditu jira.
en-mt: Apart from these animals, there are three viral pressures to facilitate the transmission of CoVs between different animal species.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Waan hundaa dura, hammamtaan latiinsa isaanii RNA walitti dhufeenya bakka walbuusuuti.
en-mt: First of all, the amount of their latitude is the RNA of the substitution relationship.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: Wal bira qabiinsa vaayirasii fuuncaa qeenxee RNA keessatti, hammi latiinsa CoVs tilmaamame kanaan ‘’giddugaleessaa’’ gara ‘’guddaa’’tti hamma dimshaashessa bakka bu’iinsaa ~10-4 ta’e marsaa waggaa 2’n, karaa madaqiinsa baattoo haaraa CoV irra dhaabatee.
en-mt: In the single RNA fungus virus comparison, the latency range of the predicted CoVs thus increased from “moderate” to “large” with substitution dimensions of ~10-4 in a 2-year cycle, through the adaptation of new CoV carriers standing on it.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: CoVs egzooribooniwuukles qaba, kan dhabamsiisa firiin isaa dandeetti jijjiiramu fi hir’achuu ta’eedha.
en-mt: CoVs have exoribonuclei, whose elimination results in a mutation and decrease in density.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Haala ajaa’ibsiisaadhaan, Reemdesiiviriin niwuukilootaayidii karaa ittisa egzooriboniwuukilasii kanaatiin fi RNA poolimireesii RNA hirkataatiin walhoruu CoV ittisa.
en-mt: Remarkably, Remdesivir prevents CoV replication through inhibition of nucleotides by this exoribonuclease and by RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: Reemdesiiviir bakka buutota farra SARS-CoV-2 ta’an keessa isa abdatamaa shaakalliwwan kilinikaa keessa jiru.
en-mt: Remdesivir is one of the most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents in clinical trials.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: Gonkumaa, hammii jijjiiramaa CoVs haguugduu isaarra si’a miiliyoona caala.
en-mt: Never, the variable amount of CoVs is a million times greater than its cover.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Dabalataan, hammi latiinsaa gaafa CoVs baattoo sanitti sirriitti hin madaqne olka’a.
en-mt: In addition, the amount of latency increases when the CoVs are not properly adapted to the carrier.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Hamma jijjiiramaa olaanaa SARS-CoV wajjiin yoo walbira qabamu, hammi jijjiirama SARS-CoV-2 gadi bu’aadha, agarsiistuu dhala namootatti madaqsuu sadarkaa olaanaa.
en-mt: Compared with the high mutation rate of SARS-CoV, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is low, indicating a high level of adaptation to humans.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Tilmaamaan, mandhee biroo isa kan namootatti dhihaatutti madaqee jira.
en-mt: Presumably, it has adapted to another nest that is closer to people.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Gaalota Eshi’aa dhihaa fi africaa kaabaa irratti kan hojjetame SARS-CoV-2, akkasumas MERS-CoV irrattis ni hojjeta.
en-mt: Developed in western Asian and north african camels for SARS-CoV-2, it also works for MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: Akka yaadaatti, hiikkaan jiinii kenniinsi talaallii fi dandamachiistonni farra SARS-CoV-2 kan hin fakkaannee fi faayidaa ariitii hin qabneedha.
en-mt: Ideally, gene translation delivery of anti-SARS-CoV-2 vaccines and tolerants is unlikely and lacks the advantage of speed.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Lammaffaa, jiinii guddaan RNA, CoVs keessatti addaba’iinsa latiinsaa fi qindatiinsa jiinii pilaastikummaa guddaa keessatti hojiirra oolchu, sababa kanaaf carraan uumamsaa sanyiiwwan keessoo ni dabala, kunimmoo CoVs haaraan gaafa haallan mijatan akka uumamuuf fayyada.
en-mt: Second, the large RNA genes, in CoVs, implement latinization and gene arrangement in great plasticity, therefore increasing the chances of internal species formation, which is useful for the formation of new CoVs when conditions are right.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Kunis waan addaa hedduun deggerama, faaya dubbisa banaa fi dalagaa pirootiinii xumura jiinii 3’ qindate.
en-mt: This is supported by a number of unique features, including open reading decoration and the function of the 3' end of the gene coordinated protein.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Sadaffaa, CoVs darbee darbees ta’ee walitti fufiinsaan yeroo RNA’n walbaay’isu of jijjiira.
en-mt: Third, CoVs transform themselves both occasionally and continuously during RNA replication.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: Baattuu akka maktuu hiddoota dhiigaatti tajaajiltu keessatti, fuuncaan bantuu irra deddeebiidhaan gaafa CoV RNA ni uumama.
en-mt: In a carrier that serves as a mixture of blood vessels, open lungs are formed repeatedly when CoV RNA is produced.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: Firooma dheeraa olaanaa fi RNAn CoV haaraa qindeessuun argamsiisuu danda’a.
en-mt: High long affinity and RNA can result in new CoV alignment.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: Ragaan walitti makama uumamaa fiiloojeenikii HCoV-HKU1 fi HCoV-OC43 keessatti akkasumas CoVs bineensaa kanneen akka SL-CoV simbira halkanii fi batCoV-HKU9 argaman.
en-mt: Evidence for natural phylogenetic integration was found in HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43 as well as in animal CoVs such as nightfowl SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Wal fudhachuun Baattuu fi vaayirasii tatamsa’ina isaa waliin walitti dhufeenya qaba.
en-mt: Transmission of the carrier and the virus is associated with its spread.

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Miidhaawwan vaayirasiin geessisu sadeen armaan olitti ilaalleen cinaatti, qaamni fudhatu vaayirasicha wajjiin walqunnamtii qabaachuun vaayirasichi sanyiiwwan garaagaraa gidduutti akka tamsa’u sababa ta’a.
en-mt: In addition to the three effects of the virus mentioned above, contact with the virus causes the virus to spread between different races.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: Kana irratti, walfudhatiinsi SARS-CoV akka fakkeenya gosaatti fudhatame, kunis ragaa gaafa sanyii keessoo daddarbiinsaa filannoo poosetiivii agarsiiseera.
en-mt: On this, the SARS-CoV infection was taken as a species example, which showed evidence of positive selection when internal seed transmission.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Xiinxala walbira qabaa adda foo’insa namaa fi siiveet SARS-CoVs irratti hundaa’uun, SARS-CoV mandheewwan garagaraa keessatti saffisaan akka madaqu, addatti jijjiirama RBD pirotiinii S wajjiin.
en-mt: Based on a comparative analysis of the specificity of human and mouse SARS-CoVs, it is concluded that SARS-CoV adapts rapidly to different hosts, specifically with changes in the RBD of the S protein.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: Walumaagalatti, RBD’n pirootiinii s kan CoV keessatti fudhattuu seelii fi duubdeebii dandamannaa baattoo irraa adda ba’a.
en-mt: In summary, the RBD of the protein s in CoV diverges from the cellular receptor and carrier resistance feedback.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: SARS-CoV keessatti, RBDn faffaca’iinsa S1 aminoo asiidii keessatti 318ffaa haga 510ffaa gidduu jira, kunis gara ACE2 namaatti kan hidhu akkasumas, galumsa wiirtuu kan vaayirasiiti.
en-mt: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is located between the 318th to 510th amino acid in the S1 scatterplot, which binds to human ACE2 as well as, the core syntax of the virus.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: RBD’n SARS-CoV dandeettiin adda baafachuu fudhattuu ACE2 bineensota garaagaraa kanneen akka simbira halkanii, siiveet fi saree vaayirasiin sanyiiwwan garaagaraa gidduutti akka daddarbu taasisa.
en-mt: The SARS-CoV RBD's ability to recognize the ACE2 receptor in various animals such as nocturnal birds, civets and cats allows the virus to be transmitted between different species.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Dhugaamatti, aminoo asiidii 6 qofatu qoratamee kan namaafi siiveetii adda ba’uun RBD keessaa 4 fuuncaa fudhattuu ACE2 waliin hundeessuudha.
en-mt: In fact, only 6 amino acids have been studied that differ between human and civet to establish 4 of the RBDs with the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: siiveetiin SARS-CoV jijjiirama RBD keessaa K479N fi S487T qabu ispaayik pirotiinii fi ACE2 dhala namaa walitti harkisa.
en-mt: a SARS-CoV sieve with K479N and S487T mutations within the RBD pulls together the spike protein and human ACE2.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: Jecha biroon, bakka bu’eewwan lamman aminoo asiidii kunneen vaayirasiin gara namootaatti madaquu danda’u.
en-mt: In other words, these two amino acid substitutes can be adapted to humans by viruses.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 simattuu seelii walfakkaataa SARS-CoV waliin qooddachuun isaa waan raajeffatamu miti.
en-mt: It is not surprising that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular host as SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: 30% garaagarummaa SARS-CoV-2 fi SARS-CoV gidduu yuuniitii S1 pirootiinii S keessatti akka ibsutti wal qabatiinsi garaagartummaa pirootiinii S ACE2 namootaa wajjin jijjiiramuu danda’a.
en-mt: The 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein suggests that the association of the S protein variant with human ACE2 may be altered.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: Qorannoon cryo-EM jedhu akka agarsiisutti ACE2 namaa fi pirootinii SARS-CoVs gidduu hidhaa guddaa 10 hamma 20 ga’utu jira jedha.
en-mt: Cryo-EM studies suggest that there are 10 to 20 significant bonds between human ACE2 and the SARS-CoVs protein.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Tatamsa’ina SARS-CoV-2’tiif koorseptariin biroo barbaachisuu akka danda’u hubachuun barbaachisaadha.
en-mt: It is important to note that other coreceptors may be required for the spread of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: Haala ajaa’ibsiisaa ta’ee HCoV-NL63’iis gara ACE2 maxxana garuu kutaa S addaati.
en-mt: Remarkably HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but is S class specific.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: Fudhattoonni HCoV kanneen akka amiinoopeeptidees N HCoV-229E, fi 9-O-aseetileetid siyaalik asiidii HCoV-OC43 hedduutu jira.
en-mt: There are several HCoV receptors such as aminopeptidase N HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Erga bineeldota irraa keessoo sanii isaaniin gara namaatti daddarbanii boodas CoVs nama waliin haala gaariin madaquu danda’u.
en-mt: Even after they are transmitted from animals to humans through their intestines, CoVs can adapt well to humans.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Simattuu seelii irratti argamu irratti dabalamee, akkaataan daddarba sanyiiwwan keessoo HCoVs haala battuu vaayirasii kanaatiin hoogganama.
en-mt: Added to the receptor on the cell, the mode of transmission of the internal progeny of HCoVs is also driven by the bacteriological state of the virus.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: Garaagarummaan mandhee pirotiinii dhala namaa fi mandheewwan uumamaa HCoVs kanneen akka simbiroota halkanii, gaalaa fi bineensota alala guuran tatamsa’ina sanyiiwwan garaagaraa gudduutti ta’urratti daangaa uumuu danda’a.
en-mt: Differences in human protein hosts and natural hosts of HCoVs such as nocturnal birds, camels and reptiles may limit the spread of a wide variety of species.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: HCoV vaayirasiin jedhamu daangaa baattuu sanaa cabsuun maxxantuu ta’ee humnaan itti gala, sana booda wal-horuu fi daddarbuu jalqaba.
en-mt: HCoV, a virus, breaks through the boundaries of the carrier, becomes attached, and begins to reproduce and spread.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: Kana waliin wal qabatee, murteessitooonni moliikulii naannoowwan baattoo fayyadoo vaayirasii adda ba’ee fi qindeeffamee tura.
en-mt: In this regard, the molecular determinants of the beneficial viral carrier regions remain identified and coordinated.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: Jiinii bal’aan qulqulleeessituu baattoo sababa madaala isaa eeggate aartii teekinoloojii CRISPR fayyadsmuun milkaa’uu danda’a.
en-mt: A wide range of gene purifiers can be successful because of the balanced art of using CRISPR technology.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: Garaagarummaan simbira halkanii fi CoVs vayirasii haaraa HCoVs akka baramuuf carraa kenne.
en-mt: Differences between nightbirds and CoVs provided the opportunity for new viral HCoVs to be learned.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: Miira kana keessatti, CoVs simbira halkanii akka hidda sanyii HCoVs’tti gargaara.
en-mt: In this sense, nightbird CoVs help as lineages for HCoVs.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: Dabalataan, latiinsa battalaa fi qindatiinsi jenetiksiis HCoV jijjiirraa uumamaa geggeessuu fi adeemsa kana keessattis akka tartiiba barbaachisoo lamaatti tajaajila.
en-mt: Additionally, the immediate latency and genetic alignment of HCoV drive natural transformation and serve as two important sequences in this process as well.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, barbaaduu ykn dhabuu pirootiinii jiinii moggaasuun isaanii bifa jabaan feenootaayippii vaayirasii fooyyessuuf dandeettii qaba.
en-mt: For example, wanting or not naming gene proteins has the potential to modify viral phenotypes in solid form.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: Pirootiiniiwwan gargaartuu SARS-CoV keessaa, ORF8 madaqqii vaayirasii simbira halkanii se’amaa ture, akka SARS-CoV simbira halkaniirraa madde garuu pirootiniin ORF8 argamu garaagara.
en-mt: Among the SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 was thought to be an adaptation of the nocturnal bird virus, as SARS-CoV originated from nocturnal birds but the ORF8 protein available is different.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: Amalli balleessuu 29 nuukilootaayidii SARS-CoVs, yaalii adda baasuu jalqaba weerarsa dhibee namaa keessatti argame.
en-mt: The destruction characteristic of the 29 nucleotides of SARS-CoVs, was discovered in the early human outbreak diagnostic experiments.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: Haquun kun ORF8 gara ORF8a fi ORF8b’tti adda baasa, akkasumas adeemsa jijjiirraa sanyii madaqsuu mandhee jijjiiru beeksisa jedhamee yaadama.
en-mt: This deletion segregates ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b's, and is thought to promote a transgenic process that alters nest adaptation.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Cinaatti, SARS-CoV aalfaa- fi gaammaa-CoVs wajjiin seenaa walitti dhiheenya sanyummaa kan diqaalomsuun guddaan RNA-hirkataa fi RNA pooliimerees gidduu jiru itti adda bahe qaba.
en-mt: In parallel, SARS-CoV has a closely related history with alpha- and gamma-CoVs in which a major dichotomy between RNA-dependent and RNA polymerases has been identified.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: Bakki qindeeffama haaraas nsp9 keessatti adda baafameera, nsp10 baayinaan akkasumas qaamota nsp14.
en-mt: New coordination sites were also identified in nsp9, predominantly nsp10 as well as components of nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Gaalota Saa’ud Arabiyaa irratti qorannoo taasifameen vaayirasiin MERS-CoV sanyii isaa kessatti irra deebi’ee of ijaaruu akka danda’u barameera.
en-mt: Tests on Saudi camels have shown that the MERS-CoV virus can replicate in its offspring.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: SARS-CoV biratti MERS-CoV amala of ijaaruu HCoVs keessatti argameera. HCoVs bineensota kan biro waliin jiinii caasaa hin qabneen wal-fudhata.
en-mt: Among SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV has been found in the self-replicating behavior of HCoVs. HCoVs interact with other animals by unstructured genes.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: Filannoon fakkeessaa jijjiirama hin eegamne vaayirasii jeenoomii keessatti fiduu waan danda’uuf eeggannoon godhamuu qaba, hedduun isaanii dhiibbaa dhukkubbii vaayirasii hir’isu, kanneen akka baattoo dandeettii ittisa qaamaa.
en-mt: Caution should be exercised as pseudo-selection can introduce unexpected changes in the viral genome, many of which reduce the pathogenic effect of viruses, such as immune carriers.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: Fakkeenyi bu’aawwan dheerina guutuu kanneenii ORF4, HCoV-229E keessatti fuuncaa pirootootaayippii, gara haqiinsa nuukilootaayidii lamaatti kan qooduudha.
en-mt: An example of these full-length derivatives is that ORF4, the prototypic tail in HCoV-229E, splits into two nucleotide deletions.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: Yeroo ORF4 hin miidhamne vaayirasii simbira halkanii fi gaala keessai ilaalamu HCoV-229E ewaliin walitti siqata, alpaca alpha-CoV kan agarsiisu nuukilootaayidii qeenxee galchuun waan keessa galu jijjiira.
en-mt: When intact ORF4 is observed in nocturnal and camel viruses, it binds to HCoV-229E, which inserts a single nucleotide indicating alpaca alpha-CoV.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: Xumurrratti garuu gadaanaa kan hin taane, adeemsi suutaa HCoVs haaraas dhiibbaa filannoo baattoon oofama.
en-mt: Finally, not least, the slow progression of new HCoVs is also driven by carrier selection pressure.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: Mallattoon ykn mallattoowwan salphaa qofti gaafa simbiroonni halkanii CoVs dhaan hubaman argame, kunis madaqiinsa CoVs fi simbira halkanii gidduu jiru madda godhachuuni.
en-mt: Only mild signs or symptoms were observed when nocturnal birds were infected with CoVs, attributing this to the adaptation between CoVs and nocturnal birds.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: Akka argamutti simbirroonni halkanii qaama isaanitiinis ta’e, keessa isaaniitiin CoVs walitti madaqaniiru.
en-mt: It turns out that nightbirds have adapted to CoVs both physically and internally.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, hanqinni si’eessuu deebii farra summii simbiroota halkanii qorannoo dhibee CoVs’n gaggeeffame hir’isa.
en-mt: For example, lack of magic reduces the antitoxin response of nocturnal birds in studies of CoVs.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: Cinaatti, gochoonni uumamaa ajjeestota seelii simbiroota halkanii sababa mandhee ajjeeftuu seelii jijjiiramoo NKG2/CD94 fi waldanda’uu meembireenii molekiyuulii kutaa I’tiin addaan cite.
en-mt: Beside, the natural actions of nocturnal avian cell killers were interrupted due to the killer nest of NKG2/CD94 mutant cells and membrane compatibility of the class I molecule.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: Dabalataanis, sadarkaa olaanaan ROS gocha meetaaboolikii olaanaa simbira halkanii irraa CoV fiduun dhiibbaa hamaa dhaqqabsiisuu danda’a, haala kanaan filannoon dhiibbaa vaayirasii daddarbiinsaa olaanaa baattoo haaraa keessatti argame geggeessa.
en-mt: Additionally, high levels of ROS may adversely affect the high metabolic activity from nocturnal birds causing CoV, in which case selection leads to the high viral transmissibility effect found in new carriers.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: Maxxantoonni dhukkuba namatti fidan kan vaayirasii CoCs of ijaaraa nanna’u, haala kanaan pirootinii haaraa uummachaa baattuu waliin wal-baru(madaqu)
en-mt: The pathogenic printers of the virus circulate by building themselves CoCs, thus adapting(adapting) to the carrier by forming new proteins

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: Haala kanaan, HCoVs haaraan sadii kan jaarraa lamman darbanitti mudatan akka carraa miti.
en-mt: Thus, the occurrence of three new HCoVs in the last two centuries is not a coincidence.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: CoVs’n bineensota irraagara namaattib hin daddarban akkasumas mallattoon kuusaa baattoo kanneen akkasimbira halkaniifi gaalaati.
en-mt: CoVs are not transmitted from animals to humansb and the signs of carrier reservoirs are nocturnal birds and camels.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: Osoo ittisa madiinummaa mandhee cimaa keessaa hin bahin wal baay’isuu danda’u.
en-mt: They can reproduce without leaving the strong nest defense.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: Iccitiin waa’ee baattota dhukkubaa mallattoo maleeyyii fi maaltu dhala namaatti dhukkuba hammeessa jedhu soba.
en-mt: The mystery about asymptomatic carriers and what makes disease worse in humans is a lie.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: Mallattoowwan dhukkubaa cimoon adda durummaan hyperactivation dandeettii ittisa qaamaa fi saayitookaayinii dandeettii ittisa qaamaa cimaa, somba haala ulfaataa ta’een huba.
en-mt: Severe disease symptoms are primarily hyperactivation of the immune system and severe immune cytokines, severely affecting the lungs.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: Faallaa kanaa, baattoonni mallattoo hin qabne deebiin madiinummaa walhoruu CoV irraa adda bahe.
en-mt: In contrast, asymptomatic carriers differed from the median response to CoV reproduction.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: Tarsiimoo wal fakkaataa dandeettii ittisa qaamaa adda baasuun yaala -SARS-CoV-2’f bu’aa gaarii qabaachuu mala.
en-mt: Similar immune detection strategies may have positive implications for the treatment of -SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: Deebiin Interfiiroon kan simbirootaa halkanii addatti cimaadha.
en-mt: The Interferon response of nocturnal birds is particularly strong.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: Kanaafuu, haggansi intarfiiraan gosa tokkoffaa yoo xiqqaate sadarkaa jalqabaa faalama SARS-CoV-2 nama keessatti fayyadamaa ta’uu qaba.
en-mt: Therefore, type I interferon coverage should be useful at least in the early stages of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: Dabalataan, NLRP3 inflammasome activation kan jedhamu simbira halkanii keessatti hanquudha.
en-mt: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation is impaired in night owls.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Sababoota kanaan, NLRP3 MCC950’n dhoksuun yaala COVID-19’tiif faayidaa qabaachuu danda’a.
en-mt: For these reasons, silencing of NLRP3 by MCC950 may be useful for COVID-19 therapy.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: Argamni SARS-CoV-2 yaada waliigalaa dagaagina SARS-CoV fi MERS-CoV hordofsiise.
en-mt: The discovery of SARS-CoV-2 followed the general hypothesis of the development of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: beta-CoV’n simbira halkanii SARS-CoV wajjiin niwuukilootaayidii 95% qooddatu argame, akksumas bat-CoV’n niwuukilootaayidii hoomoolojii 96% SARS-CoV-2 wajjiin qooddatutu jira.
en-mt: beta-CoV was found to share 95% nucleotides with nightbird SARS-CoV, and there is bat-CoV that shares 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: Xirinyii fi bineensonni kan biroon gabaa irra jiran bakka mijataa vaayirasii hedduun kan akka SARS-CoV fakkaatan hedduutu keessatti argama. Kallattiidhaa baattuun SARS-CoV-2 addaan hin baafamiin jira.
en-mt: Squirrels and other animals on the market are a breeding ground for many viruses such as SARS-CoV. The direct carrier of SARS-CoV-2 has not been identified.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Paangooliinii beta-CoVsfirooma adda ta’een gara SARS-CoV-2tti argame, paangoolinootni akka baattoo giddugaleessaa tokkootti tajaajiluu ykn paangooliinii beta-CoVs gara uumamsa xumuraa SARS-CoV-2 faffaca’iinsa jiinii uumuu danda’u.
en-mt: Pangolin beta-CoVsfound with unique affinity to SARS-CoV-2, pangolins may serve as an intermediate carrier or pangolin beta-CoVs to the ultimate creation of SARS-CoV-2 gene dispersal.

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: Gaaffiiwwan kan jiran yoo ta’ellee, ragaan SARS-CoV-2 itti yaadamees ta’u dingataan namaan akka uumame ibsu hin jiru.
en-mt: Despite questions, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 was intentionally or accidentally caused by humans.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: CoVs’n dhukkuba battalaa SARS-CoV-2 irraa kan ka’e gara fuulleffannoo harkisuutti deebi’eera.
en-mt: CoVs have returned to the focus due to the immediate outbreak of SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: Qo’annoon CoVs simbiroota halkanii fi bineensota biroo irratti godhamu miira barbaachisummaa madda zoonootikii fi golga bineensa HCoVs namatti daddarbuu miira keenya jijjiiree jira.
en-mt: Studies of CoVs in nocturnal birds and other animals have changed our sense of the importance of zoonotic sources and animal veils of HCoVs transmission to humans.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: Ragaan gadi fagoon akka agarsiisetti SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV fi SARS-CoV-2 bu’uura simbiroota halkanii qabu, akkasumas karaa mandhee yerootiin gara namootatti daddarbu.
en-mt: Deep evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a nocturnal bird basis, and are transmitted to humans through temporary nests.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: Dhibeen SARS-CoV gabaa keessatti waltuttuquu dhala namaa fi bineensa ‘civet’ jedhamuu irraa madduudhaan walqabatee gabaa cufanii bineensicha ajjeesuun tatamsa’ina SARS ni dhaaba.
en-mt: SARS-CoV is caused by human contact with a civet in the market and closing the market and killing the animal will stop the spread of SARS.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Sababeessa qal fakkaataan, paangoliiniin sababa ittisa daddarbiinsa dhibee bineeldota irraa gara namaaf gabaa keessaa baafamuu qaba, argamsa sanyii paangoliinii yeroo ilaallu beta-CoVs’n SARS-CoV-2 waliin walitti siqeenya qaba.
en-mt: For similar reasons, pangolins should be removed from the market for the prevention of animal-to-human transmission, given the availability of pangolin breeds that beta-CoVs are related to SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: Yoo ta’eyyuu, haalli tatamsa’iinsa SARS-CoV-2 kara paangooliinii fi hoosistoota kan biroo gara namootaatti daddarbu ammas gara fuulduraatti qorannoon qulqullaa’uu qaba.
en-mt: However, the mode of transmission of SARS-CoV-2 to humans via pangolins and other mammals still needs to be clarified in the future.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: Gama biroon immoo, MERS-CoV vaayirasiin jedhamu kun yeroo dheeraaf Gaalota Eshi’aa dhihaa fi Africaa kaabaa keessa jiraataa tureera.
en-mt: On the other hand, the MERS-CoV virus has long lived in western Asian Camels and northern Africa.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: Gaalli kun meeshaa imalaa murteessaatti tajaajila, akkasumas akka madda foonii, aannanii, oomisha gogaa fi oomisha uffataatti tajaajila.
en-mt: The camel serves as a crucial means of travel, as well as a source of meat, milk, leather products and clothing production.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: Bal’inaan gama baha giddugaleessaa fi afrikaatti babal’ataniiru.
en-mt: They have spread widely across the Middle East and Africa.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Sababa kanaaf, baballachuu SARS-CoV fi SARS-CoV-2 ittisuuf akka bineeldota bosonaarratti chaayinaa keessatti godhame to’annoo MERSf gaalota hunda aarsaa gochuun hin danda’amu.
en-mt: For this reason, it is not possible to sacrifice all camels for MERS control as was done in wildlife in China to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: Weerara MERS yeroo ammaa kana dhaabuuf, tooftaalee too’annaa dhukkubootaa biroo wajjiin walitti dabaluun talaalliin amansiisaa ta’e kan MERS-CoV ittisu gaalaaf qophaa’uu qaba.
en-mt: To stop the current MERS outbreak, a reliable vaccine against MERS-CoV should be developed for camels in combination with other disease control strategies.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: Vaayirasii kana guutumatti dhabamsiisuun waan hin danda’amneef jiinootaayippiin haarofni weerara fidu mul’achuu danda’a.
en-mt: Since the virus cannot be completely eradicated, a new genotype may emerge that causes the invasion.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: Zoonootik CoVs garaagaraatu bosona keessa marmaaraa jira.
en-mt: Various zoonotic CoVs are roaming the forest.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: Muraasa, simbira halkanii irraa kan dhufu CoVs fi bineeldota irraa gara namaatti kan darbu garaa garummaa qaba.
en-mt: Few, CoVs from nocturnal birds and animal-to-human transmission vary.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: Carraawwan CoVs ittiin dagaaganii fi walitti makaman hedduutu jira, mul’achuu CoVs haarawaa baay’ee daddarboo ta’anii fi ajjeesanii hordofsiisaa jira.
en-mt: There are many opportunities for CoVs to develop and combine, leading to the emergence of new highly infectious and lethal CoVs.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: Aadaan bineensota bosonaa nyaachuu Chaayinaa iddoo tokko tokkotti mul’atu waltuttuqqaa namaa fi bineensota gidduu jiru hir’isuuf balaaleffatamuu qaba.
en-mt: The culture of eating wild animals in some parts of China should be condemned to reduce contact between humans and animals.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Rakkina SARS, MERS fi COVID-19, irraakan ka’e qophiifi deebiin iddootti qophaa’uu ta’a.
en-mt: The crisis of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, will be preparedness and response on the spot.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: Dhugaamatti, vaayirasootni baay’een plaanetiirra yeoo dheeraaf turaniiru.
en-mt: In fact, many viruses have been on the planet for a long time.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Hamma carraan bahaa argamutti hammattuuwwan uumamaa isaanii keessa turu.
en-mt: They remain in their natural embraces until an eastern opportunity presents itself.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Simbirroonni halkanii mallattoowwan vaayirasii tamsaasuu ishee agarsiisan hedduu qabaattus karaan itti dhalli namaa simbiroota halkanii fi bineensota bosonaa biroo wajjiin tuttuqqaan qaba hir’achuu danda’u haala kamiin namoonni haala itti isaan irraa fagaatan irratti yoo barataniidha.
en-mt: Although nightingales have many signs of spreading viruses, the only way humans can reduce their contact with nightingales and other wildlife is if people learn how to stay away from them.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: Bineensa harma hoosisoo ta’an itti fufiinsaan hordofuun naannawa golga uumamaa CoVs baruuf fayyada, kunis gara fuulduraatti tatamsa’ina dhibee bineensaa fi nama gidduutti gara fuulduraa uumamuu danda’u beekuu fi too’achuuf fayyada.
en-mt: Continuous monitoring of mammals is useful for learning about the natural vector environment of CoVs, which is useful for detecting and controlling future outbreaks of disease between animals and humans.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Guduunfuudhaaf, karaan bu’a qabeessi babal’achuu vaayirasii ittiin ttifnu namootaaf- bakka biqiloota vaayirasii huboo ta’an qaburraa fagaachuudha.
en-mt: In summary, the most effective way to prevent the spread of the virus is to stay away from people—where there are virus-contaminated plants.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Sanyiiwwan SARS-CoV-2 hedduun hanga ammaatti badaa jiru.
en-mt: Many strains of SARS-CoV-2 are still disappearing.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Jalqaba, yoo simbirri halkanii vaayirasii SARS-CoV-2 paangoliiniitti dabarsan, haala akkamii keessatti simbirri halkanii fi paangoliiniin bakka jireenyaa tokko qooddachuu isaanii arguun nama fayyada.
en-mt: First, if nocturnal birds transmit the SARS-CoV-2 virus to pangolins, it would be useful to see under what circumstances nocturnal birds and pangolins share the same habitat.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Lammaffaa irratti, gara namaatti dabarsuuf yoo simbira halkaniitu ga’ee guddaa qaba ta’eef, akkamittiin namoonni simbira halkanii wajjin wal-tuttuqu kan jedhu yaadamuu qaba.
en-mt: Second, if nightingales play a major role in transmission to humans, how people interact with nightingales should be considered.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Sadaffaa, yoo bineensi hoosisaan akka mandhee giddugaleessa dhugaatti tajaajila ta’e, nama dabalatee sanyiiwwan biroo wajjiin akkamitti akka walqunnamu, simbirroonni halkanii yookaan Paangoliiniin adda bahuu qabu.
en-mt: Third, if the mammal serves as a true central nest, how it interacts with other species, including humans, should be distinguished by nightbirds or Pangolins.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: Walumaagalattu, erga hoosiftoonni beeyiladootas dabalatee SARS-CoV-2 saaxilamoo ta’anii too’annoo fi qorannoon dhukkubichaa gaggeeffamuu qaba.
en-mt: In general, since mammals, including animals, are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, disease control and testing should be conducted.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Simbira halkanii ta’uu qaba, paangoliinii ykn hoosiftoota biroo, SARS-CoV-2 ykn vaayirasiiwwan maatiiwwan warra adda ba’anii wajjin baattoowwan uumamaa fuulduraa ta’uusaatu eegama.
en-mt: Should it be nocturnal birds, pangolins or other mammals, SARS-CoV-2 or viruses with isolated parent families are expected to be future natural carriers.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Qorannoon naannoo kanatti itti fufe karaa daddarbiinsa SARS-CoV-2 bineensota keessatti, ittisaa fi to’annoo COVID-19 nama keessatti qabu gabaasa barbaachisaan ni ibsa.
en-mt: Ongoing research in this area on the route of transmission of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, and the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans will provide an important report.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: Ulaagaa qorannaa mallattoo “nama shakkamaa” fi “nama mirkaneeffamaa” COVID-19 fooyyessuun barbaachisaadha.
en-mt: The criteria for testing for “suspected” and “confirmed” symptoms of COVID-19 need to be improved.

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Gurraandhala 6, 2020, gartuun keenya gorsa qajeelcha qo’annoo fi yaalii bara 2019 dhibee vaayirasii koroonaa haaraa (2019-nCoV) dhiyeesse; qajeelchi kun immoo muuxannoo keenya qooduu fi weeraricha akka addunyaatti to’achuuf hube-uumaa gaariidha.
en-mt: On November 6, 2020, our team presented the 2019 research and trial guideline recommendations for the new coronavirus (2019-nCoV); this guide is a good hub for sharing our experiences and controlling the attack globally.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, dhibeen vaayirasii koroonaa 2019 (COVID-19) dhibee haaraadha, argannoowwan qo’annoo adeemsifamaa jiraniitii fi muuxannoo shaakala dhukkubsattootaa irratti hundaa’uudhaan hubannoo fi beekumsi keenya suuta guddataa deemaa jira; kanaaf, malawwan ittiin mallattoo qorataniifi wal’aananis itti fufiinsaan fooyya’aa jiru.
en-mt: However, the 2019 coronavirus (COVID-19) is a new disease, and our understanding and knowledge is slowly growing based on ongoing research findings and patient practice experiences; therefore, methods of diagnosing and treating symptoms are continuously improving.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: Xalayaa kana keessatti, qajeelfama keenya irratti yaada tokkoof deebii kenninee ulaagaa mallattoo qorachuu haarawa, kan “namoota shakkaman” fi “namoota qabamuun isaanii mirkanaa’e” jedhu dhiyeessine, akkaataama Qajeelfamoota Qorannoo Mallattootii fi Wal’aansa COVID-19 isa baay’ee dhiyoo (marsaa torbaffaa) isa Koree Biyyoolessaa Fayyaa Rippaabilika Uummata Chaayinaatiin gad dhiifame.
en-mt: In this letter, we responded to a comment on our guidelines and proposed new symptom testing criteria, for “suspected persons” and “confirmed cases”, in accordance with the most recent COVID-19 Symptom Testing and Treatment Guidelines ( seventh cycle) released by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Vaayirasii koroonaa 2019 inni haaraan (2019-nCoV), inni amma seerumaan dhukkuba vaayirasii koroonaa 2019 (COVID-19) jedhamee moggaafamee vaayirasiin isaa immoo mallattoo rakkoo hafuuraa hamaa vaayirasii koroonaa 2 (SARS-CoV-2) jedhamee moggaafame, Muddee 2019 keessa jalqabe.
en-mt: The new 2019 coronavirus (2019-nCoV), which is now officially named coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and whose virus is named the symptoms of severe respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), began in December

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: Bitootessa 11 bara 2020 dhaabbanni fayyaa addunyaa (WHO)n COVID-19 dhibee weerara addunyaa jedhee moggaase.
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a global pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: Dhukkuba SARS-CoV-2 ittisuuf gareen keenya qajeelfama gorsa atattamaa baasee jira, kun immoo Gurraandhala 06, 2020 Qo’annoo Fayyaa Loltuu keessatti toora intarneetiirratti maxxanfamee jira.
en-mt: To prevent SARS-CoV-2, our team has issued emergency advisory guidelines, which were published online on January 06, 2020 in the Soldier Health Study.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: Erga maxxanfamee qalbii namoota hedduu hawwatee jira.
en-mt: Since its publication, it has captured the hearts of many.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, dhibeen COVID-19 dhibee haaraa ta’uu hubadhu, hubannoo fi beekumsi keenya immoo argannoowwan qo’annoo adeemsifamaa jiraniitii fi muuxannoo shaakala dhukkubsattootaa irratti hundaa’uudhaan suuta guddataa deemaa jira; kanaaf, malawwan ittiin mallattoo qorataniifi wal’aananis itti fufiinsaan fooyya’aa jiru.
en-mt: However, note that COVID-19 is a new disease, and our understanding and knowledge is slowly evolving based on ongoing research findings and patient practice experiences; therefore, methods of diagnosing and treating symptoms are continuously improving.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, Qajeelfamoonni Mallattoolee Qorachuutii fi Wal’aansaa COVID-19f Koree Fayyaa Biyyoolessaa Rippaabiliikii Uummattootaa Chaayinaatiin gad dhiifame (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), Amajjii 16 2020 hanga Bitootessa 3, 2020 keessatti, maxxansaalee waliigalaa torba kanneen haalonni isaanii tokko tokko baay’ee jijjiiramanii baasee jira.
en-mt: For example, the Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Symptoms for COVID-19 released by the National Health Committee of the Peoples' Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), from March 16, 2020 to February 3, 2020, included seven total editions of the conditions some of them have been changed a lot.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Qajeelfama keenyaaf yeroo ammaatti ‘Zhou et al.’ irraa yaada argannee jirra, muuxannoo dhukkubsataa irratti qaban irraa ka’uun wixinee qabxii galmeessuu salphaa ta’e eegalan.
en-mt: For our guidance, we currently refer to 'Zhou et al. we got feedback from, they expected a simplified scoring draft based on their experience with the patient.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Hojiin isaanii qajeelfama keenyaaf ragaa haarawa dabale, kana malees, weerara dhibee daddarbaa addunyaa guutuu kanaaf ragaa gatii guddaa qabu ta’e.
en-mt: Their work added new evidence to our guidelines and provided valuable evidence for the global epidemic.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Hojii isaanii barbaachisaadhaaf beekamtii kennaa akkasumas galata keenya isinii ibsina.
en-mt: We acknowledge their important work and express our gratitude.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, hojiin isaanii qorannoo haaraa fi yaalii toora qajeelchaa COVID-19 (yaalii fooyyya’iinsaa torbaffaa) waliin walqabatee haarayiinsas ni barbaada.
en-mt: However, their work also requires updates in relation to new research and COVID-19 guideline trials (seventh revision trial).

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Akkaataa maxxansa isa torbaffaatti (Bitootessa 3, 2020), dhukkubsataa shakkame qabamuu isaa mirkaneessuuf amaloota seenaa dhukkubootaa keessaa tokko mallattoo dhukkubsataa keessaa lama walitti fidanii qaaccessa waliigalaa taasisuu barbaachisa, yookaan seenaa dhukkubaa ifa ta’e hinqabu yoo ta’e, mallattoolee dhukkubsataa sadii guutuu qaba.
en-mt: According to the seventh edition (February 3, 2020), one of the characteristics of the patient's history is to combine two of the patient's symptoms to confirm the infection, or if there is no clear history, three symptoms must be completed . . . .

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Seenaa qo’annoo faffaca’iinsaa fi to’annaa dhibee: (1) seenaa imalaa yookaan magaalaa Wuhaanii fi naannoo isii keessa jiraachuu yookaan hawaasota biroo dhukkubni COVID-19 guyyoota 14 dura utuu mallattoo hin agarsiisin dura gabaafame; (2) namoota dhukkuba daddarbaa SARS-CoV-2 tiin qabaman waliin tuttuqii qabaachuu (qorannoo niiwukilaay asiid poozetiivii ta’e); (3) seenaa dhukkubsattoota qaama gubaa yookaan mallattoolee hafuura baafannaa qaban, kanneen magaalaa Wuhaaniifi naannoo isaa irraa dhufan, yookaan hawaasota biroo kan guyyoota 14 dura utuu mallattooleen hin eegalin COVID-19 irraa gabaafame irraa dhufan waliin tuttuqqii qabaachuu; (4)tuuta dhukkubsattootaa dhukkubicha qabaachuun isaanii mirkaneeffame (dhukkubsattoota 2 fi isaa ol kan qaama gubaa fi/yookaan mallattooleen hafuura baafannaa torban 2 keessatti irratti argaman, bakkeewwan xixiqqaa akka mana, waajjira, daree mana barnootaa fi kkf keessatti) waliin seenaa tuttuqqii qabaachuu.
en-mt: Outbreak and disease control study history: (1) travel history or residence in and around Wuhan or other communities reported 14 days before symptoms of COVID-19; (2) contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious individuals (positive nucleic acid test); (3) history of contact with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms, from Wuhan and surrounding areas, or from other communities reported from COVID-19 14 days before the onset of symptoms; (4)contact history with a confirmed group of patients (2 or more patients with burning sensation and/or respiratory symptoms present within 2 weeks, in small settings such as home, office, school classroom, etc.).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Mul’isa kilinikaa: (1) ho’ina qaamaa fi/ykn mallattoolee; (2) tarreeffama suuraa dhibee COVID-19 wajjin; (3) seeliin dhiiga diimaa waliigalaa sirrii ta’u agarsiisu, sadarkaa hubee jalqabaa irratti lakkoofsa lymphocyte gadi bu’e ykn hir’ate.
en-mt: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/or symptoms; (2) a list of photographs with COVID-19; (3) show a normalization of total red blood cells, with a lowered or decreased lymphocyte count at the early stage of the hub.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoota mirkaneeffaman mallattoo dhukkuba isaanii qorachuun haala armaan gadiitiin namoota shakkaman, kanneen ragaa wantoota dhukkuba fidanii yookaan qorannoo dhiigaa keessaa tokko qabanii irratti hundaa’uu qaba: (1) qorannoo PCR yerooma sanatti SARS-CoV-2 dhaan qabamuu mul’isu. (2) wantoonni vaayirasiin qabu guutummaan isaa toora galee vaayirasii koroonaa haarawaan walfakkeenya guddaa yoo qabaate; (3) antiibodii IgM addaatii fi antiibodii IgG SARS-CoV-2 qorannoo dhiigaa keessaatiif poozetiivii yoo ta’e; yookaan antiibodiin addaa IgG SARS-CoV-2 negetiivii irraa gara poozetiiviitti jijjiiramuu, yookaan sadarkaa fooyya’uu keessatti antiibodiin isa yeroo dhukkubi itti ammaatee jiruu caalaa harka 4 fi isaa oliin ol ka’uu.
en-mt: Screening of confirmed patients for symptoms should be based on suspected cases, who have evidence of pathogens or one of the blood tests: (1) PCR tests showing immediate infection with SARS-CoV-2 (2) the entire virus's properties are aligned and have a high degree of similarity to the new coronavirus; (3) positive for specific IgM antibodies and SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibodies for intrablood tests; or a change in the SARS-CoV-2 specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or a 4-fold or more increase in the level of antibody at the time of illness.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Qorannoon ‘PCR’, inni yerooma qorannootti nuukiliik asiidiin ujummoo qilleensaa yookaan samuuda dhiigaa keessa jiraachuu qoratu maxxansaawwan lammaffaa (Amajjii 18, 2020) fi sadaffaa (Amajjii 22, 2020) tti dabalamuu isaa arguu dandeenya.
en-mt: We can see the addition of the PCR test, which tests for the presence of nucleic acids in the airways or blood samples during the test, to the second (March 18, 2020) and third (March 22, 2020) editions.

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: Naamunaa dhiigaa fuudhame keessatti lubbuulee xixiqqooo dhukkuba fidan keessaa arguuf kan qabame; arfaffaa (amajji 27-2020), shanaffaa (gur8-2020) ilaalama, fi kan dhiigaa gulaala torbaffaa irratti ba’a.
en-mt: Infected with disease-causing microorganisms in blood samples; the fourth (March 27-2020), the fifth (Aug8-2020) will be considered, and the blood will be released in the seventh edition.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Fooyya’iinsonni hojii itti fufaa qorattootaarratti hundaa’an kunniin qorannoo mallattoolee saffisa qabuuf meeshaa filatamaa nuukliik asiidii adda baasu barbaachuun, akkasumas samuudonni ujummoo qilleensaa keessaa fuudhaman samuuda dhiigaa dabalatee, kanneen argamuu fakkeenyota (specimen) garaagaraa guddisanii fi bu’aa poozetiivii ‘antiiboodii’ adda ta’ee ulaagaa mirkanaa’e keessa fiduu deeggaran.
en-mt: These improvements are based on the ongoing work of the researchers in the search for a preferred nucleic acid detection tool for rapid marker testing, as well as airway samples, including blood samples, which increase the availability of different specimens and specific antibody positive results supported bringing it within the approved criteria.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Kana malees, dhukkubsattoota mallattoo agarsiisaniifi mallattoo hin agarsiisne irraa akka of eeggannuuf ragaaleen nu yaadachiisan daddabalaa dhufaniiru.
en-mt: In addition, there is increasing evidence to remind us to beware of both symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Kanaaf, gabateen yaa’aa ‘Zout et al.’ fooyya’uu qaba, nama mallattoo dhukkubaa hinqabne “carraan qabamuu xiqqaa” jedhanii waan adda baasaniif.
en-mt: Therefore, the flow table 'Zout et al. should be improved, as they identify an asymptomatic person as “low risk of infection”.

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: Malli qabxii itti kennanis hojii mana yaalaa fi qo’annoo dabalataatiin mirkaneeffamuu qaba.
en-mt: The method of scoring should be validated by further laboratory work and studies.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Gudunfaadhaaf, dubbistoota hundumtuu akka yaada kennanitti ragaa qabatamaan dhufaa akka jiru abdii qabna.
en-mt: In summary, we hope that concrete evidence is coming as all readers have commented.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Qorannoo mallattoolee “namoota shakkamanii” fi “namoota qabamuun isaanii mirkanaa’ee” tiif qajeelfamoota biyya isaanii isa baay’ee dhiyoo akka barbaadaniifi hordofaniif yaada dhiyeessinaaf.
en-mt: We suggest that they seek and follow their most recent country's guidelines for the testing of symptoms of “suspected persons” and “confirmed cases”.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Gareen keenya isin gargaaruudhaaf qajeelfama keenya yeroo yerootti ni haaressa.
en-mt: Our team will update our guidelines from time to time to help you.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: Baangilaadesh namoota shan sababa COVID-19’tiin du’an, isa olaanaa kan ta’e gabaafte.
en-mt: Bangladesh has reported five deaths from COVID-19, the highest.

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Kaleessa Baangilaadish guyyicharra namoota haarawa COVID-19 irraa kan ka’e du’an shan mirkaneessiteetti.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh confirmed five new deaths from COVID-19 on the day.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Kun guyyaa tokko keessatti lakkoofsa du’a vaayiresicharraa maddee isa olaanaadha.
en-mt: This is the highest number of deaths from the virus in a single day.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: Guyyaa kaleessaa, Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR)’n Baangilaadish akka gabaasetti lakkoofsi namoota haarawa qabamanii 114 fi kanneen dhukkubicha irraa dandamatanii mana isaanii turaa jiran 33 dha.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported 114 new cases and 33 recoveries.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Du’a waliigalaa 17tu galmaa’e.
en-mt: A total of 17 deaths were recorded.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Walga’ii oduu oonlaayinii taasifamu irratti, qindeessaan ‘IEDCR’, Dr Merjaadii Saabiriinaa Filooraa, namoonni du’an dhiira afurii fi dhalaa tokkodha jedhan.
en-mt: At an online news conference, IEDCR coordinator Dr Merjadi Sabrina Flora said the dead were four men and one woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: Akka Dr Meerjaadiin jedhanitti, dhukkubsattoonni lama umuriin isaanii 60 oli, lama 51 fi 60 gidduu, tokko ammoo 41 hanga 50 tti dha.
en-mt: According to Dr Meerjadiin, two patients are over 60 years old, two are between 51 and 60 years old and one is between 41 and 50 years old.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Miidhamtoota keessaa lama Dhaka irraa dhufan jette.
en-mt: Two of the victims came from Dhaka, she said.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: Dhaabbanni fayyaa addunyya (WHO) COVID-19 dhibee daddarbaadha jedhee kan labse bitootessa 11.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a communicable disease on February

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Akka hoggantoonni dhaabbata miidiyaa biyyattii Anadolu’tti himanitti, kanneen dhukkubsatan keessaa namni hogganaa koomishiinii farra malaammaltummaa Beengaalii ta’an Jalal Saifur Rahman hospitaala kuweet Maitree’tti waldhaanaman.
en-mt: According to officials of the country's media agency Anadolu, Jalal Saifur Rahman, head of the Bengal anti-corruption commission, was treated at Kuwait's Maitree hospital.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: Dilbatarra, labsii viidiyoo keessatti, ministeeerri geejiba daandii fi riqichaa baangelaadesh Obaayidul Kuwaader akka jedhetti geejibni ummataa hamma jalqaba karoorfame caalaa cufamee tura, hamma dilbata dhufuutti.
en-mt: On Saturday, in a video announcement, Bangladesh's Minister of Road Transport and Bridges Obaidul Quader said public transport would remain closed for longer than originally planned until next Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Sochii geejjiba uummataa dhaabuun kun Bitootessa 26 eegalee Sambata Ebla 4 xumuramuuf karoorfame.
en-mt: The public transportation shutdown is scheduled to begin on February 26 and end on Saturday, April

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: Geejjibsiisi meeshaalee murteessoo—qoricha, boba’aa fi nyaata—amma iyyuu hayyamamaa ture.
en-mt: Transportation of critical supplies—medicine, fuel and food—was still allowed.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: Mudannaan dhibee COVID-19 jalqaba galmaa’e Baangilaadesh keessatti bitootessa 8, namoota xaaliyaaniitii deebi’an lamaa fi haadha warraasaanii keessaa tokkorrati argame.
en-mt: The first case of COVID-19 was reported in Bangladesh on February 8, in two returnees from Italy and one of their wives.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: Bitootessa 19 asitti, namoonni sadan kunniin fooyya’aniiru.
en-mt: Since February 19, the three have improved.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: Akka addunyaatti namoonni SARS-CoV-2 qabaman miliyoona tokko darban.
en-mt: The number of SARS-CoV-2 cases worldwide has passed one million.

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: Akka Yuunivarsitiin Joonsi Hoopkinsi ibsetti gaafa Kamisaa, lakkoofsi waliigalaa namoota dhukkuba SARS-Cov-2 dhaan qabamanii akka addunyaatti miliyoona tokko darbeera.
en-mt: According to Johns Hopkins University, on Thursday, the total number of people infected with SARS-Cov-2 worldwide has passed one million.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Yoo xiqqaate du’i namoota kuma 52 COVID-19, dhukkuba vaayirasii koroonaatiin dhufu, waliin wal qabsiifaman.
en-mt: At least 52,000 deaths have been linked to COVID-1

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Guyyaa walfakkaataatti Maalaawii keessatti namni jalqabaa vaayirasii koroonaatiin qabame argamuunii fi Zaambiyaa keessatti namni sababa koroonaa vaayirasiitiin du’uun guyyaa murteessaa ture.
en-mt: On the same day, the first case of the coronavirus in Malawi and the death of a person in Zambia were crucial.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: Kamisarraa eegaaltee Kooriyaan Kaabaa biyyoota muraasa faalama vaayirasii koroonaa irraa bilisa ta’an keessaa tokko ta’uu isii falmatte.
en-mt: Since Thursday, North Korea has argued that it is one of the few countries free of the virus.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Dhaabbanni fayyaa addunyaa Kaleessa dhukkubsattoota 1,051,635 gabaase. Kanneen keessa 79,332 sa’aatii digdamii afur keessatti hanga sa’aatii 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) ebla 4tti.
en-mt: The World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 cases yesterday. Of these, 79,332 in the twenty-four hours to 10 am Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4th.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: Yuunaayitid isteetitti namoota koroonaan qabaman kuma 244 oltu galmaa’e, yoo xiqqaate du’aatii 5,900 galmeessise
en-mt: More than 244,000 cases have been reported in the United States, with at least 5,900 deaths

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: Daataa yuunivarsiitii Hoopkiins wabeeffachuun oduun CBS akka gabaasetti, sababa vaayirasii koroonaaf roobiirra namoota US 1000 oltu du’e.
en-mt: Citing data from Hopkins University, CBS news reported that more than 1,000 people in the US died of the virus on Wednesday.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: Addunyaa kana keessatti biyyoonni tatamsa’ina dhukkubichaa dhaabuuf tarkaanfiiwwan daran ciccimoo ta’an labsan.
en-mt: Countries around the world have announced even tougher measures to stop the spread of the disease.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: Gaafa Kamisaa, Sergeey Soobiyaanin, kantiibaan magaalaa Mooskoo, cufamuu magaalichaa hanga Caamsaa 1 tti dheeressan.
en-mt: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the closure until May

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: Akka biyyoolessaatti, Pirezidaanti Vilaadimiir Putiin hanga Ebla 30 tti lammiiwwan Raashaa utuu bakkee hojii hindeemin kaffaltii argachuun isaanii akka itti fufu beeksisan.
en-mt: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin announced that Russians will continue to receive payment without going to work until April

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: Paarlaamaan poorchugaal labsii yeroo muddamaa guyyoota 15’n dheeressuuf murteesse; murtichi sagalee deeggarsaa 215, sagalee dhoorkaa kudhan fi sagalee faallaa tokkoon ragga’e.
en-mt: Portuguese parliament decides to extend state of emergency by 15 days; the resolution passed by 215 votes in favour, ten against and one against.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: Saawudii Arabiyaan magaalota qulqullaa’oo Makkaa fi Madiinaa keessatti qoqqobbiin sochii gara guyyaa guutuutti deeressite; isaan dura, qoqqobbiin sochii kan hojjetu 3 p.m fi 6 a.m. gidduu qofatti ture.
en-mt: Saudi Arabia extends curfew in holy cities of Mecca and Medina to full day; before them, curfews only applied between 3 pm and 6 am.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: Taayilaandi qoqqobbii sochii sa’a 10 p.m fi 4 a.m gidduu hojiirra oolchuuf karoorfatte.
en-mt: Thailand plans to implement a curfew between 10 pm and 4 am.

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: Bulchaan Oohiyoo, Mike DeWine, yeroon turtii manaa-bahuu-dhiisuu hanga caamsaa 1tti akka dheeratu beeksisan.
en-mt: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced that the curfew will be extended until May 1st.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Kuusaawwan Awustaraaliyaa daangaa sooftii mana fincaanii walitti dhufeenya namaatiin gadi buuse.
en-mt: Australian archives lowered the limits of toilet soot in terms of human interaction.

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: Gaafa Dilbataa fi Sanbata xiqqaa galgala, hidhatawwan kuusaa Awustiraaliyaa Woolworths fi Coles daangeffama bittaa isaanii waraqaa mana fincaanii irraa gara lamaafi baasiifi galii tokkotti qarqaba tokko kuusaawwan sadarkaa biyyoolessaa hundaa keessatti hir’isaniiru.
en-mt: On Saturday and Saturday evening, Australian warehouse chains Woolworths and Coles cut their purchase limits from toilet paper to two and one edge per spend-to-income across all national-level warehouses.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: ALDI nillee gaafa Dafinoo, daangeffama saamsa-tokko tti jalqabdeetti.
en-mt: ALDI also started with Dafinoo, a one-loot restriction.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: Hanqinooti kunniin akka ergaawwaniitti bakkaa baasii (checkouts) irratti, akkasumas hidhatawwan fuulota Facebook irratti maxxanfaman.
en-mt: These flaws are posted as messages at checkouts, as well as links to Facebook pages.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Bittoonni sababa sodaa COVID-19’tiif yoo namni adda of baasuu barbaadeef meeshaa kuusaa akka jiran gabaafame
en-mt: Buyers are reportedly stocking up on items in case someone wants to isolate themselves due to fears of COVID-1

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: Gaafa Roobii, Woolworths ajaja tokkotti bittaawwan waraqaa mana fincaanii dhiyeessii manaaf qarqaba tokkotti daangesse.
