en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolworths limited purchases of toilet paper per order to one slot for household supplies.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Jijjiiramoonni kunneen dhorkaa walbittaa tokkotti paakii afurii duraanii kan Woolworths fi Coles n walduraa duubaan Bitootessa gaafa 4 fi 5 jalqabsiifame hordofuudhaani.
en-mt: The changes follow a previous four-pack ban introduced by Woolworths and Coles on February 4 and 5 respectively.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: Koolsi, ibsa miidiyaa Bitootessa 8 kennaniin akka gabaasanitti, daangaa saamsa afurii wajjiin, “kuusaawwan hedduun dhihaatanii sa’aatii tokko keessatti gurguramaa jiru”, fi dhiheessa gaafatan “seeraan ala”, yeroo ALDI’n, maxxansa feesbuukii kan Kibxataa, “kan hin eeggamin” jedheenitti.
en-mt: Coles, in a press release on February 8, reported that, with a limit of four cancellations, “multiple stocks being offered and sold within an hour”, and requesting offers “illegal”, while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Wednesday, said it was “unexpected ” he said to her.

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: Torban darbe gurgurtaan “fiixeetti ol guddataa” deeme, akka dubbi himaa Woolworzitti.
en-mt: Last week sales “peaked”, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: Kuusaan Koostikoo Kaambeeraa keessaa torban darbe hamma hayyamame saamsa lamatti daangesse.
en-mt: The Costico warehouse in Cambera last week limited the permitted amount to two servings.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Caalaatti hanqinicha gadi hir’isuuf, Coles qarqabaalee gurguddoo dhiyeessitoota irraa ajajeera fi deddeebitii harkaan gahuu dabaleera, Woolworths istookii dabalataa ajajeera, yeroo ALDI’n Roobii addaa karoorfameef dursee argametti istookiiwwan hojjeteera.
en-mt: To further cut the shortfall down, Coles ordered larger quantities of crackers from suppliers and increased hand-delivery, while Woolworths ordered more stock, making stocks when ALDI was available ahead of planned Wednesday specials.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: Daayirektarri hogganaan Waldaa Shaqaxxootaa Awustiraaliyaa Russell Zimmerman, shaqaxxoonni mankuusa guutuuf ni yaalu, garuu dhorkaaleen manneen maree naannawaa makiinota qaqqabsiisanii irrattii rakkisaa taasiseera.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Shacks Association, said shacks would try to fill the warehouse, but local council restrictions on delivering machines made it difficult.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Inni gatiiwwan oomishaa ol ka’aa deeman eega, akka dhiyeessitoonni fedhii, akkasumas adda kan ta’an xiqqoo guutuuf yaalaniin.
en-mt: He expects commodity prices to keep going up, as suppliers try to meet demand, as well as specific bits.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: Gaafa facaasaa, ADLI gadhiifama duraa istookii hordofuun, kuusaaleen muraasi Roobii addaa adeemsisuu hin danda’an.
en-mt: On sowing day, following ADLI's preliminary release of stock, a few warehouses will not be able to process Wednesday specials.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: Gabaasa News.com.au irratti ogeessi shaqaxaa ‘Queensland University of Technology’ akka jedhanitti, manneen kuusaa galgala hundumaa meeshaalee guutu.
en-mt: In a News.com.au report, a Queensland University of Technology tax expert said warehouses are full every evening.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Sooftiin mana fincaanii meeshaa bal’aa akka ta’e yaada kenne, gara hamma lakkoofsa gabaa xiqqeessattu geessa, akkasumas, yeroo gurgurame, teessoo bal’aa duwwaatti hambisa, sodaa dhabamuu cimsa.
en-mt: He suggested that toilet socks are a vast commodity, leading to the extent that they underestimate the number of markets, and, when sold, leave vast benches empty, reinforcing the fear of loss.

sourceString: "Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic" said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: Akka ‘ABC News’ tti “Coles fi Woolworths yaada [kana]utuu meeshaaleen baayyeen minjaala kusaarra jiru ta’ee, utuu oomihaaleen akka qulqulleessituu mana fincaanii fi saanitaayizeriin [bitamuu] danda’uu ta’ee fi baayyinaan jiru ta’ee, walitti qabama hawaasaa hir’isuu ni dandeessa ture” jedheera, Russell Zimmerman.
en-mt: According to ABC News, “Coles and Woolworths think [that] if there were more goods on the table, if products like toilet cleaners and sanitizers could be [purchased] and in abundance, it would be collected you could reduce social.” Russell Zimmerman.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: Oomishaan sooftii mana fincaanii wanta miira hin kennine dubbate Roobii darbe irratti gabaan ala akka ta’an dubbate.
en-mt: The toilet soap manufacturer said on Wednesday that it would be out of the market.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: Kiimberlii-Klaarki, kan sooftii mana fincaanii Kileeneksi uumee, fi Soolaaris Peeppar kan Xuuxxuu uume, dhiheessa eeguus 24/7 hojjataa akka jiran ibsan, akkan gabaasa news.com.au’tti.
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark, the maker of Cleanex toilet soap, and Solaris Paper, the maker of the Absorbent, said they were working 24/7 to maintain supply, according to news.com.au.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: Domain.com, weebsaayitiin riil isteetii, akka gabaasetti dhiheessitoonni tokko tokko namoota Meelboornitti karaarraa meeshaa bitataniif sooftii mana fincaatii bilisaan dhiheessan.
en-mt: Domain.com, a real estate website, reported that some suppliers offered free toilet socks to people buying stuff off the street in Melbourne.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: Oduu NT gulaallii Kamisaa, guyyaa guyyaan Darwin keessatti kan maxxanfamu, fuula saddeet kan ciramee akka waraqaa mana fincaaniitti faaayidaarra oolu galcheera.
en-mt: Thursday's editorial of the NT News, published daily in Darwin, inserted eight pages of clippings recycled as toilet paper.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Kuusaaleen jalqaba daangessa fudhachuu didan, akka gabaasa BBC Awustaraaliyaa Bitootessa 3’tti gurgurtaawwan irra daangaa kaa’uuf karoora akka hin qabe dubbatan.
en-mt: Stores that initially refused to accept the restrictions said they had no plans to limit sales, according to a BBC Australia report on February

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman oomishoonni biroo fedhii olaanaa keessa akka jiran dabale, golgaawwan, sanitaayizarii, mi’oota gogfaman, dhiqannaa harkaafi daakuu dabalatee.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added other products are in high demand, including curtains, sanitizers, dried dishes, hand sanitizers and powders.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: Bifa walfakkaatuun, Awustaraaliyaan alatti, dilbata galgala giddugala gabaa Biriitish Okaadootti gurgurtaan sooftii mana fincaanii Andirees hammattuu-12 hanga lamatti.
en-mt: Similarly, outside Australia, sales of Andreas toilet socks at British shopping center Ocado on Saturday evening ranged from 12 to two.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: Dhaabbanni Fayyaa Addunyaa COVID-19 n weerara addunyaa jechuun labse.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has declared COVID-19 a global pandemic.

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Gaafa Roobii, Dhaabbati Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO) jalqabbii COVID-19 itti fufaa jiru — dhukkuba vaayirasii koroonaa SARS-CoV-2’n dhufu — akka weerara addunyaawaatti labse.
en-mt: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — a disease caused by the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — a global pandemic.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Jechi “weerara” jedhu baldhinaan tatamsa’uu dhukkubaa kan ibsu ta’us, haalonni murtaa’an hangam hamaa akka ta’an hin ibsu, Dhaabbanni Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO)’n barbaachisummaa tarkaanfii mootummaa kaa’e:
en-mt: Although the term “epidemic” broadly describes the spread of disease, it does not describe how serious certain situations are, the World Health Organization (WHO) laid out the need for government action:

sourceString: "All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: “Biyyoonni hundi ammallee haala weerara kanaa jijjiiruu ni danda’u.
en-mt: “All countries can still change the nature of the outbreak.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: Yoo biyyoonni deebicha keessatti namoota isaanii adda baasan, qoratan, wal’aanan, qofaatti baasan, faana dhahan akkasumas gurmeessan," jedhan Teediroos Adhaanom Gebreyesuus, Daarekteerri Olaanaa WHO.
en-mt: If countries in response identify, test, treat, isolate, track and organize their people," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO Director-General.

sourceString: "We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction."
targetString: “nuti sadarkaa saffisa tatamsa’iinsaatiinii fi hammeenyaa akkasumas sadarkaa akeekkachiisa hoj-malee baay’ee nu yaachisa.”
en-mt: “We are very concerned about the level of spread rate and severity as well as the level of idle warnings.”

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: Akka Dr.Toom Fireedi, Yuunaayitid Isteetitti hogganaa Giddugala Ittisaa fi Too’annoo Dhibee duraaniitti, weerarichi “kan hin baratamne.”
en-mt: According to Dr. Tom Freddy, former director of the Centers for Disease Prevention and Control in the United States, the outbreak is “unprecedented.”

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Yaadachiisa Guraandhala keessa CNN’n maxxanfame irratti “infiluweenzaan alatti, vaayiresiin sirna hargansuu tatamsa’ina tasaa irraa gara walitti fufaa addunyaatti tarkaanfate hin jiru” jedhe.
en-mt: "With the exception of influenza, no respiratory virus has progressed from random to continuous global outbreaks," he said in a reminder published by CNN in January.

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus akkana jechuun ilaalcha wal fakkaata dubbatan “kana dura weerara vaayirasii koroonaatiin babal’ate hin agarre.”
en-mt: Ghebreyesus expressed similar views, saying "we have never seen an outbreak of the coronavirus before.

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: Itti fufuudhaanis, “fi weerara addunyaa yero walfakkaataatti to’atame kanaan dura arginee hin beeknu.”
en-mt: “And we have never seen a global outbreak controlled at the same time,” he continued.

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: Haala haaraa erga weerarri addunyaa kun murtoo WHO’n Amajjii keessa weerarichi dhimmaa balaa fayyaa hawaasaa addunyaa jechuun labsee as
en-mt: A new development since the global outbreak was declared a global public health emergency by the WHO in March

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: Daayirektarri Inistiitiyuutii Alerjii fi Dhibeewwan Huboo Biyyaalessaa Yuunaayitid Isteetsi, Dr. Anthony Fauci, waa’ee weerarichaa irratti, “wanta jala sararamuu qabu, kana caala hammaachuuf jira,” jedhan.
en-mt: The director of the US National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, Dr. "What needs to be underlined is that it's going to get worse," Anthony Fauci said of the attack.

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: Kamisaa kaasee, Associated Press yoo xinnaate akka addunyaatti dhimmoota COVID-19 126,000 jiraachuu gabaase, du’a 4,600 ol geessisuun.
en-mt: As of Thursday, the Associated Press reported at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, with more than 4,600 deaths.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Weerarri addunyaawaa vaayirasii koroonaa 2019–20 weerara addunyaawaa dhukkuba vaayirasii koroonaa 2019 (COVID-19) itti fufaa jirudha, miidhamuu sombaa akka tasaa hamaatiin coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) dhufa.
en-mt: The 2019–20 global coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing global pandemic of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) with sudden severe lung injury.

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Jalqabbichi Wuhaan, Chaayinaa keessatti gaafa Mudde 2019 adda baafame, akka Yaaddoo Addunyaawaa Balaa Tasaa Fayyaa Uummataa ta’ee Amajjii 30, 2020 tti labsame, akkasumas akka weerara addunyaawaatti Bitootessa 11, 2020 tti beekame.
en-mt: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China in December 2019, declared a Global Public Health Emergency Concern on March 30, 2020, and recognized as a global outbreak on February 11,

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: Akka Ebla 10, 2020’tti, daangaalee fi biyyoota 210 keessatti dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 tilmaamaan miiliyoona 1.61’tu argame, kunis tilmaamaan du’a 97,000 hordofsiise.
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, there have been an estimated 1.61 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 across 210 borders and countries, leading to an estimated 97,000 deaths.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Namoonni 364,000 tti siqan bayyannataniiru.
en-mt: Nearly 364,000 people have recovered.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: Dhimmi hamma du’aa dhukkubichi geessisu Chaayinaa keessatti 4%, yeroo akka addunyaatti Aljeeriyaa keessatti 13.04% hanga Niiw Zilaand keessatti 0.8% deemutti.
en-mt: The issue of the severity of deaths caused by the disease is 4% in China, when globally it goes from 13.04% in Algeria to 0.8% in New Zealand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Mallattoowwan beekamoon hoo’a qaama, qufaa fi hanqachuu hargansuu hammatu.
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Mallattooleen niimooniyaa fi dhibee dhukkubbii hamaa sirna hargansuu ta’uu mala.
en-mt: Symptoms of pneumonia and severe respiratory disorders may be present.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Yeroon saaxilamummaatii hanga mallattoon mullatutti fudhatu naannoo guyyoota shanii ta’a, garuu guyyoota lamaa hanga kudha-afurii turuu danda’a.
en-mt: The time from exposure to symptoms is around five days, but can last from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Talaalliin yookaan qorichi addaa beekame hin jiru.
en-mt: There is no known vaccine or specific cure.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: Yaaliin jalqabaa kan mallattoo qabuu fi yaala gargaaraadha. Tarkaanfiileen ittisaa gorfaman harka dhiqachuu, yeroo qufa’an afaan haguuggachuu, namoota biraa irraa fageenya eeggachuu, akkasumas hordofuu fi namoota qabaman jedhamanii shakkaman irraa adda of baasuu of keessatti hammata.
en-mt: Initial therapy is symptomatic and adjuvant therapy. Recommended preventive measures include washing hands, covering mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from others, as well as monitoring and isolating suspected cases.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: Abbootiin taayitaa guutuu addunyaa ittisa imalaa hojiirra oolchuun, adda foo’uun, yeroo mana turuu kaa’uun, too’annoo balaa naannoo hojiitiin, fi dhaabbilee cufuun deebii kennan.
en-mt: Authorities around the world responded by implementing travel prevention, quarantine, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and business closures.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: Weerarri addunyaawaa kun tasgabbii dhabuu hamaa hawaas-diinagdee addunyaa, ta’iileen ispoortii, amantaa, siyaasaa fi aadaa yeroo biraatti darbuu ykn haqamuu, fi hawaasa ballaan bitamuudhaan hanqinni dhiyeessii guddaan akka mudatu taasiseera.
en-mt: The global outbreak has led to severe global socio-economic instability, postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and massive supply shortages.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Manneen barnootaa ykn Yuuniversiitiileen guutummaa biyyaatti ykn akka naannawaatti biyyoota 193 keessatti cufamuudhaan, tilmaamaan baayyina barattoota addunyaa dhibbeentaa 99.4 irraan kan dhiibbaa geessisedha.
en-mt: Schools or universities were closed nationwide or regionally in 193 countries, affecting an estimated 99.4 percent of the world's student population.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: Odeeffannoon sobaa waayee vaayiresichaa toora interneetaan kan baballatanii fi mudannooleen akka lammiilee alaa jibbuu fi namoota chaayinaa, namoota gosa Bahaa fi Kibba-baha Eeshiyaa ta’iinaa fi bifa isaanii qaban fi kan biroo naannoowwan vaayiresichi baayyinaan itti mullate irraa ta’an irraa qoollifannaan tureera.
en-mt: False information about the virus has spread online and there have been incidents such as xenophobia and stigma from Chinese, people of East and Southeast Asian ethnicity and appearance and others from areas where the virus is most prevalent.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Sababa hir’achuu imalaa fi cufamuu industirii gurguddaatiin, hir’inni faalama qilleensaa fi dhabamiinsi kaarboonii jira.
en-mt: Due to reduced travel and the closure of large industries, there is a reduction in air pollution and carbon elimination.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Angaawonni wuhaan, Chaayinaa (magaalaa guddoo konyaa Hubei) keessaa garee dhimmoota michii sombaa sababa hin beekamne qaban Mudde 31, 2019 tti gabaasan, akkasumas qorannoon Amajjii 2020 gara jalqabaatti jalqabame.
en-mt: Officials in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a group of cases of unknown cause pneumonia on December 31, 2019, and an investigation began in early March

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni hedduun gabaa gurgurtaa Nyaata Galaanaa Huunaan wajjiin hidhata qaban kanaaf vaayirasichi bu’uura zoonootik qaba jedhamee yaadama.
en-mt: Many cases are associated with Hunan Seafood retail markets and therefore the virus is thought to have a zoonotic basis.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: Vaayiresiin weerara sana kaase SARS-CoV-2 jedhamuun kan beekamu, koronaavaayiresoota simbira halkanii, koronaavaayiresoota pangolini, fi SARS-CoV tti kan dhiyaatu vaayiresii haaraa argamedha. Namicha jalqaba mallattoon irratti argamee booda adda baafame kan dhukkubsate Muddee gaafa 1, 2019 fi namni sunimmoo tuttuqaa muldhataa kilaastera gabaa wantoota jiidhaa boodaa sanaa wajjiin hin qabu ture.
en-mt: The virus that triggered that outbreak, known as SARS-CoV-2, is a newly discovered virus close to nightbird coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV. The man who was first identified after symptoms became ill on December 1, 2019 and had no apparent contact with the latter market cluster.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Kilaasteroota ta’iilee Muddee2019 keessa gabaafaman keessaa lama-sadaffaan gabichaa hidhata qabaachuun isaanii bira ga’ameera.
en-mt: Two-thirds of the clusters of events reported in December2019 were found to be linked to the table.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: Bitootessa 13, 2020 tti, gabaasi Chaayinaa Kibbaa Maxxansa Ganamaa (Morning Post) hin mirkanoofne dhimmi Sadaasa 17, 2019 tti deebi’e, umurii 55 keessatti konyaa Hubei irraa, isa jalqabaa ta’uu mala. Gurraaandhala 26, 2020 tti, WHO’n, akkuma dhimmoonni haaraan Chaayinaa keessatti gadi bu’uun gabaafameen garuu Xaaliyaan, Iraan fi Kooriyaa Kibbaa keessatti tasa dabaluu gabaase, lakkoofsi dhimmoota haaraa Chaayinaan alaa lakkoofsa dhimmoota haaraa Chaayinaa keessaa yeroo jalqabaaf caale.
en-mt: On February 13, 2020, an unconfirmed South China Morning Post reported that a case returned on March 17, 2019, at the age of 55 from Hubei province, may be the first. On November 26, 2020, the WHO reported a decline in new cases in China but a sudden increase in Italy, Iran and South Korea, with the number of new cases outside China exceeding the number of new cases in China for the first time.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Ta’iileen gadi butamanii gabaafamuun, keessattuu warren mallattoo giddu galeessaa agarsiisan irratti mullachuu mala.
en-mt: Kidnapping incidents may be reported, especially in those with moderate symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Gurraandhala 26 tti, wal bira qabiinsaan dhimmoota xiqqootu dargaggoota keessaa gabaafame, warreen 19 fi isaa gadi ta’an akka addunyaatti dhimmoota 2.4% bakka bu’an waliin. Gorsaan saayinsawaa olaanaa Ingilizii, Patrick Vallance, 60% uummata Biriitish utuu madiinummaan qaamaa hawaasa keessa jiru bira hin ga’amin hubamuu akka qaban tilmaame.
en-mt: As of 26 November, comparatively few cases were reported among adolescents, with those 19 and younger representing 2.4% of cases globally. The British chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would have to be diagnosed before the physical mediumship in society was reached.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Lakkoofsi dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 wajjiin walqabatanii, fi kanneen akkaataa adeemsa seeraatiin qorannoon isaanii poozatiivii ta’uu mirkanaa’e.
en-mt: The number of patients related to COVID-19, and those who tested positive in accordance with the legal process.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: Akka Bitootessa 23’tti, biyyi baay’ina ummata ishee keessaa %3 qoratte hin turre, akkasumas biyyoonni hedduun kanneen akka Xaaliyaanii, Neezarlaandi, Ispeen, fi Siwuuzerlaandi imaammata warreen mallattoo salphaa qaban hin qorataman jedhu qabu.
en-mt: As of February 23, no country had tested 3% of its population, and many countries such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland have policies that do not test those with mild symptoms.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Qu’annoon Bitootessa 16 tti maxxanfame Chaayinaa keessatti, hanga Amajjii 23 tti, COVID-19’n hubamuun 86% tti tilmaamamu akka adda hin baanee, fi dhukkubaan hubamuun ragaa barreeffamaan hin deeggaramne kunniin madda dhukkubaan hubamuu 79% dhimmoota ragaa barreeffamaan deeggaramanii ta’uu argate.
en-mt: A study published on February 16 found that in China, as of March 23, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 cases were not diagnosed, and these unsupported cases were the source of 79% of documented cases acquired.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Xiinxalli istaatistiksii Bitootessa 30 maxxanfame, lakkoofsi dhibamtootaa Xaaliyaanii keessaa hamma gabaafame akka caalu tilmaameera.
en-mt: A statistical analysis published on February 30 estimated that the number of cases in Italy was higher than reported.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: Tilmaamni jalqabaa lakkoofsa wal hormaataa (R0) kan COVID-19 1.4 hanga 2.4 ture.
en-mt: Initial estimates of the reproductive number (R0) for COVID-19 ranged from 1.4 to

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Qu’annoon Wiirtuu To’annoofi Ittisa Dhukkubaa US’n maxxanfame 5.7 ta’uu akka malu goolabe.
en-mt: A study published by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention concluded that it was likely to be

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: Namoonni baay’een COVID-19 qabaman dandamatan.
en-mt: Many people infected with COVID-19 recovered.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Warreen hin qabneef, yeroon mallattooleen dagaagan irraa gara du’aatti guyyoota 6 hanga 41 gidduutti ture, kan caalatti baramaa guyyoota 14 ta’uu waliin.
en-mt: For those who did not, the time from symptom development to death ranged from 6 to 41 days, with the more common being 14 days.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: Hanga Ebla 10 2020tti, tilmaamaan du’a 97,000 tu COVID-19 waliin walqabata ture.
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, there were an estimated 97,000 COVID-19-related deaths.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: Chaayinaa keessatti hamma Guraandhala 5tti du’aatiiwwan 80%n warreen 60 ol ta’anii fi 75% immoo dhukkuboota kardiyovaaskulaarii fi Sukkaaraa dabalatee warra rakkoolee fayyaa durumaan qaban turan. Akka pirootokooliitti hammi du’aatii weerara addunyaa COVID-19, namoota COVIDf bu’aa qorannoo poositiivaa qabaatanii du’anidha.
en-mt: As of November 5, 80% of deaths in China were among those over 60 and 75% were among those with pre-existing health problems, including cardiovascular disease and diabetes. According to the protocol, the death rate of the global COVID-19 pandemic is the number of people who die with a positive test result for COVID.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: Lakkoofsi hamma dhukkuba COVID-19’n du’uu olaanaa ta’uu mala, akka namoota utuu hin qoratamin du’an hammachuu hin malleen – fkn. manatti, iddoo yaalaman keessatti, kkf.
en-mt: The number of deaths from COVID-19 may be high, as people who die without being tested should not be included – e.g. at home, in treatment facilities, etc.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: Odeeffannoon hin qulqulloofne Xaaliyaanii akka argatetti du’i guddaan yeroo weeraraa du’a dhaabbataa COVID harka 4-5x’n caale.
en-mt: Unconfirmed data from Italy found that the highest death toll during the pandemic was 4-5x the permanent death toll from COVID.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Dubbi himtuun Giddugala Ittisaa fi Too’annoo dhibee U.S. (CDC) “[hammi du’aa jedhame] tilmaama gadi aanaa ta’uu ni beekna”, ibsa gabaasa himamaatiin mirkanaa’e kan U.S.’tti lakkoofa gadi bu’aa ta’e kan akka tilmaama gadi aanaa yeroo hunda weerara keessatti muudatu, kan akka weerara infuluweenzaa iswaayin H1N1 bara 2009. Duuti jalqabaa kan mirkanaa’e Wuhaanitti Amajjii 9, 2020.
en-mt: A spokeswoman for the US Centers for Disease Prevention and Control (CDC) said “we know [the alleged death toll] is an underestimate”, a statement confirmed by claims reports that in the US the lowest number of as low estimates always occur in outbreaks, such as the H1N1 swine flu outbreak in 2009. The first death was confirmed in Wuhan on March 9,

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: Lafa Chaayinaan alatti duuti jalqabaa Filiippinsi keessatti Muddee gaafa 1, kan mullatee fi duuti jalqabaa Eeshiyaan alattii immoo Muddee gaafa 14, Faransaayi keessatti ture.
en-mt: The first death outside China occurred in the Philippines on December 1, and the first death outside Asia occurred on December 14 in France.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: Guraandhala gaafa 28, lafa Chaayinaan alatti du’aatiin daarzaana caalu Iraan, Kooriyaa Kibbaa fi Xaaliyaanii tokkoon tokkoo isaanii keessaatti galmaa’eera.
en-mt: On November 28, more than a dozen deaths outside China were recorded in Iran, South Korea and Italy each.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Bitootessa 13, biyyoonnii fi daangaaleen afurtamaa ol Antaarkitikaan alatti ariilee hundarratti argaman du’a gabaasan. Tarkaanfileen hedduu haamilee baay’isuuf fayyadamaman.
en-mt: On February 13, more than forty countries and territories reported deaths on all islands except Antarctica. Several measures were used to increase morale.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Lakkoofsonni kunniin naannoon fi yeroo dhaan jijjiiramu, akkasumas qabiyyee qorannoo, qulqullina sirna kunuunsa fayyaa, filannoowwan wal’aansaa, yeroo erga jalqabbii dhukkubaa jalqabaa irraa kaasee, fi amaloota uummataa kanneen akka umurii, saala, fi fayyaa waliigalaatiin dhiibbaan irra gaha. Reeshoon du’aa-gara-dhimmaa lakkoofsa du’aa hiruu yeroo kenname gidduutti lakkoofsa dhimmoota qoratamanii calaqqisiisa.
en-mt: These numbers change by region and time, and are affected by study content, health care system quality, treatment options, time since first disease onset, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and general health. The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of cases studied during a given time interval.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: Odeeffannoo Yuunivarsiitii Joon Hoopkiinsi irratti hundaa’uun duu’I addunyaa hammi du’a-dhukkubsataa 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) akka Ebla 10, 2020’tti.
en-mt: Based on Johns Hopkins University data, the global mortality rate is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of April 10,

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: Lakkoofsichi naannoon gargari.
en-mt: The numbers vary by region.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Chaayinaa keessatti tilmaamni reeshiyoo du’aatii-irraa-ta’ii 17.3% (warreen mallattoon agarsiisuu jalqabniif Amajjii 1-10 2020 tti) irraa 0.7% ( warreen Guraandhala 1 2020 irraa kaasanii mallattoo agarsiisuu jalqabaniif) tti gadi bu’eera. Safartuuleen biroon hamma du’aatii ta’ii (CFR), kan dhibbeentaa namoota qoratamanii dhukkubichaan immoo du’anii ibsuu, fi hamma du’aatii hubamiinsaa (IFR), kan dhibbeentaa namoota hubamanii (qoratamanii ykn utuu hin qoratamiin) dhibechaan du’anii ibsudha.
en-mt: In China, the estimated death-to-incidence ratio has dropped from 17.3% (for those who start showing symptoms from March 1-10, 2020) to 0.7% (for those who start showing symptoms from January 1, 2020). Other measures are the case fatality rate (CFR), which describes the percentage of people diagnosed and die of the disease, and the infectious mortality rate (IFR), which describes the percentage of people diagnosed (diagnosed or undiagnosed) who die from the disease . . . .

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Istaatistiksiin kun yeroon kan daanga’uu miti akkasumas dhukkuba karaa murtoo dhukkubsataa irraa ummata murtaa’an hordofa.
en-mt: These statistics are not time-limited and track disease through specific populations from patient decisions.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: Hayyoonni hedduun uummattoota murtaa’aniif lakkoofsota kunniin shallaguuf yaalaniiru.
en-mt: Many scholars have tried to calculate these numbers for specific populations.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: Yunivarsiitiin Oxford Wiirtuu Dawaa Ragaa Irratti Hundaa’e (University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine) hamma du’aa dhukkubichaan hubamuun geessise guutummaa weerara addunyaawaa sanaaf 0.1% fi 0.39% gidduu akka ta’u tilmaama.
en-mt: The University of Oxford's Center for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates the death rate from the disease to be between 0.1% and 0.39% for the entire global outbreak.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: Tilmaamni gubbaa kan hamma kanaa kan qorannaa irra keessoo jalqabaa COVID-19 Jarman keessatti, fi qo’annoo Istaatistiksii dhiibbaa qorannoo tilmaama CFR irrattii wajjiin wal fakkaataadha.
en-mt: The above estimates of this magnitude are similar to those of the first COVID-19 internal survey in Germany, and the Statistical Study of the Impact of Surveys on CFR Estimates.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: WHO’n weerarri addunyaawaa kun to’atamuu akka danda’u ibsa.
en-mt: The WHO says the global outbreak is controllable.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: Fiixee fi yeroon murteessaan weeraraa kan hin eeggamnee fi kallattiidhaan garaagarummaa qabaachuu mala.
en-mt: Peaks and critical periods of epidemics are unexpected and may vary in direction.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: Maciej Boni’n Yunivarisiitii Mootummaa Penn akka ibsetti, "Utuu hin mirkanaa’in hafe, jalqabbiiwwan dhukkubaa salphaatti daddarban addatti dheerina yeroo guddinaa booda yeroo jijjiirama xiqqoo qabu fi isa booda baattoowwan jiran yeroo dhumanitti gadi bu’uu jalqabu.
en-mt: Penn State University's Maciej Boni explained, "Remaining uncertain, easily transmitted disease initiations begin to decline specifically after the length of the growing season when there is little change and after which available carriers are exhausted."

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: Garuu kun yoom akka ta’uu danda’u ammatti tilmaamni hiika qabeessa kaa’uun hin danda’amu.
en-mt: But it's not yet possible to put a meaningful prediction as to when this might happen.

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: Gorsaan fayyaa olaanaan mootummaa Chaayinaa Zhong Nanshan biyyoonni hundi tarkaanfilee tatamsa’ina vaayirasichaa dhaaban irratti gorsa Dhabbata Fayyaa Addunyaa hordofuuf yoo qindaa’an “waxabajjii dhaabbachuu danda’a” jechuun akeekkachiisan.
en-mt: China's chief health adviser Zhong Nanshan warned that "October could stop" if all countries coordinated to follow the World Health Organization's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: Bitootessa 17, Aadam Kuuchariskiin mana barumsa qulqullinaa fi qoricha Landan akka himanitti SARS-CoV-2 “yoo xiqqaate waggaa tokko yookaan lamaaf marmaaruuf deema.”
en-mt: On February 17, Adam Kuchariski of the London School of Hygiene and Medicine told SARS-CoV-2 that it was “going to wrap up for at least a year or two.”

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: Akka qorannoo Kolleejjii Impeeriyaaliitti Neel Farguusan taasisaniitti, addaan fageenyi qaamaa fi tarkaanfileen biroo kan barbaachisaniif “hanga talaalliin hojiirra oolutti (ji’oota 18 yookaan achii ol)”.
en-mt: According to research by Neil Ferguson at Imperial College, physical distancing and other measures are required “until the vaccine is effective (18 months or more)”.

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: Wiiliyaam Iskaafiner’n Yuunivarsiitii Vaanderbiil kan ibsan “akka ni yaadutti vaayirasii koroonaa kana nan shakka – sababni isaas suuta daddarba – guutumatti ni dhabama” akkasumas “gara dhukkuba waqtiitti jijjiiramuu mala, kan bara hunda deddeebi’u”.
en-mt: William Scaffiner of Vanderbilt University explained that "I suspect the coronavirus is likely to spread – because it is slow to spread – it will disappear completely" and "it may turn into a seasonal disease, which recur every year.

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: Faalamni duubdeebii dheerachuu jijjjiiramaa fi hoomaa madiinummaa irratti hundaa’a.
en-mt: Feedback contamination depends on the length of the variable and the mosquito medium.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: Mallattooleen COVID-19 kan waliigalaa ta’uu danda’u akkasumas namoonni dhukkubaan qabaman mallattoo agarsiisuu dhabuu malu.
en-mt: The symptoms of COVID-19 can be general and people who are infected may not show any symptoms.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: Mallattooleen heddumminaan mullatan lamaan ho’iinsa qaamaa (88%) fi qufaa gogaa (68%) dha.
en-mt: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: Mallattooleen dhaabbii sasalphoon dadhabbii, hancufa baay’achuu (phlegm), miira fuunfachuu dhabuu, harganuu dadhabuu, dhukkubbii irree fi walitti galoo, madaa’uu kokkee, bowuu mataa, qorra, hoqqisuu, dhiiga tufuu, baasaa, yookaan bulaa’uu gogaa. Tilmaamaan namoota jaha keessaa tokko hammeenyaan akka dhukkubsatuu fi rakkinni hargansuu akka muudatu Dhaabbanni Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO) lafa kaa’e.
en-mt: Mild constipation symptoms include fatigue, phlegm, shortness of breath, shortness of breath, arm and neck pain, sore throat, headache, chills, coughing, spitting blood, rash, or skin rash. The World Health Organization (WHO) estimates that approximately one in six people becomes seriously ill and experiences respiratory problems.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: Giddu-galli Ittisaa fi Qorannoo Dhibee U.S. (CDC)’n mallattooleen hatattamaa harganuuf rakkachuu, dhukkubbiin ykn dhiibbaan laphee jabaachuu, diphina tasaa, dammaquuf rakkachuu, fi fuulli ykn hidhiin addaachuu faati jechuun tarreesseera; mallattooleen kunneen jiru taanaan hordoffiin meedikaalaa hatattamaa ni gorfama. Dhukkubichi kana caala guddachuun, niimooniyaa hamaa, dhiphachuu sirna hargansuu hamaa, ciniinnaa, naasuu ciniinaa fi du’aa hordofsiisuu danda’a.
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, pain or palpitations, sudden depression, difficulty waking up, and whitening of the face or nose; immediate medical follow-up is recommended if these symptoms are present. The disease can progress further, leading to severe pneumonia, severe respiratory distress, bites, biting shock and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.

en-mt: A few infected people may not show symptoms, clinical signs but test results confirm infection, so those in direct contact with confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and tested to control infection, researchers say.

Akka fakkeenya haala hin beekamneetti, tilmaami firaakshinii namoota COVID-19 waliinii kan miira fuunfachuu isaanii dhaban jalqabatti 30% isa booda 15% tti gadi bu’e.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: Dhukkubichi sadarkaa jalqabaatti tuttuqqii walitti dhiyeenyaatiin fi copha xixiqoo wayita qufaa, haxxissoo fi haasaatiin akka daddarbu amanama; tuttuqqiin walitti dhiyeenyaa meetira 1 hanga 2 (faana 3 hanga 6).
en-mt: The disease is believed to be transmitted in the early stages by close contact and small droplets during coughing, sneezing and speech; intimate contact 1 to 2 meters (3 to 6 fans).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: Qufa’uun hin haguugamne copha meetira 4.5 (faana 15) hanga meetira 8.2 (faana 27) deemuu danda’u akka hordofsiisu qo’annoon argatee jira.
en-mt: Studies have found that uncovered coughing can lead to drops that can go from 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.

Cophni sirna hargansuu wayita harganutti, yemmuu dubbannu dabalatee uumamuu ni danda’a, ta’us vaayiresichi qilleensaan kan daddarbu miti.
en-mt: A few suggest that the virus is transmitted by tiny droplets that form when we speak, which can stay in the air for a long time. Respiratory droplets can occur during breathing, including when we speak, but the virus is not airborne.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: Coccobni kunniin afaan ykn funyaan namoota bira jiranii keessa bu’uu ykn somba isaaniillee seenuu ni danda’u.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Mootummaan Chaayinaa daddarbiinsa karaa sagaraa fi afaanii SAR-CoV-2 haaleera. Vaayiresichi mallattoon mullachuu jalqabee guyyoota sadii keessatti daddarbiini isaa guddaadha, ta’us tatamsa’inni isaa mallattooleen duraa fi sadarkaalee boodaa dhukkubichaarrattis jiraachuu mala.
en-mt: The Chinese government has denied fecal and oral transmission of SAR-CoV-2. The virus is most transmissible within three days of the onset of symptoms, but its spread may also occur in the pre-symptoms and later stages of the disease.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Namoonni mallattoon osoo irratti hin mul’atin guyyaa sadi dura qaratamanii poozatiivii ta’an osoo mallattoo muldhisuu hin eegalin daddabarsuu akka danda’an akeekama.
en-mt: It is suggested that people who test positive three days before showing symptoms can transmit it before they start showing symptoms.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: Gabaasota laaboraatorii xiqqoo qofaatu dhimmooti mallattoo malee jiraachuu mirkaneessan, garuu daddarbiinsi mallattoo malee biyyoota muraasaan yeroo qorannoowwan quunnamtii faana dhahuu adda baafaman.
en-mt: Only a small number of laboratory reports have confirmed the presence of asymptomatic cases, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by a few countries during contact fan tests.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.

en-mt: While the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) is not entirely clear on how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three cancers. The virus will live in the fields for hours to days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.

en-mt: Specifically, the virus can be found on plastic (polypropylene) for up to three days, stainless steel 304 for one day, and copper for up to four hours.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Bineeldonni vaayiresicha namootatti akka dabarsan ragaan hin jiru, ta’us aanga’oonni Biriitish akkuma dirroota biroo namoonni hubaman tuquu malan tuqneen boodaa, bineeldota erga tuqneen booda harka ofii akka dhiqannu gorsu.
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals transmit the virus to humans, but British authorities advise that we wash our hands after touching animals, as we do in other areas where infected people may touch.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Vaayirasiin koroonaa mallattoo sirna hargansuu hamaa 2 (SARS-CoV-2) vaayirasii novel dha, jalqaba kan argame namoota sadii kanneen niimooniyaan qabamanii fi garee dhukkubsataa sirna hargansuu olaanaa Wuhaan wajjiiin walqunnamtii qaban irraati.
en-mt: Severe respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, originally detected in three cases of pneumonia who were in contact with an upper respiratory patient group in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Amaloonni vaayirasii SARS-CoV-2 haaraan vaayirasii koroonaa isatti dhihaatan keessatti ni argamu. Qaama namaatiin alatti, vaayirasichi saamunaa manatti argamuun du’e, kan haguugduu isaa bulbulu. SARS-CoV-2 isa jalqabaa SARS-CoV wajjiin walitti dhihaata.
en-mt: New characteristics of SARS-CoV-2 are present in its closest relatives. Outside the human body, the virus was killed by household soap, whose coating dissolved. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Bu’uura zoonoozikii akka qabu yaadama.
en-mt: It is thought to have a zoonotic basis.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: Xiinxalli hidda sanyii, koronaavaayiresiin hiddaan kilaastera giinesii Beettaakoronaavaayiresii, sabgiinesii Saarbeekoovaayiresii (toora B) keessa, qacceewwan simbira halkaniirraa dhufan lamaan waliin akka ta’an mulliseera.
en-mt: Pedigree analysis revealed that the coronavirus is rooted in the Betacoronavirus genus cluster, subgenus Sarbecovirus (line B), with two nocturnal strains.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: Guutummaa jenoomii sadarkaa eddattoowwan vaayirasii koroonaa simbira halkanii ((BatCov RaTG13) kan biraa waliin inni 96% kan wal fakkaatu.
en-mt: It is 96% identical to another nightbird coronavirus ((BatCov RaTG13) that is 96% identical to the complete genome level.

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: Gurraandhala 2020, kutaa muraasa tartiiba jiinii vaayirasii paangoliinii fi kan dhala namaa gidduu garaagarummaa amiinoo aasidii tokko qoft akka jiru qorattoonni Chaayinaa argatan.
en-mt: In November 2020, Chinese researchers discovered that there was only one amino acid difference between parts of the gene sequence of the pangolin virus and that of humans.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: Walbira qabni jiinii-waliigalaa vaayirasii paangoliinii fi SARS-CoV-2 gidduu jiru %92 ta’ee argame, kunis paangoliiniin mandhee yeroo akka ta’e mirkaneessuuf ni hanqata.
en-mt: The gene-total comparison between pangolin virus and SARS-CoV-2 was found to be 92%, which falls short of confirming that pangolin is a temporary nest.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: Dhukkubni vaayirasii mallattoolee isaatiin qoratamuu danda’a, yoo mirkansi isaa suuraa kaasuu reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) infected secretions or CT’tiin ta’es.
en-mt: Viral disease can be diagnosed by symptoms, even if confirmation is by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) imaging of infected secretions or CT.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Qorannoon PCR fi CT walbira qabuu Wuhan’tti godhame akka ibsutti CT’n PCR caalaatti dafee deebii kenna, ta’us fakkiiwwan isaa hedduun michiiwwan sombaa fi adeemsota dhukkuboota biraa waliin walirra bu’uudhaan adda bahee mullachuudhaan isaa gadidha.
en-mt: A study comparing PCR and CT in Wuhan showed that CT responds more quickly than PCR, but many of its images are less distinct due to overlap with lung lesions and other disease processes.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: Tarsiimoowwan daddarbiinsa dhukkubichaa ittiin ittisan kaninni dabalatu guutummaa qulqullina dhuunfaa gaariitti eeggachuu, harka dhiqachuu, harka hin dhiqamneen ija, funyaanii fi afaan tuquu dhiisuu, fi herbeetti qufa’uu ykn haxxiffachuu fi herbichammoo kuusaa xuraa’awwanii keessa kallattiidhaan buusuu.
en-mt: Strategies to prevent transmission include maintaining good personal hygiene, washing hands, not touching eyes, lips and mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into the herb and dropping the herb directly into the sewage reservoir.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.

en-mt: Those who may be infected have been advised to wear medical masks in the community.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Tarkaanfiiwwan walirraa fageenya qaamaas daddarbuu ittisuuf ni gorfamu. Mootummoonni baay’een imala gara biyyootaafi iddoowwan jalqabbichaan miidhamanittiifi irraatti barbaachisaa hin taane hunda daangesseera yookaan gorseera.
en-mt: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission. Many governments have restricted or advised all unnecessary travel to and from countries and places affected by the initiative.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: Haa ta’u malee, kutaa addunyaa hedduutti vaayirasichi sadarkaa tatamsa’ina hawaasaa irra ga’ee jira.
en-mt: However, in many parts of the world, the virus has reached the stage of community spread.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: Kana jechuun vaayiresichi hawaasa keessa baballachaa kan jiruu fi miseensonni hawaasaa muraasni immoo akkamittii fi eessaa akka hubaman hin beekan. Dhiyeessitoonni kunuunsa fayyaa nama hubamuu hin oolleef kunuunsa taasisan of eeggannoowwan gulantaa, of eeggannoo tuttuqqii fi eeggannoo ijaa akka fayyadaman ni gorfamu. Faana dha’iinsi tuttuqqii madda dhibechaa akka baranii fi faffaca’iinsa kana caalu ittisuuf abbootii taayitaa fayyaatiif mala bu’a qabeessadha.
en-mt: This means that the virus is spreading in the community and few community members do not know how and where they are infected. Health care providers caring for a potentially infected person are advised to use standard precautions, contact precautions and eye protection. Contact tracing is an effective way for health authorities to identify the source of the disease and prevent further spread.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.

en-mt: Many mobile phone users are voluntarily implemented or envisioned and as of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen teams of experts were working on solutions that go with personal information such as using Bluetooth to provide travel information to other mobile users.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Harka dhiqachuun tatamsa’ina dhukkubichaa ittisuuf ni gorfama.
en-mt: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC’n namoonni akka harkoota irra deddeebi’anii saamunaafi bishaaniin yoo xinnaate sekondiiwwan digdamaaf dhiqatan gorsa, keessattuu erga mana fincaanii deemanii booda yookaan yommuu harkoonni mul’inaan xurii ta’anitti; utuu hin nyaatin dura; fi funyaan ofii qulleessuun, qufa’uun fi haxxiffachuun booda.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the bathroom or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and clearing one's lips, after coughing and sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Kun sababa qaama namaatiin alatti, vaayirasichi saamunaa manatti argamuun du’a, haguugduu isaa mancaasa.
en-mt: This is because in addition to the human body, the virus dies with household soap, destroying its covering.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: CDC’n caalaatti sanitaayizarii harkaa alkoolii of-keessaa qabu qabiyyee alkoolii yoo xinnaate 60% waliin yeroo saamunaafi bishaanni bilisaan hin argamnetti fayyadamuu eereera.
en-mt: The CDC further recommends using alcohol-based hand sanitizer with an alcohol content of at least 60% when free soap and water are not available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: WHO’n harkoota hin dhiqamneen ija, funyaan yookaan afaan tuquu irraa of-qusachuu namoota gorsa.
en-mt: The WHO advises people to avoid touching their eyes, lips or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: Dirroonni makaawwan hedduudhaan qulqulleeffamuu ni danda’u (dirroota sibiilaatiif daqiiqaa tokkoof farra ilbiisotaaf saaxilamuun), 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine dabalatee.
en-mt: Fields can be cleaned with several mixtures (one minute exposure to insecticide for metal fields), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Furmaatawwan biroo, kanneen akka benzalkonium chloride fi chrohexidine gluconate, bu’a qabeessummaan isaanii xiqqaadha.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: Yoo ta’iin COVID iddoowwan tajaajilaa akka waajjiraa, oolmaa guyyaafaatti shakkame ykn argame, naannoowwan hundi akka waajjiraalee, kutaaleen dhiqannaa, bakkeewwan waliinii, meeshaalee elektirooniksii waliin fayyadamaman kanneen akka taableetii, tach iskriinsi, kiiboordii, riimoot kontiroolii fi maashinoonni ATM namoota dhukkubsataniin fayyadaman, farri ilbiisotaa akka itti biifamuu qabu CDC’n in gorsa.
en-mt: If COVID is suspected or detected in service areas such as offices, daily routines, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic devices such as tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls and ATM machines used by sick people, are anti the CDC recommends insecticide spraying.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: Dhaabbanni fayyaa kan gorsu namoonni yeroo qufa’an yookaan haxxifatan afaanii fi funyaan isaanii ciqileen yookaan sooftiin haguuguu qabu, akkasumas soofticha saffisaan gatuu qabu.
en-mt: The WHO recommends that people cover their mouths and lips with a tissue or soap when coughing or sneezing, and dispose of the soap immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Haguugduuwwan fuulaa kan yeroo baqaqsanii yaaluu namoota dhukkubaaf qabamaniif gorfama, haguugduu fuula kaawwachuun hamma isaa daangessuttii fi fageenya imalaa kan yeroo hafuura baafannu cophni bahu, haxxifachuu, fi qufa’uu ittisa.
en-mt: Surgical masks are recommended for people who are infected, and wearing a mask limits the size and distance of travel to prevent droplets from breathing, sneezing, and coughing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: WHO’n yoomiifi akkamitti golgaawwan akka faayidaarra oolan qajeelchawwan kenneera.
en-mt: WHO has provided guidelines on when and how to use veils.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: Akka Isteevan Giriifin’tti qorattoonni vaayirasii Yuunivarsiitii Liidsi, “maaskii fuulaa kaawwachuu hamma fuula isaanii tuttuquu namootaa ni hir’isa, kan yoo harka sirriitti hin qulqulleeffatin dhibeef nama saaxilu.” Akkasumas maaskiin namoota nama dhukkubsataan qabame kunuusuuf ni gorfama.
en-mt: According to Steven Griffin, virus researchers at the University of Leeds, "wearing a face mask reduces the amount of contact people have with their faces, which can lead to disease if you don't clean your hands properly. Masks are also recommended for people caring for an infected person.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: WHO’n namoota fayyaa ta’aniin golgaawwan uffachuu yoo isaan balaa olaanaa, kan akka warreen nama COVID-19 qabu kunuunsaa jiran qofaaf yaada kenna, isaan dabalataan golgaawwan uffachuun namooti fuula isaanii akka hin tuqneef gargaaruu maluu mirkaneessanis.
en-mt: The WHO only recommends wearing masks for healthy people if they are at high risk, such as those caring for someone with COVID-19, although they also confirmed that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their faces.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Biyyoonni hedduun miseensota uummataatiin fayyadamiinsa golgaawwan fuulaa jajjabeessuu jalqabaniiru.
en-mt: Many countries have begun to encourage the use of veils by members of the public.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: U.S. keessatti CDC’n haguugduu fuulaa huccuu irraa hojjatamu kan meedikaalaa kan hin taane gorsa. Chaayinaan addatti maaskii meedikaalaa kan miseensota fayyaa hawaasaatiin gatamu gorsiti, keessattii yeroo namoota biraa wajjiin ( meetira 1 (faana 3) yookaan Sanaa gadi) walitti dhuhaatan.
en-mt: In the US, the CDC recommends non-medical cloth masks. China specifically recommends medical masks that are disposed of by public health members, including when in close contact with others ( 1 meter (3 feet) or Less).

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: Hong Kong yommuu geejjiba hawaasaa fayyadaman ykn iddoowwan namni itti baay'atan turanitti haguuggiiwwan kutaa baqaqasanii hodhuu uffachuu akka qaban gorsiti.
en-mt: Hong Kong recommends wearing operating room masks when using public transport or in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: Qondaaltonni fayyaa Taayilaand namoonni haguuggii fuulaa uffatarraa manumatti akka hojjetatanii fi guyyuu akka miiccan jajjabeessaa jiru.
en-mt: Thai health officials are encouraging people to make cloth masks at home and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: Cheek Republikii fi Siloovaakiyaan haguuggii utuu hin godhataniin ykn afaanii fi funyaan ofii utuu hin saamsatiin alaa hawaasatti ba’uurra uggura keesseetti.
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia have banned people from going outside without wearing a mask or covering their mouths and lips.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Bitootessa 16, Veetnaam hundumtuu yeroo gara hawaasaa bahan ofii fi namoota biraas eeguuf maaskii fuulaa akka kaawaatan gaafatte.
en-mt: On February 16, Vietnam required all to wear face masks to protect themselves and others when going out into the community.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: Namoonni mankuusaa nyaataa seenaa kamuu haguugduu fuulaa akka fayyadaman mootummaan Awustaraaliyaa dirqama taatise.
en-mt: The Australian government has made it mandatory for people in any historical food warehouse to wear masks.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: Israa’el jiraattota hunda yeroo uummata gidduu ta’anitti akka isaan golgaawwan fuulaa uffatan gaafatte.
en-mt: Israel required all residents to wear face veils when in public.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: Taayiwaan walakkaa Bitootessaa irraa eegalee kan guyyaatti maaskiiwwan miiliyoona kudhan oomishtu, imaltoonni baaburaa fi baasii magaala gidduu maaskii fuulaa akka kaawwatan kan dirqamsiifte Ebla 1 irratti.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has produced ten million masks a day since mid-February, forced passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on April

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: Paanaamaan yeroo gara alaa bahamu haguugduun fuula akka uffatamu dirqama taasifte, kanneen haguugduu fuula bitachuu hin dandeenyeef haguugduu fuulaa manatti oomishamu gorsite.
en-mt: Panama made it mandatory to wear face masks when going out, recommending homemade masks for those who could not afford them.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Haguuggiin faalaa Jaappaan,Kooriyaa Kibbaa, maaleeshiyaa, fi Singaapoor keessattis ballinaan fayyadamamaniiru.
en-mt: Pollution masks have also been widely used in Japan,South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: Walirraa fageenyi hawaasummaa (dabalataan walirraa fageenya qaamaa jedhamee beekamu) gochaawwan to’annoo dhukkubaan hubamuu faffaca’insa dhukkubaa hir’isuuf yaadaman namoota gidduutti walitti dhufeenya dhiyoo hir’isuun hammata.
en-mt: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes disease control practices designed to reduce the spread of disease by reducing close contact between people.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Maloonni kan isaan hammatan; qofaatti baafamuu; dhorkaawwan imalaa; fi cufaatii manneen barnootaa, bakkeewwan hojii, isteediyeemotaa, tiyaaterootaa ykn giddu galawwan daldalaati.
en-mt: The methods include; being excluded alone; travel restrictions; and the closure of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters or shopping malls.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Namoonni dhuunfaa mana turuudhaan, imalarraa of qusachuudhaan, naannoowwan namoonni itti heddumman dhiisuudhaan, nagaa walgaafannaa tuttuqqii hin qabne fayyadammudhaan, fi qaamaan warreen biroorraa of fageessuudhaan, maloota gargar ba’iinsa hawasaaa hojiirra oolchuu ni danda’u.
en-mt: Individuals can implement social isolation methods by staying at home, refraining from travel, avoiding crowded areas, using non-contact greetings, and physically isolating themselves from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Amma mootummoonni hedduun naannoo weeraraan miidhametti addaan fageenya hawaasaa dirqamsiisaa yookaan gorsaa jiru.
en-mt: Many governments are now enforcing or recommending social distancing in affected areas.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: Hammamtaan olaanaa walitti qabamuu qaamota mootummaa US’n fi dhaabbilee fayyaan eeramu ariitiin namoota 250 irraa (yoo faffaca’insi COVID-19 beekame naannicha keessa hin jiru ta’e) gara namoota 50 tti hir’ateera, akkasumas booda gara namoota 10 tti.
