en-mt: The maximum number of gatherings referred to by US government officials and health agencies quickly decreased from 250 people (if there is no known spread of COVID-19 in the region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 22, 2020 Jarmaniin walitti qabama hawaasaa nama lamaan olii ni uggurte. Ga’eessonni dulloomanii fi warreen rakkoo fayyaa akka sukkaaraa, dhibee onnee, dhibee sirna hargansuu, dhiibbaa dhiigaa fi sirna madiinummaa dadhabaa qaban miidhaawwan dhukkubbii cimaa fi mallattooleef kan saaxilamanii fi iddoon weerara hawaasaatti hanga danda’ametti mana akka turan CDC’n gorseera. Gara dhuma Bitootessaa 2020 tti, kaayyoonsaa walitti dhufeenya hawaasumaa yaadaan ykn fageenyaan eegaa tuttuqqii qaamaa immoo hir’isuu ta’uu ibsuudhaaf, WHO fi qaamoleen fayyaa biroon termii “gargar fageenya hawaasaa” “gargar fageenya qaamaanii” tiin bakka buusuu eegalan.
en-mt: On February 22, 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people. Older adults and those with health problems such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, high blood pressure and weak immune systems are at increased risk of severe pain and symptoms and stay home as much as possible in community outbreaks, the CDC advised. Towards the end of February 2020, WHO and other health authorities began replacing the term “social distancing” with “physical distancing” to explain that its aim is to maintain social contact mentally or at a distance and reduce physical contact.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: Itti fayyadamni jecha “addaan fageenya hawaasaa” namoonni haalota tokko tokkorratti namoota biroo wajjiin akka walqunnamaniif osoo hin taane, guutumatti akka addaan fagaataniifi. Hoggantoonni tokko tokko yeroo weeraraa kanatti qajeelfama fayyaa saalqunnamtii dhiheessu.
en-mt: The use of the term “social distancing” does not mean that people interact with other people in certain situations, but that they stay away completely. Some leaders offer sexual health guidance during the epidemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Kunneenis kan dabalatan gorsawwan nama waliin jiraattu waliin, kan vaayiresiicha of keessaa hin qabne ykn mallattoo vaayiresichaa hin qabne waliin walquunnamtii saalaa gochuuti.
en-mt: These include recommendations for having sex with someone you live with who is not infected or has no symptoms.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: Manatti qofaatti of tursiisuun kaninni gorfamu warreen COVID-19 f qoratamanii fi warreen akka hubaman of shakkaniif dha.
en-mt: Staying at home only is recommended for those who have been tested for COVID-19 and those who suspect they will be infected.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: Dhaabbileen fayyaa qajeelfama bal’aa adda-of-baasuu isa sirrii irratti hojjatan. Mootummoonni hedduun guutuu hawaasaa naannoo faalame jiraatan adda of baasuu dirqamsiisan yookaan gorsan.
en-mt: Health institutions have developed comprehensive guidelines for proper isolation. Many governments have forced or advised isolation of entire communities living in contaminated areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: Qajeelfamni cimaan of-adda baasuu kanneen garee miidhaa olaanaa keessa jiraniif kennamee jira.
en-mt: Strict instructions for self-isolation are provided for those in the highest disadvantage group.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Warreen nama COVID-19’tiin qabameef saaxilamtanii fi biyya yookaan naannoo tattamsa’inni itti baay’atetti imaltan yeroo saaxila baatan irraa eegaltanii guyyoota 14f akka adda of baaftan gorfamtan.
en-mt: Those who have been exposed to an infected person and traveled to a country or region where the outbreak is high are advised to isolate themselves for 14 days from the time of exposure.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: Tarsiimoowwan jalqabbiin dhukkubichaa ittiin to’atamu baballina dhorkuu ykn uggura, akkasumas akkaataa ittisaati.
en-mt: Strategies to control the onset of the disease are prevention or restriction of spread, as well as prevention.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: Too’annaan kan eegale sadarkaa jalqabaa weerarichaa irratti akkasumas dhukkubichi ummata biraatti akka hin babaldhanne kanneen qabaman baruu fi adda baasuu fi tarkaanfiilee too’annaa dhibee kan biraa fi talaalli ifoomsuu.
en-mt: Control began in the early stages of the outbreak and to identify and identify those infected to prevent the spread of the disease to other populations and to announce other disease control measures and vaccines.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Yemmuu tatamsa’ina vaayiresichaa to’achuun dadhabamutti, tarkaanfileen gara gulantaa miidhaa hir’isuutti deema: tarkaanfileen tatamsa’ina harkisuu fi dhiibbaa inni hawaasaa fi sirna fayyaa irraan ga’u hiri’isuuf fudhatamaniiru.
en-mt: When the spread of the virus cannot be controlled, measures move to the harm reduction stage: measures are taken to delay the spread and reduce its impact on society and the health system.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Tarkaanfileen to’annoo baballinaa fi miidhaa hir’isuu yeroo walfakkaataatti fudhatamuu danda’u.
en-mt: Expansion control and damage reduction measures can be taken at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: Ittisni lakkoofsa wal hormaata salphaa lakkoofsa 1 gaditti hir’isuudhaan weerara booddeetti deebisuu tarkaanfii cimaa fudhachuu barbaada. Gosa ittisa weerarichaa keessaa tokko fiixee weerarichaa gadi hir’isuu yaaluudha. Boca diriirsuu jedhamee beekama.
en-mt: Prevention requires strong measures to delay the outbreak by reducing the number of simple breedings below One type of prevention is to try to reduce the peak of the attack. It is known as stretching the shape.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Kun balaa yaadda’uu tajaajiloota fayyaa hir’isa akkasumas talaalliiwwaniifi wal’aansonni akka dagaagfamaniif yeroo dabalataa dhiyeessa.
en-mt: This reduces the risk of health services worrying and offers more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Gidduu seensi faarmasiin alaa kan weeraricha hogganuu malu tarkaanfii ittisa dhuunfaa, kanneen akka qulqullina harkaa, haguugduu fuulaa kaawwachuu, fi adda of foo’uu of keessatti hammata; tarkaanfiiwwan hawaasaa kanneen akka manneen barnootaa cufuu fi walitti qabama ummataa haquu; hirmaannaa hawaasaa fudhatamaa fi hirmaannaa dhiibbaa akkasii keessaa jajjabeessuuf; akkasumas kunuunsa naannoo kanneen akka, qaama wantootaa qulqulleessuu. Gochi cimaan weeraricha too’achuuf yaadame Chaayinaatti kan fudhatame erga hammeenyi weerarichaa ifoomaa dhufeeti, kanneen akka guutuu magaalaa adda foo’uu fi ittisa imalaa kaa’uu.
en-mt: Outpatient pharmacy interventions that may lead to the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing masks, and face washing; community measures such as closing schools and canceling public gatherings; to encourage acceptable community engagement and participation within such impacts; and environmental care such as, cleaning the body of things. Strict measures to contain the outbreak have been taken in China since the severity of the outbreak became known, such as city-wide quarantine and travel restrictions.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Biyyoonni biroos tarkaanfilee tatamsa’ina vaayiresichaa daangessuuf yaadaman garagaaraa hojiirra oolchaniiru.
en-mt: Other countries have implemented various measures to limit the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: Kooriyaan Kibbaa sakattii waiigalaa fi iddoo tursiisaa naannawaa kan jalqabdee fi sosochii namoota hubamanii irratti sagalee waamichaa kenniteetti.
en-mt: South Korea has launched general searches and local quarantine facilities and issued a call on the movement of affected people.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: Singaapoor deeggarsa maallaqaa warreen hubaman kanneen qofaatti of-baasaniif dhiyeessiteetti akkasumas adabbii guddaa warreen akkas gochuu dhiisan irra keesseetti.
en-mt: Singapore has offered financial assistance to victims who self-destruct and has imposed heavy penalties on those who do not.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: Taayiwaan oomisha golgaa fuulaa dabalteetti akkasumas dhiyeessiiwwan wal’aansaa kuufaman adabdeetti. Fakkeessitoonni Biritaaniyaa Guddoo fi Yunaayitid Isteetsiif akkaataan ittisaa (gadi bu’uutti jira garuu faffaca’insa weerara iddoo murtaa’ee dhaabaa hin jiru) fi uggurri (guddina weerara iddoo murtaa’ee duubatti deebisuu) rakkoowwan guddaa akka qaban agarsiisan.
en-mt: Taiwan has increased the production of masks and penalized stockpiles of medical supplies. The simulations for Great Britain and the United States showed that the patterns of prevention (declining but not stopping the spread of spatial aggression) and deterrence (retarding the growth of spatial aggression) posed significant problems.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Imaammatoonni akkaataa ittisaa baay’ee mijaa’oo ta’an tarii fiixee fedhii kunuunsa fayyaa 2/3’n fi du’a immoo walakkaan hir’isuu danda’u, garuu ammayyuu du’ii fi yaadda’uun sirnoota fayyaa kumaatamaan lakkaa’aman keessatti mul’ata.
en-mt: The most appropriate preventive style policies might cut the peak of health care demand by 2/3's and deaths by half, but still thousands of deaths and worries for health systems appears in the.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: Uggurri filatamuu danda’a garuu hamma vaayirasichi uummata gidduutti tamsa’aa jirutti tursiifamuu qaba (yookaan hamma talaalliin argamutti, yoo sun jalqaba argame), akka daddarbaatti Kanaan ala yeroo tarkaanfiiwwan laafanitti ariitiin deebi’a.
en-mt: A ban can be elected but should be delayed until the virus is spreading among the population (or until a vaccine is available, if that is first available), as contagious Otherwise it will rapidly return when measures are slack.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Dhiibbaan yeroo-dheeraa weeraricha dhaabuuf godhamu miidhaa diinagdee fi hawaasummaa fida.
en-mt: Long-term pressure to stop the invasion causes economic and social damage.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Qorichi farra vaayiresii addatti COVID-19f mirkanaa’e hin jiru, garuu qorichoota jiran irratti yaalii gaggeessuu dabalatee hojjechuudhaaf tattaaffiin adeemsarra jira .
en-mt: There is no approved antiviral drug specifically for COVID-19, but efforts are underway to develop existing drugs, including trials.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: Qoricha qufaa lakkaa’a-dhaabu, dhugaatii dhangala’aa, fi boqachuun mallattoo laaffisuu danda’a.
en-mt: Count-stop cough medicine, fluid drinks, and rest can alleviate symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: Hammeenya, yaala oksijiinii, dhangala’oo veenii gidduu, fi hargansuu irratti hundaa’uun gargaarsi barbaachisuu mala.
en-mt: Depending on severity, oxygen therapy, intervenous fluids, and respiration, assistance may be required.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: Istirooyidii fayyadamuun bu’aawwan hammeessuu mala.
en-mt: Steroid use may worsen the effects.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Kompaawundootni dhukkuboota vaayirasiin dhufan biroo wallaanuuf mirkanaa’anii turan hedduun wallaansa COVID-19 f akka oolaniif qoratamaa jiru.
en-mt: Many compounds that have been approved to treat other viral diseases are being tested for the treatment of COVID-1

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: WHO’n “yaaliiwwan manaa fi aadaa” muraasni mallattoolee SARS-CoV-19n dhufan balleessuuf akka danda’anis ibseera.
en-mt: The WHO also said that a few “home and traditional remedies” can relieve the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: Dandeettii dabaluun fi kunuunsa fayyaa dhukkubsattoota COVID-19n barbaadamaniif oolchuun akka tarkaanfii deebii bu’uuraa weerarichaatti WHO’n kan ibsamedha.
en-mt: Increasing capacity and providing health care to patients in need of COVID-19 is described by the WHO as a basic response measure to the outbreak.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC fi Dhaabbanni Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO) Awurooppaa qajeelfama hospitaalonnii fi buufataaleen tajaajila fayyaa qabeenya sadarkaa garaagaraatti itti fayyadamuuf itti dhimmi bahan baase, xiyyeeffannoo tajaajila laabiraatoorii gara qorannoo COVID-19’tti akka naannessan, adeemsa filannoo yoo barbaachise haquu, maatii dhukkubsattoota COVID-19 adda baasuu, akkasumas namoota leenjisuunii fi lakkoofsa meeshaa hargansuu fi siree dabaluun humna yaala addaa dabaluu.
en-mt: The ECDC and the World Health Organization (WHO) Europe have issued guidelines for hospitals and healthcare facilities to use resources at various levels, shift the focus of laboratory services to COVID-19 testing, cancel the selection process if necessary, and separate families of COVID-19 patients evacuation, as well as training people and increasing the number of respirators and beds to increase the specialized medical force.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: dhukkubsataa jalqabaa (dhibamaa duwwaa jedhamu) jalqaba eessaa akka qindaa’e irratti yaadota garaagaraatu jira.
en-mt: there are various opinions on where the first patient (called the empty patient) was originally organized.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Dhukkubsataan jalqabaa vaayirasii koroonaa haaraa kan beekame Muddee 1,2019 Wuhaan, Hubei, Chaayinaatti.
en-mt: The first case of the new coronavirus was reported on December 1,2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Ji’a tokko gidduutti, lakkoofsi dhimmoota vaayirasii koroonaa Hubei keessaa suuta suutaan dabale.
en-mt: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Kunneen irra jireessaan “Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market”, kan bineeldota lubbuun jiran gurguruun kan walqabatee, fi yaadrimeen tokko immoo vaayiresichi gosoota bineeldotaa kanneen keessaa tokkoorraa dhufe kan jedhudha; ykn, ykn jecha biraan, achii as dhuftisaa bineeldota irraati. Kilaasterro niimooniyaa sababnisaa hin beekamne Muddee gaafa 26 kan mullatee fi Hospitaala Godina Hubei keessatti dookter Zhang Jixian’n kan Muddee gaafa 27 Wuhan Jianghan CDC beeksiseen kan yaalamedha.
en-mt: These are mostly the “Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market”, which sells live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these species; or, or in other words, it comes from animals. Cluster pneumonia of unknown cause appeared on December 26 and was treated at Hubei Provincial Hospital by Dr. Zhang Jixian on December 27, according to the Wuhan Jianghan CDC.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Muddee gaafa 30, gareen dookterootaa ‘Wuhan Central Hospital’ “waayee koronaavaayiresii SARS fakkaatuu” namoota waliin hojjetan akeekkachiisanii turan.
en-mt: On December 30, a team of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital warned colleagues “about a SARS-like virus”.

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Dookteroota kanneen keessaa saddeet, Li Wenliang dabalatee odeefannoo sobaa faffacaasuudhaan poolisii dhaan kan doorsifamanii fi kan biraan Ai Fen immoo dammaksituu kaasuu isheetiif hoggantoota isheetiin yakkamteetti.
en-mt: Eight of the doctors, including Li Wenliang, were threatened by police for spreading false information, and another, Ai Fen, was accused by her superiors of raising the alarm.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: Muddee 31 irratti Koomishiiniin Fayyaa Magaala Wuhaan akeekkachiisa hawaasaa baase akkasumas Dhaabbata Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO)’s beeksise.
en-mt: On December 31, the Wuhan City Health Commission issued a public warning and notified the World Health Organization (WHO).

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Dhukkubsattoonni niimooniyaa hin beekamnee hedduun abbootii taayitaa Wuhaaniif gabaafaman qorannoo jalqaba Amajjiitti ta’u eegaluuf. Yeroo sadarkaa jalqabaa weerarichaa, lakkoofsi dhukkubsattootaa tilmaamaan guyyaa torbaa fi walakkaatti dachaan dabala.
en-mt: Several cases of unknown pneumonia have been reported to Wuhan authorities to launch an investigation in early March. During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubles approximately every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Jalqabaa fi walakkaa Amajjii 2020’tti, vaayirasichi gara kutaalee Chaayinaa kanneen biraatti tatamsa’e, godaansa bara haaraa Chaayinaatiin kan deeggarame fi Wuhaan giddugala geejjibaa fi wal jijjiiraa baaburaa taate.
en-mt: In early and mid-March 2020, the virus spread to other parts of China, supported by Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan became a transportation and rail hub.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Amajjii 20 tti, guyyaa tokkotti Chaayinaan dhimmoota haaraa 140 ta’an gabaasteetti, namoota lama Beejing keessaafi tokko Shenzeen keessaa dabalatee.
en-mt: As of March 20, China reported 140 new cases in a single day, including two in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Deetaan seera qabeessa gara boodaa Amajjii 20, 2020 tti namoonni 6,174 dursanii mallattoo agarsiisuu jalqabuu isaanii agarsiisa. Akka Bitootessa 26 tti, Yunaayitid Isteets akka addunyaatti Chaayinaa fi Xaaliyaan irraa lakkoofsa dhimmoota mirkanaa’anii olaanaa fudhatteetti. Akka Ebla 9, 2020 tti, dhimmooti miiliyoona 1.61 olta’an akka addunyaatti gabaafamaniiru; namoonni 97,000 ol du’aniiru 364,000 ol immoo bayyaannataniiru.
en-mt: Retrospective valid data shows that as of March 20, 2020, 6,174 people have already started showing symptoms. As of February 26, the United States has received the highest number of confirmed cases from China and Italy worldwide. As of April 9, 2020, there are more than 1.61 million cases reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Biyyoonnii fi daangaawwan 200 itti dhihaatan yoo xiqqaate dhukkubsataa tokko ni qabaatu.
en-mt: Close to 200 countries and territories will have at least one patient.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Sababa weerara addunyaa Europe’n, biyyoonni Naannoo Schengen hedduun sochii bilisaa kan dhorkanii fi to’annoowwan daangaa jalqabaniiru.
en-mt: Because of Europe's global invasion, many Schengen Area countries have banned free movement and introduced border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Deebiiwwan gochaa biyyoolessaa tarkaanfiiwwan to’annoo kanneen akka qofaatti of-baasuu (ajajoota mana-turaa jedhamuun beekaman, ajajoota hamma qajeelfamni dabalataa kennamutti iddoo jiran turuu, yookaan uggura) fi yeroowwan namoonni mana isaaniitii ba’anii deemuu hin dandeenye hammateera. Akka Ebla 2 tti, namoota miiliyoona 300 jechuun hamma danda’amuun, yookaan 90% uummatichaa, Yunaayitid Isteets keessatti uggura gosa ta’ee jala jiru, namoonni miiliyoona 50 ol ta’an Filippiins keessatti uggura keessa jiru, namoonni miiliyoona 59 ta’an Kibba Afriikaa keessatti uggura keessa jiru, fi namoonni biiliyoona 1.3 Hindiitti uggura keessa jiru.
en-mt: National action responses have included control measures such as curfews (known as stay-at-home orders, stay-in-place orders until further instructions, or bans) and periods when people cannot leave their homes. As of April 2, almost 300 million people, or 90% of the population, are under tribal restrictions in the United States, more than 50 million people are under restrictions in the Philippines, and 59 million people in the South They are under blockades in Africa, and 1.3 billion people are under blockades in India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 26, addunyaarraa namoonni biiliyoona 1.7 ta’an cufiinsa wayii kan guyyoota lama booda biiliyoona 2.6 tti gudda jala turaniiru — naannoo tokko sadaffaa ummata addunyaa kan ta’anidha.
en-mt: On February 26, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some kind of lockdown that rose to 2.6 billion two days later — around a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Dhukkubsataan jalqabaa COVID-19 jalqaba kan argame muddee 1, 2019 Wuhaanitti; akka gabaasni hin mirkanaa’in hin mirkanaa’in tokkootti dhukkubsataan jalqabaa booda Sadaasa 17’tti akka ta’e akeeka.
en-mt: The first case of COVID-19 was first reported on December 1, 2019 in Wuhan; according to one unconfirmed unconfirmed report the first patient was after March 17th.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Doctor Zhang Jixian garee dhimmoota michii sombaa sababni isaanii hin beekamne Mudde 26 tti ilaalaniiru, kan irratti hospitaalli ishee Wuhaan Jianghan CDC Mudde 27 tti beeksise.
en-mt: Dr. Zhang Jixian saw a group of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause on Dec. 26, of which her Wuhan Jianghan hospital notified the CDC on Dec.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Qorannoon sanyii jalqabaa eddattoowwan dhukkubsataa Mudde 27, 2019 tti argamuu vaayirasii koroonaa SARS-fakkaatu agarsiise.
en-mt: The first seed test of the patient's samples on December 27, 2019 showed the presence of the SARS-like coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Yaadachiisi uummataa Komishinii Fayyaa Mana Qopheessaa Wuhaaniin Mudde 31 tti gadhiifame.
en-mt: A public reminder was issued by the Wuhan Provincial Health Commission on December

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: WHO’nis guyyaama walfakkaataatti ture kan odeeffannoo argate.
en-mt: WHO received the information on the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Akkuma yaadachiifne kunneen ta’aniin, dooktaroonni Wuhan waayee weerarichaa “odeeffannoo baballisuu” dhaan poolisootaan akeekkachiifamniiru.
en-mt: As we recalled, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for “spreading information” about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Koomishiniin Fayyaa Biyyoolessaa Chaayinootaa jalqabatti "ragaa ifaan" daddarbiinsa namaa-gara-namaa akka hin jirre dubbataniiru.
en-mt: The Chinese National Health Commission initially said there was "no clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Xumura Amajjiitti, mootummaan Chaayinaa duula cimaa kan booda barreessaan olaanaan Paartii Kommunistii Shii Jiinpiingi “waraana ummataa” jedhaniin tatamsa’ina vaayirasichaa ittisuuf labse.
en-mt: In late March, the Chinese government launched a massive campaign that Communist Party Secretary-General Xi Jinping later called a "people's war" to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: “Seenaa addunyaa irratti iddoo kunuunsa addaa guddaa” jedhamee kan ibsame, sararri ittisaa saaniteer imala keessaa fi alaa Wuhaan dhaabuuf Amajjii 23 labsame, akkasumas magaalota Hubei keessa jiran 15tti babaldhate, waliigalaan namoota miiliyoona 57 bira gaha.
en-mt: Described as “the largest quarantine facility in the history of the world”, the sanitary line to stop travel in and out of Wuhan was announced on March 23, and extended to 15 cities in Hubei, reaching a total of 57 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: Fayyadamni konkolaattota dhuunfaa magaalaa keessatti uggurameera.
en-mt: The use of private vehicles is banned in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: Ayyaaneffannaan Waggaa Haaraa warra Chaayinaa (Amajjii 25) iddoowwan baay’eetti haqameera.
en-mt: Chinese New Year celebrations (March 25) have been canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: Abbootiin taayitaa ijaarsa hospitaalaa yeroo, Hospitaala Hooshenshaan, kan guyyaa 10 keessatti xumurame ifoomsan.
en-mt: Authorities announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Hoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Hospitaalli kanbiraan ‘Leishenshan Hospital’, qabiinsa dhukkubsattoota dabalataaf ijaaramee ture.
en-mt: Another hospital, the Leishenshan Hospital, was built to accommodate additional patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Hospitaalota haaraa ijaaramanitti dabalataan, Chaayinaan Wuhan keessaa bakkeewwan tajaajilaa biroo 14 kanneen akka, giddu galawwan walga’ii fi isteediyeemotaa gara hospitaala yerootti jijjiirteetti. Amajjii gaafa 26, imaltootaaf labsiiwwan fayyaa kennuu fi Festivaala ayyaana Birraa dheeressuu dabalatee, weerara COVID-19 to’achuuf tarkaanfiiwwan biroo fudhateera.
en-mt: In addition to the newly built hospitals, China has converted 14 other services in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals. On March 26, it took other measures to contain the outbreak, including issuing health notices to travelers and extending the Spring Festival.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Yuuniversiitileen fi manneen barnootaa biyyattiis cufamanii turan.
en-mt: Universities and schools in the country were also closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: Naannoleen akka Hong Kong fi Macau keessattuu manneen barnootaa fi yuuniversiitiilee waliin walqabatee tarkaanfiilee hedduu fudhataniiru.
en-mt: Regions such as Hong Kong and Macau have taken several steps, especially in relation to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Naannolee Chaayinaa hedduu keessatti fageenyarraa hojjechuun jalqabee ture.
en-mt: Telecommuting had begun in many regions of China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Dhorkaaleen imalaa Hubei keessaa fi alatti tumamanii turan.
en-mt: Travel restrictions were enacted in and out of Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: Geejjibni ummataa fooyya’e, akkasumas muuziyeemiiwwan guutuu Chaayinaatti argaman yeroodhaaf cufaman.
en-mt: Public transport improved, and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: To’annaan sosochii ummataa magaalota hedduu keesatti fudhatamee kan turee fi tilmaamaan namoonni miiliyoona 760tti siqan (walakkaa ummata biyyattiitii ol) dhorkaaleen mana alaa muraasni mudateera. Erga weerarichi Bitootessa keessa kan addunyaa ta’eetii, aanga’oonni Chaayinaa tarkaanfilee jajjaboo vaayiresicha biyyoota biroorraa akka hin galle ittisuuf fudhataniiru.
en-mt: Curfews were imposed in many cities and an estimated 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some outdoor restrictions. Since the outbreak became global in February, Chinese authorities have taken bold measures to prevent the virus from entering other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Fakkeenyaaf, Beejiingi imaltoota addunyaa magaala seenan hundaaf dirqama turtii guyyoota 14 dirqama goote. Bitootessaa 23 irratti, giddugala Chaayinaatti guyyaa shan keessatti akka biyyaatti nama tokko qofatti darbe, haala kana keessatti imalaa Istaanbul Irraa gara Guwaanzuu deebu’een ture.
en-mt: Beijing, for example, has imposed a 14-day stay requirement on all international travelers entering the city. On February 23, it passed to only one person nationwide in five days in central China, in which case I was traveling back from Istanbul to Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: Bitootessa 24,2020, tatamsa’inni dhukkubaa kan biyya keessaa akka ugguramee fi weerarichi Chaayinaa keessatti akka too’atame Piriimiyer Li Keqiyang gabaase.
en-mt: On February 24,2020, Premier Li Keqiang reported that the domestic outbreak had been contained and the outbreak had been contained in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Guyyuma walfakkaataatti dhorkaaleen imalaa, qaama Wuhan kan taate Hubei keessatti uggura ji’oota lamaan booda laaffatanii turan. Ministeerri Dhimmoota Alaa Chaayinaa seensi viisaani ykn eyyeme jireenyaa warra qabanii Bitootessa 28 irraa kaasee akka dhaabbatu, imaammanni kun yoom akka dhumu ibsa dabalataa malee, gaafa Bitootessa 26, 2020 beeksiseera.
en-mt: On the same day, travel restrictions were relaxed in Hubei, part of Wuhan, after a two-month ban. The Chinese Foreign Ministry announced on February 26, 2020 that entry of visa or residence permit holders will be suspended from February 28, without further details on when the policy will expire.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Warreen Chaayinaa seenuu barbaadan imbaasiiwwan yookaan qoontsilaawwan Chaayinaatii viisaa fudhachuu qabu.
en-mt: Those who wish to enter China must obtain a visa from Chinese embassies or consulates.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Mootummaan Chaayinaa daldalootaa fi warshaalee Bitootessa 30 deebi’anii akka banaman jajjabeessaniiru, akkasumas dhaabbileef qarqaabaalee durgoo maallaqaa kennaniiru. Manni Maree Mootummaa dho’iinsa COVID-19 haaraa ittisuuf maatiiwwan fageenya hawaasaa eeggachuuf akka ta’utti kabaja isaa toora internaataan akka mullisan haa gaafatuyyuu malee, Manni maree biyyattii Bitootessa 4, 10:00 kan Festivaala Qingming waliin walirra bu’utti yeroo callisaa biyyaalessaa kan daqiiqaa-sadii labseera.
en-mt: The Chinese government has encouraged businesses and factories to reopen on February 30, and has provided financial incentives to companies. Although the State Council has asked families to express their respect online to maintain social distance to prevent a new outbreak of COVID-19, the State Council will declare a national silence period on February 4, 10:00 which coincides with the Qingming Festival declared three-minutes.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: COVID-19 gaafa Amajjii 20, 2020 Chaayinaarraa gara Kooriyaa Kibbaatti akka faca’e ni mirkanaa’e.
en-mt: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread from China to South Korea on March 20,

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: Ejensiin fayyaa lammii daballii olaanaa dhukkubsattootaa Gurraandhala 20 gabaase, baldhinaan tuuta guddaa Deeguu warraaqsa amantii haaraa Mana Amantaa Shiinchoonjii Iyyasuus’tti tatamsa’e.
en-mt: The Citizen's Health Agency reported a high increase in cases on November 20, widespread by a large crowd of new religious religious followers at the Shinchonji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Hordoftoonni Shincheonji Wuhaan iddoo jalqaba shakkamaan weerarichaa itti argame irraa Daegu daawwatan
en-mt: Shincheonji followers visited Daegu from Wuhan, where the outbreak suspect was first found

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Hanga Gurraandhala 22 tti, hordoftoota mana sagadaa 9,336 keessaa, 1,261 yookaan 13% ta’an mallattoolee gabaasaniiru. Kooriyaan Kibbaa dammaqiinsa sadarkaa olaanaa Gurraandhala 23 2020tti labsiteetti.
en-mt: As of November 22, of the 9,336 chapel attendees, 1,261, or 13%, reported symptoms. South Korea declared a high-level alert on January 23,

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Gurraadhala 28 irratti, Kooriyaatti dhukkubsattoota mirkanaa’an 2,000 oltu gabaafame, Gurraadhala 29 gara 3,150’tti ol guddate.
en-mt: On November 28, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on November

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Iddoon ka’umsaa loltoota Kooriyaa Kibbaa erga loltoonni sadii vaayiresichaaf poosetiiva ta’anii booda adda baafamee ture.
en-mt: The origin of the South Korean troops was identified after three soldiers tested positive for the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: Sagantaaleen daandiiwwan qilleensaas miidhamanii kan turanii fi kanaafuu jijjiramanii turan. Kooriyaan Kibbaa akka addunyaatti sagantaa guddaa fi sirnaan qindaa’e uummata hundaaf qorannoo vaayiresii gaggeessuun fi namoota hubaman adda baasuu akkasumas warreen isaan waliin tuttuqqii qaban faana dhahuu fi qofaa tursiisuu jalqabdee turte.
en-mt: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore changed. South Korea had launched the world's largest and most systematic program of screening for the virus and identifying infected people as well as beating and isolating those in contact with them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Maloonni sakattii kan dabalatu namoonni haaraan addunyaarra dhufanii mallattoo qaban karaalee appilikeeshinii moobayilaatiin dirqamaan of gabaasuu, wayita imalarra jiranitti vaayiresichaaf qoratamuun bu’aan guyyaa itti aanutti ba’uu fi dandeettii qorannoo dabaluun guyyootti haga namoota 20,000 akka qoratamuu danda’an gochuu faadha.
en-mt: Screening methods include mandatory self-reporting of symptomatic newcomers through mobile applications, testing for the virus while traveling with results released the next day and increasing testing capacity to test up to 20,000 people a day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Guutuu magaalaa addatti foo’uu dhabaatanis sagantaan Kooriyaa Kibbaa weerara too’achuu irratti milkaa’aa akka ta’etti fudhatame. Hawaasni Kooriyaa Kibbaa jalqabarra deebii balaa Pirezidaantiin Muun Jee’in kennan faallessaa turan.
en-mt: Although they did not clear the entire city, the South Korean program was considered successful in controlling the invasion. South Korean society initially opposed President Moon Jae-in's disastrous response.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Kooriyaanonni hedduun Moon weeraricha sirnaan hin qabne, jechuun himannaaf waamicha gochuudhaan ykn deebiisaaf galateeffachuu irratti mallattoo walitti qabaniiru.
en-mt: Many Koreans collected signatures on Moon not handling the attack properly, either by calling for a complaint or thanking him in return.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Bitootessa 23, Kooriyaan Kibbaa torban afur keessatti dhukkubsataa guyyaa-tokkoo gadi aanaa akka qabdu gabaafame.
en-mt: On February 23, South Korea reported the lowest number of daily cases in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 29, Eebla 1 irraa kaasee imaltoonni alaa torbeewwan lamaaf iddoo tursiisaa kan turan ta’uun gabaafamee ture.
en-mt: On February 29, it was reported that foreign travelers had been detained for two weeks since April

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Akka gabaasa miidiyaa Ebla 1’tti, Kooriyaan Kibbaa gaaffii gargaarsa qorannaa vaayirasii biyyoota garaagaraa 121 irraa keessummeessite.
en-mt: According to media reports on April 1, South Korea has received requests for assistance in virus testing from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Iraan dhukkubsataa SARS-CoV-2 jalqabaa Qom’tti adda barame Gurraandhala 19 beeksifte, kan, akkaataa Ministeera Fayyaa fi Barnoota Fayyaatti booda namoonni lama du’an.
en-mt: Iran announced the first SARS-CoV-2 case identified in Qom on November 19, after which, according to the Ministry of Health and Health Education, two people died.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Tarkaanfiiwwan jalqabaa mootummaan beeksifaman haqamuu qophiilee sirbaa fi taateewwan aadaa kan biroo, taateewwan ispoortii, akkasumas kadhannaawwan Jimaataa, akkasumas cufamuu yunivarsiitiiwwaniifi manneen barnootaa hammate.
en-mt: The initial measures announced by the government encompassed the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, as well as Friday prayers, as well as the closure of universities and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: Iraan vaayirasicha qolachuuf riyaala tiriiliyoona shan ramadde.
en-mt: Iran has allocated five trillion riyals to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Pirezidaant Hassan Roohaaniin Guraandhala gaafa 26, 2020, iddoowwan weerarichaan hubaman qofaatti baasuuf karoorri akka hin turree fi namootani dhufni qofti akka qofaatti baafaman dubbatan.
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on January 26, 2020, that there were no plans to evacuate only to affected areas and that only arrivals would be evacuated.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Karoorri imala magaalota gidduu daangessuu kan ifoome Bitootessa keessa, yoo imalli guddaan magaalotaa bara haaraa Peershiyaa Noowruuz kan itti fufe ta’es.
en-mt: Plans to restrict intercity travel were announced in February, although the main urban travel of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Bakki waaqeffannaa Shia, Qom keessa jiru hanga Bitootessa 16, 2020 tti imaltoota alaaf banaa ta’ee tureera. Guraandhala keessa Iraan Chaayinaatti irraa fudhachuun giddu gala baballinaa vaayiresichaa taateetti.
en-mt: The Shia place of worship, in Qom, remained open to foreign travelers until February 16, In November, Iran took over from China and became the epicenter of the virus.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Iraan keessatti weeraricha too’achuu keessatti, Gurraandhala 28’tti biyyoonni kudhanii ol dhukkubsattoota isaanii gara Iraanitti deebisan, kun kan agarsiisu hammi weerarichaa dhukkubsattoota 388 kanneen guyyaa sana mootummaa Iraaniin gabaafaman caala hammaachuu mala.
en-mt: In containing the outbreak in Iran, more than a dozen countries returned their patients to Iran on November 28, suggesting the scale of the outbreak may be worse than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government that day.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: Paarlaamaan warra Iraan cufameera, miseensota 290 isaa keessaa 23 vaayirasichaaf gaafa Bitootessa 3 tti positiivii ta’uun isaanii gabaafamuu waliin.
en-mt: Iran's parliament has been closed, with 23 of its 290 members testing positive for the virus on February

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 12, ‘Human Rights Watch’ haalduree tokko malee falmattoota mirga namoomaa mormii naga qabeessaaf hidhaman akka gadlakkisuu fi hidhamtoota jiran hunda yeroof akka gadlakkisuu qabu yaaada dhiyeesseera.
en-mt: On February 12, Human Rights Watch recommended the unconditional release of human rights activists arrested for peaceful protests and the temporary release of all existing detainees.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: Vaayirasichi dhaabbilee dhiheenya jiran kanneen akka, buufata ugguraa, kan yaala fayyaa gahaa hin qabne ni babal’atu sodaan jedhu akka jiru himee jira.
en-mt: He said there are fears that the virus will spread to nearby facilities such as quarantine facilities that lack adequate medical treatment.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 15, mootummaan Iraan erga weerarichaatii biyyattii keessatti isa olaanaa ta’e du’aatiilee 100 gabaaste.
en-mt: On February 15, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths, the highest in the country since the outbreak.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: Dhukkuba Bitootessa 17’tiin namoonni teessoo qaban yookaan namoonni siyaasaa Iraan yoo xiqqaate 12 ta’anii fi hoggantoonni mootummaa du’anii jiru.
en-mt: At least 12 Iranian politicians and government officials have died of the February 17 outbreak.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: Bitootessa 23, Iraan sababa vaayirasii koroonaatiif sa’aatii sa’aatiin dhukkubsattoota 50 fi daqiiqa kudhan kudhaniin du’a tokko keessummeessaa turte.
en-mt: On February 23, Iran was hosting 50 cases every hour and one death every ten minutes due to the coronavirus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: Akka hoggantoota Dhaabbata Fayyaa Addunyaa (WHO)’tti, dhukkubsattoonni Iraan keessa jiran kan jedhamee ol dachaa shan caaluu mala.
en-mt: According to World Health Organization (WHO) officials, the number of patients in Iran may be five times higher than estimated.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Qoqqobbiin U.S. Iraan irra keesse humna diinagdeen biyyattii weerara vaayirasichaa ittisuuf qabdu miidhaa jiraachuu akka malu gorfame.
en-mt: US sanctions against Iran may be hurting the country's economic ability to fight the outbreak, it has been warned.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: UN tti Komishinarri Olaanaa Mirgoota Namoomaa uggurri diinagdee biyyoota baay’ee weerara addunyaawaan hubamaniif akka salphatuuf gaafatan, Iraan dabalatee.
en-mt: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has called for easing economic sanctions against many countries affected by the global attack, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: Jalqabbichi Amajjii 31 tti Xaaliyaanitti faffaca’uun isaa mirkanaa’e, yeroo tuuristoonni Chaayinaa lama Roomaa keessatti SARS-CoV-2’f positiivii ta’anitti.
en-mt: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on March 31, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Dhimmooti hamma olaanaan dabaluu jalqabaniiru, kan mootummaa warra Xaaliyaan akka inni barrisuu xiyyaarotaa hunda Chaayinaattii fi irraa yeroof dhaabu akkasumas labsii yeroo hatattamaa labsuuf kakaase.
en-mt: Cases have begun to escalate, prompting the Italian government to temporarily suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Qoodinsi dhukkubsataa COVID-19 kan walitti dhufeenya hin qabne booda adda bahe, dhukkubsattoota 16 Gurraandhala 21 Loombaardiitti mirkanaa’an irraa eegaluun. Gurraandhala 22’tti Manni Maree Ministeerotaa weerara ittisuuf seera ifoomse, bulchiinsota garaagaraa 11 Kaaba Xaaliyaanitti argaman keessaa namoota 50,000 ol adda foo’uu dabalatee.
en-mt: The unrelated COVID-19 patient division was later identified, starting with 16 patients confirmed on 21 November in Lombardy. On November 22, the Council of Ministers announced laws to prevent the outbreak, including the quarantine of more than 50,000 people in 11 different provinces in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: Muummeen Ministeeraa Juuseeppee Koonteen, “naannoolee weerarichaatti seensaa fi bahiinsi hin dhihaatu, jedhan.
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, “There will be no entry and exit to the affected areas.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Naannolee kanneenitti yeroof tursiifamuun dalagaalee hojii fi ta’iilee ispoortii durayyuu ajajameera. “ Bitootessa 4, mootummaan Xaaliyaanii akkuma duuti Xaaliyaanii keessaa 100 ga’een cufaatii manneen barnootaa fi yuuniversiitiilee guutummaa biyyattii keessa jiraniif ajaja kenne.
en-mt: Temporary detention in these areas has been ordered even before work and sporting events. “ On February 4, the Italian government ordered the closure of schools and universities across the country as soon as the death toll reached

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Taateewwan ispoortii hangafoonni hundi, tapha kubbaa miilaa Serie A dabalatee, kan hanga Eblaatti cufaadhaan gaggeeffamuuf ture, garuu Bitootessa 9’tti, ispoortiin hundi yoo xiqqaate ji’a tokkoof dhaabbate.
en-mt: All major sporting events, including Serie A football, were scheduled to be closed until April, but on February 9, all sport was suspended for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: Bitootessa 11 tti, Muummichi Ministeeraa Koonteen sochii daldalaa hunda jedhamuun hamma danda’amuun madabbira guddaa shaqaxi keessatti gurguramuufi faarmaasiiwwan osoo hin dabalatin hojii yeroodhaaf addaan kutuu ajajeera. Bitootessa 6 tti, Koolleejjiin Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation fi Intensive Care (SIAARTI) Warra Xaaliyaan, yaadota naamusa wal’aansaa.
en-mt: On February 11, Prime Minister Conte ordered a temporary suspension of almost all business activities in Shaqaxi, including pharmacies. On February 6, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI), the concepts of medical ethics.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 19, weerarichaan du’aatii 3,405 erga gabaasteen booda addunyaarraa biyya du’aatiin koronaavaayiresiinii keessatti guddaa ta’e Chaayinaarraa fudhachuun taateetti.
en-mt: On February 19, it took over from China as the world's deadliest country after reporting 3,405 deaths from the outbreak.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Bitootessa 22, Raashiyaan meeshaalee fayyaa Xayyaarota lolaa sagal gara Xaaliyaanitti akka ergite gabaafame.
en-mt: On February 22, Russia reportedly sent nine fighter jets of medical supplies to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: Akka Ebla 5’tti, Xaaliyaaniitti dhukkubsattoota 128,948, du’a 15,887, fi kanneen fayyan 21,815 tu ture, kanneen keessaa hedduun naannoo Loombaardiitti argamu.
en-mt: As of April 5, Italy had 128,948 cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries, many of them in the Lombardy region.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Gabaasi CNN walmakiinsi uummata maanguddoo guddaa Xaaliyaaniifi yeroodhaan namoota hunda vaayirasicha qaban qorachuu dadhabuun hamma dhukkubichaan du’uu olaanaadhaaf gumaachuu akka danda’u agarsiise.
en-mt: A CNN report showed that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and the failure to test all people infected with the virus in time could contribute to the high death rate.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: Deebiin Yuunaayitid Kingdom vaayiresichaaf kenne jalqaba akka biyyoota miidhamanii dhiphinarraa walaba turan keessaa tokko ta’eetti mullatee kan turee fi hanga Bitootessa 18, 2020 tti, mootummaan Biritish gargar fageenya hawaasa bifa kamiiyyuu ykn qufaa tursiisuu namoota hedduu lammiilee isaarra hin keenye ture.
en-mt: The United Kingdom's response to the virus initially appeared to be one of the most stress-free affected countries and as of February 18, 2020, the British government had not imposed any form of social distancing or mass coughing on its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Sababa kanaan, hanqina to’annoo mullatee fi cimina deebii rakkoolee hawaasa mudataniirratti komii irrate ka’e fudhateera. Bitootessa gaafa 16, Muummichi Ministeeraa Boris Johnson imalawwan barbaachisoo hin taane, fi tuttuqqii hawaasaa irratti namoonni yoo danda’amee manaa akka hojjetanii fi bakkeewwan wali ga’ii kanneen akka iddoowwan walitti qabama hawaasaa, restooraantii fi tiyaateroota akka dhiisan gan gorsu ibsa baasanii turan.
en-mt: As a result, he accepted complaints about the lack of control and the strength of response to community problems. On February 16, Prime Minister Boris Johnson issued a statement advising people to stay home if possible and avoid public places such as public gatherings, restaurants and theaters on unnecessary travel and public contact.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Bitootessaa 20, wantoota nama haaromsan kanneen akka manneen dhugaatii fi jiimii hamma danda’ameen akka cufaman mootummaan ifoomse, akkasumas hojii dhabdummaa yeroo qaala’iinsaa hambisuuf hanga hojjattoota %80’tiif hanga daangaa yuuroo 2,500tti kaffaltii ji’aa raawwachuuf waadaa gale. Bitootessa 23, Muummeen Ministeeraa tarkanfii addaan fageenya hawaasaa, gurmuu namoota lamaa olii dhoorkuu fi imalaa fi sochii manaan alaa daangessu murteessaadha jedhamanii amanaman cimaa labsan.
en-mt: On February 20, the government announced that refreshment facilities such as bars and gyms would be closed as much as possible, and promised to pay monthly payments of up to 80% of workers up to a limit of 2,500 euros to prevent unemployment during inflation. On February 23, the Prime Minister announced strict measures believed to be crucial, such as social distancing, a ban on groups of more than two people and restrictions on travel and movement outside the home.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Tarkaanfii duraa kan hin fakkaanne, qoqqobbiiwwan kunneen karaa dhimma nagaa fi gurmuu bittinsuutiin poolisiidhaan hojiirra oola.
en-mt: Unlike preliminary measures, these sanctions are enforced by the police through peace and dispersal issues.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: Daldalawwan harki caalaan akka cufamaniif ajajamaniiru, daldalawwan "barbaachisoo" jedhaman utuu hin dabalatin, madabbira guddaa shaqaxi keessatti gurguramu, faarmaasiiwwan, baankota, suuqiiwwan haardiweerii, bufatoota boba’aa, fi gaaraajiiwwan dabalatee.
en-mt: Most businesses have been ordered to close, excluding "essential" businesses, including pharmacies, banks, hardware stores, gas stations, and garages.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: Amajjii gaafa 20, ta’iin COVID-19 jalqabaa Bulchiinsa Kaaba-Lixa Washington Paasifik keessatti namicha Wuhan irraa Amajjii gaafa 15 deebi’e irratti argamee ture.
en-mt: On March 20, the first case of COVID-19 in the Northwest Washington Pacific State was detected in a man who returned from Wuhan on March

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: Humni Ittisa vaayirasii koroonaa Waayit Haawos Amajjii 29 hundaa’e.
en-mt: The White House Coronavirus Prevention Task Force was established on March

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: Amajjii gaafa 31, bulchiinsi Trump labsii yeroo hatattamaa fayyaa hawaasaa kan labsee fi seensa imaltoota Chaayinaa irraa dhufanii irratti dhorkaa kaa’eera.
en-mt: On March 31, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency and imposed a ban on the entry of travelers from China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: Amajjii 28, 2020 tti, Wiirtuun To’annoo Dhukkubaa dhaabbata fayyaa uummataa mootummaa U.S. dursaa ta’e — isaan meeshaa qorannoo mataa isaanii akka dagaagsan beeksise.
en-mt: On March 28, 2020, the Centers for Disease Control became the leading US government public health agency — announcing that they would develop their own testing tool.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Kana hojjachuun alatti, Yuunaayitid Isteet jalqabbii qorannoo rincicaa qabaataa turte, kun yeroo sanitti dhugummaa weerarichaa hale ture.
en-mt: In addition to doing this, the United States would have initiated a rincica investigation, which at the time undermined the authenticity of the attack.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: Hanga dhuma Guraandhalaatti meeshaalee qorannoo kan miti-mootummaaf (Dhaabbilee barnootaan, kaampaanotaan fi hospitaalotaan) hanqina mirkaneessaa mootummaa federaalaa , fi hanga jalqaba Bitootessaatti ulaagaalee danqoo namoonni qoratamuuf akka hin geenye taasisan (yeroo sanaa kaasee ajajni dookteraa barbaachiseera) tiin, qorannoon meeshaalee qorannoo ga’oomoo hin taane mootummaa federaalaatiin qophaa’een akkaan miidhamee ture .
en-mt: Until late January for non-governmental test kits (by educational institutions, companies and hospitals) due to lack of federal approval , and until early February due to barrier requirements that prevent people from getting tested (since then a doctor's order has been required). was severely affected by the federal government

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: Guraandhala gaafa 27, ‘Washington Post’ qorannoowwan 4,000 gadi ta’an Yuunaayitid Isteetsi keessatti godhamuu isaanii gabaasee ture.
en-mt: On November 27, the Washington Post reported that fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 13, qorannoolee 14,000 gad akka raawwate ‘The Atlantic’ gabaaseera.
en-mt: On February 13, it conducted fewer than 14,000 tests, The Atlantic reported.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Bitootessa 22 tti, ‘Associated Press’ kan gabaaase: “Namoonni hedduun mallattoolee qabanii fi ajajni dookteraa qorannoodhaaf sa'aatiiwwaniif ykn guyyootaaf eeganiiru.” Yuunaayitid Isteetsi keessatti erga duuti jalqabaa bulchiinsa Washington keessatti gaafa Guraandhala 29 gabaafamee booda, Bulchaa Jay Inslee’n, gocha bulchiinsota biroonis hordofame, labsii yeroo hatattamaa labsani.
en-mt: On February 22, the Associated Press reported: "Many people have symptoms and have waited hours or days for a doctor's order for testing. In the United States, after the first death was reported in Washington state on November 29, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, followed by other states.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 3 manneen barnootaa naannoo Seattle dareen kan haqanii fi walakkeessa Bitootessaatti, guutummaa biyyattiitti manneen barnootaa cufamaa turan. Gaafa Bitootessa 6 2020, Yuunaayitid Isteetsi tilmaama miidhaa koronaavaayiresiin haaraan kun biyyattii irraan ga’urratti garee ipidimiyooloojistootaatiin ‘Imperial College of London’ keessatti gorsamaniiru.
en-mt: On February 3, Seattle-area schools canceled classes and by mid-February, schools were closing across the country. On February 6, 2020, the United States was advised by a team of epidemiologists at the Imperial College of London on the estimated impact of the new coronavirus on the country.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: Guyyaa wal fakkaataatti Pirezidaantiin Tiraampi qophaa’ummaa fi ramaddii dhiheessa deebii vaayirasii koroonaa doolaara biiliyoona 8.3 baajata muddamaa dhaabbileen federaalaa weeraricha akka ittiin ittisaniif Ramadan mallatteessan.
en-mt: On the same day, President Trump signed Ramadan into the preparation and allocation of $8.3 billion in emergency budgets for federal agencies to fight the outbreak.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: Korporeeshinoonni dhorkaalee imalaa hojjettootaa kaa’aniiru, konfiraansota kan haqanii fi hojjettoonni manaa akka hojjetan jajjabeessaniiru.
en-mt: Corporations have imposed travel restrictions on employees, canceled conferences and encouraged employees to work from home.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Ta’iileen ispoortii fi waqtiileen haqamaniiru. Bitootessa gaafa 11, Bitootessa 13 kaasee guyyoota 30maaf kan hojiirra oolu dhorkaa imalaa Yuunaayitid Kingidom irraan kan hafe biyyoota Awurrooppaa gara caalaan irra kaa’uu Trump dubbataniiru.
en-mt: Sporting events and times have been cancelled. On February 11, Trump said he would impose a 30-day travel ban on most European countries except the United Kingdom.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: Guyyaa itti aanu, ittisni gara Yuunaayitid Kiingidamii fi Ayerlaandi akka hammatu babal’ise.
en-mt: The next day, he extended the defense to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 13, labsii yeroo hatattamaa biyyaalessaa labse, kunimmoo fandiileen federaalaa rakkooleef deebii kennuuf akka argaman taasiseera.
en-mt: On February 13, he declared a national emergency, making federal funds available to respond to the crisis.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Bitootessa 15 irraa jalqabee, tatamsa’ina vaayiresichaa hir’isuuf guutummaa U.S. keessatti daldalli hedduun kan cufaman ykn yeroo hojii hir’isaniiru.
en-mt: Since February 15, many businesses across the US have closed or reduced working hours to reduce the spread of the virus.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: Bitootessa 17 tti, weerarri iddoo murta’ee sun isteetota 50’n hunda keessaafi Aanaa Kolumbiyaa keessatti mirkanaa’eera. Bitootessa 23 tti, Magaalaan Niiw York dhimmoota vaayirasii koroonaa 10,700 akka qabdutu gabaafame, guutummaa lakkoofsa dhimmoota Kooriyaa Kibbaa keessa jiruun ol kan ta’e.
en-mt: As of February 17, the targeted outbreak had been confirmed in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. As of February 23, New York City reported 10,700 cases, more than the entire number of cases in South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: Bitootessa gaafa 25, Bulchaaan akkuma dachaan dabaluun ta’ii guyyoota 2.0 irraa gara guyyoota 4.7 tti hir’atee booda gargar fageenyi hawaasa waan hojjetaa jiru fakkaata jedhan.
en-mt: On February 25, the governor said the social distancing seemed to be working after the incident doubled from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: Akka Bitootessa 28’tti, Magaala Niwuu Yoorkitti namoota 32,308 dhukkubsatanii, fi 672 sababa vaayirasichaattiin du’antu ture. Bitootessa 26, Yuunaayitid Isteet Chaayinaa fi Xaaliyaan dabalatee biyya addunyaa kamuu caala dhukkubsataa vaayirasii koroonaa qabaachuu gabaaste. Akka Ebla 8’tti Yuunaayitid Isteetitti dhukkubsattoota 400,335’tu galmaa’e, akkasumas namoota 12,841’tu du’e.
en-mt: As of February 28, there were 32,308 cases in New York City, and 672 deaths from the virus. On February 26, the United States reported more coronavirus cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy. As of April 8, there were 400,335 registered cases in the United States, and 12,841 deaths.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Akka gabaasa miidiyaa Bitootessa 30tti, Pirezidaantiin U.S. Tiraampi qajeelfama adda fageenya hawaasaa hanga Ebla 30 turu murteessan.
en-mt: According to media reports on February 30, US President Trump has decided to extend the social distancing guidelines until April

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: Guyyuma walfakkaataatt, ‘USNS Comfort’ dooniin hospitaalaa siree 1000 qabu, Niw Yoork keessatti ni hundeeffame.
en-mt: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a 1,000-bed hospital ship, was established in New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Ebla 3 tti, U.S. sababa vaayirasii koroonaatiin dheerina yeroo sa’atii-24 gidduutti rikordii du’aa 884 qabdi turte.
en-mt: As of April 3, the US had a record 884 deaths from the virus in the 24-hour period.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: Ebla 3 kutaa Newuu yoorki keessatti baay’inni dhukkubsattootaa 100,000 caale. Waayit Haawus miidhaa salphisee ilaaluunii fi ergaa hoggantoota fayyaa kallattii too’achuun akkasumas saayintistoota dhimma ummata qindeessanii fi maxxansoota vaayirasicha wajjiin walqabatan waajjira Itti Aanaa Pirezidaantii Maayik Peensi irratti komatame.
en-mt: On April 3, the number of cases in New York State exceeded 100,0 The White House has been accused of downplaying the damage and controlling the direction of health officials' messages, as well as public affairs scientists and publications related to the virus in Vice President Mike Pence's office.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Mirkaneessi guutummaa to’annoo balaa Traamp sararawwan deeggaraa irratti bakka lamatti citeera.
